Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a view to die for!”
Reviews.Author: MrsNewlywedd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Orivliged room. These rooms are newly remodeled and if your standing on the patio they have a view of the arc. It was amazing.( I do believe they have direct view rooms as well). I do wish they had chairs on the patio... But they may have been a bit to narrow for that. The hotel location is great. Your right in the middle of it all - it is quite busy everywhere you go. (but thats Paris) The staff at the Splendid Etoille was super friendly. The rooms themselves were very big for Paris standards. Plenty of room. Even with all the luggage and clutter that comes with a 5 night stay. The rooms even have a small sitting area which we used often for our daily ritual of ordering coffee for 2 from room service. Highly reccomended! The bathrooms are anazing! My fsvorite! All completely updated and sparkling clean! Definately take a bath if your their in the colder months like we were :). The only thing I have to say that's remotely negative is that the beds were not as soft and plush as I would have liked... Or am accustomed to from nicer hotels in the States. I will say though, we visited 3 different locations in Europe for our honeymoon - all nicer hotels - and this was consistant across the board... Could just be a difference in culture? Either way, i would highly reccomend this hotel. You can walk to do many if the sites and your right next to the hop-on hop-off bus stop and the river cruises. The Eiffel tower is not that bad of a walk either if your up to it ... 20 minutes tops. If you stay here, be sure to visit drugstore republics right on the Champs. Honestly, it's the coolest store. One night we got amazing food from there...the grocery, wine and dessert sections and brought it back to the room for a carpet picnic. Highly reccomended. Loved it all!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: We had the best time here. The breakfast was amazing every morning. The staff were very friendly and all spoke English. It's central to everything. The suite we stayed in was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: spike .
Reviews.Content: Located just 200 meters from the Arc de Triomphe and 10 meters from the metro.. this is perhaps on of the best situated 4**** hotels in Paris, staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast is fairly decent ...

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle A
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris and couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Ken and the rest of the staff were very pleasant, welcoming, and warm. We had two rooms in the 4th floor (403 and 404) and the view to the Eiffel Tower was amazing. The hotel is a block away from the metro and there are many restaurants around. No questions asked, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay - homely atmosphere in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aoifesh1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one-night stay in the Hotel Splendid Etoile. We arrived late on Sunday evening and were met by a pleasant receptionist. The hotel itself is beautifully restored and has a lovely, relaxed atmosphere. We had a room on the first floor, room 109 - for ourselves and our 4 year old daughter. We walked in to a room with 2 beds and a flatscreen TV - then to the right, you could walk through a doorway to a room with another TV, a bed for our daughter, wardrobe and then leading into a beautiful modern bathroom. The room itself was comfortable and very tastefully decorated.. We had breakfast included in our rate and it was very pleasant, a continental buffet, also with hot ratatouille, scrambled eggs, bacon... My only gripe was that the hotel's restaurant and bar were closed during the stay, which I wasn't aware of.. albeit they should be open again in a few days. The hotel's location is incredible, just a couple of hundred foot from the L'Arc de Triomphe and a short stroll to the Champs Elysees... I will be returning to this hotel, without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Natalia L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with perfect central location. Clean and spacious room and helpful staff. Great views from the room's balcony of the arc de triomphe. Beautiful decoration with all mod cons. Quick and easy access to Paris Metro and excellent local restaurants. Would recommend for any stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went for our second trip and to ring in the new year in Paris, this time we wanted to stay in a location that was more in the center of all the action and beauty. we would recommend the Hotel Splendid Etoile to anyone, the staff especially the chief concierge Farooq where so amazing, Farooq was there to help us in anything we could have possibly needed. Every detail of the hotel is amazing from the breath taking view of the arch de triumph, Champs de elysee, and Eiffel tower to the delicious chocolate truffles that are served at the hotel checking. We can't wait to go back to Paris and when we do we will defiantly being staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cathie M
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect for our Paris vacation. The scenery was perfect - the balcony from our room had a fabulous view of L'Arc de Triomphe and I was told most rooms at the hotel have a similar view. Staff was very attentive and had fabulous recommendations for restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. The hotel is a very short walk to Avenue des Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es; for fun take the tunnel beneath Place de l'Ã‰toile. It is a perfect location for a Paris tourist. The RER station is in front of the hotel, the Metro station is directly across the street and the Air France bus stops on the other corner. This saved us quite a bit of money as we were able to take the Metro everywhere; a carnet de billets is only about 12 Euro and the Air France bus was the most economical way to get from the airport. This made the slightly higher cost of the hotel well worth it! Beds were very comfortable and there was a decent size table with a few comfortable chairs in the the room as well. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: yasminr
Reviews.Content: I booked the Splendid Etoile for a business trip as recommended by a colleague. The rooms were very spacious and had a lovely view of the Arc de Triomphe. I did however have twin beds put together even though I booked a double which was a bit annoying. Good size bathroom, would have been good to have got some slippers as it was a little cold to walk on the tiling barefoot! Breakfast was nice with different pastries on each day, staff were friendly and there was a lift to the station right outside!

Reviews.Title: “good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: soceanu
Reviews.Content: can't beat the location-just 50 meters from Arc de Triomphe the new rooms with the view to Arc de Triomphe are the best around the corner a few good restaurants service was good location was excellent for the Air France Coach and also all the major tourist attractions all together a very nice 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed”
Reviews.Author: An_ordinary_tourist
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location, rooms and bathrooms really grea,t very clean and beautifully decorated, service was good, public areas quite compact but didn't have cause to use them. Walls a bit thin between rooms could hear next door banging and clattering occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mohd666
Reviews.Content: very good hotel and place of the hotel was excellent because you can use metro, taxi and even by walk.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at the Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay for a romantic weekend in Paris. The location was excellent for the Air France Coach and also all the major tourist attractions. We couldn't fault the hotel. It was warm and welcoming with pleasant friendly staff. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were relaxed and truly delicious. We will definitely return soon and have no hesitation in recommending it. Sue and Mike

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: Deb L
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at 9:30am and check in was at 2:00, the hotel staff allowed our party to check in at 9:30am without an additional charge. The location is perfect the Air France bus stop and metro are across the street. Rooms are clean and service was wonderful! Concierge staff especially Chef Concierge Musani was par excellent, no problem communicating everyone speaks English fluently! One small issue I gained a few pounds eating the free chocolate truffles kept in a basket at the front desk. I am planning another trip to Paris in the spring and plan to stay with Splendid Etoile...I would not think of looking for another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kazmi1986
Reviews.Content: the room was small but very clean! the hallway smelled like pait or somthing but other than that the hotel was great. location was great too very easily accesible to the main attractions and the staff was VERY helpful!! they explained all the transportation systems to us and told us where to eat and stuff so it was great!!! and getting a ride from the airport from the airfrance bus made it very easy I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every regard!”
Reviews.Author: AdSchu
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel! Despite being small, it offered everything one would want and its location right next to the Arc de Triomphe is just fantastic. Initial check-in was a pleasant affair where we were greeted at the main entrance and ushered into the nicely decorated lobby. Mere minutes after we got into our room, our luggage was brought in. The front desk staff are very efficient and attentive. Our room was glorious... So clean, nicely decorated, and well-appointed! The decor is very pleasant and well-coordinated. Being warm-natured, it was nice to be able to open the window to allow the cooler air in. My only non-positive comment is that he bed was a bit firm for our tastes. The bathroom, while small, was flawless in its appearance and cleanliness. All facilities were in perfect working order. The hotel's breakfast is excellent with an expansive variety of food and drink offerings makes for a great start to a day of walking and sightseeing. The breakfast room, which apparently becomes a restaurant in the evening, was quite pleasing with darker colors and contemporary decor. The staff there were attentive and diligent at making sure guests were happy. Our stay at Splendid Etoile really added to our first Paris experience. There is no doubt that we will stay here when we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love about this hotel and city?”
Reviews.Author: zws284
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for a romantic New Year's Eve getaway, and we couldn't have been more pleased. The magic of this hotel really begins with the staff, who were incredibly patient and helpful. We arrived at 8:30am after an overnight flight hoping for a check-in by noon, and had a room prepared for us by the time we had a coffee and pastry down the street - I've never had that happen on my travels around the world. We stayed in a Prestige level room - which was well worth the upgrade. Recommendations for restaurants and activities were spot on with what we were looking for. The room was sizable by Paris standards, and had an incredible view of the Arc de Triomphe (we stayed in the corner room, #407). Aside from the view, the hotel was a splendid launch point for trips to the Champs Elysees, to local markets, and to the train. This hotel will forever hold special memories for us - I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Abby090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in December and had a wonderful time. Paris is amazing, topped off by staying in this fantastic hotel, perfectly located for all top attractions. We walked to most places. Our room was clean and cosy, with very comfy beds, excellent attention to detail and an amazing view of the Arc de Triumph! Breakfast was nice with a good selection. Staff were helpful but not intrusive and spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “It's Paris”
Reviews.Author: sachmogoat
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location: 1st hotel off Arc de Triumph, M1 across the street, in the heart of Paris. Great for walking to business or metro to most of central Paris in minutes. Beautiful European hotel. Friendly staff. Low key atmosphere. Breakfast was included and was the standard well done buffet. I had a first floor small room, facing an inside alley, requested an upper floor and they graciously accommodated. The room was large, with a sitting area with room to breath. For the price (it was pricey), it earned it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OH10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfection! We stayed on the 6th floor and views were amazing! The staff is so lovely and especially Faruc at the front desk. This place has all the french charm of a smaller hotel, and the design is fresh and very clean. Tres chic!! And did I mention the view....spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IliasK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Splendid Etoile, for 4 nights in a superior room with Arc de Triumph view (107). Room was very nice, very clean, with beautiful view in Arc de Triumph. The decoration was great and the bed/pillows very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent management of our luggage too. Free of charge, we left them in the morning took them in the evening. We had a ticket with number and they kept them in safe place. The location of the hotel is definitely its biggest plus. In wonderful area, Champs Elysees in 200 meter, Metro, bicycles, taxi and bus straight to the airport just across the street. If i tried to find some minus maybe that it would be the value for money, but thats the case in Paris, rooms are expensive and the most of them without breakfast. Generally I recommend this hotel, and i will visit it again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: pauljoanssss
Reviews.Content: Positives - We had a room on floor 5 at the hotel front. It was really splendid with 2 sets traditional full height opening french type doors and outside a narrow balcony running along full length of room. From the balcony a good view of Arc de Triomphe. (The doors were of a double design and completely eliminated all traffic noise once shut.) Room was very well furnished, curtains, bedding etc 1st class and bathroom fittings all top of the range and spotless. Hotel concierge and all staff always very helpful. Metro within 50 yards. Negatives - no social feel to hotel, little public area, bar always empty, restaurant down narrow corridor. By my standards very expensive, we booked thro Expedia for a "romantic break" which included room upgrade plus bottle of champagne, cost Â£500 for 2 nights room only. Breakfast another â‚¬25 per head. No tea making facility in room, â‚¬6 for tea/coffee room service (but it came beautifully presented with biscuits). BUT I suspect all these negatives are very typical for Paris center hotels so if you intend to spend this money I would certainly recommend this hotel. Couple of tips, breakfast in cafe around the back corner (not opposite) was about â‚¬10 (recommended by concierge). Do not underestimate time require visit the Arc de Triomphe, queues can be very long any time of day. Each night at 6:30 there is a small ceremony around the flame of the unknown solder, this is easy and free to view.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Splendid Etoile!”
Reviews.Author: minervam
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Paris with two lifelong friends and we could not have asked for a better experience. The Hotel Splendid Etoile was very convenient to the Metro, RER and was a short walk to the Champs Elysees. Every night we relaxed with a glass of champagne out on our balcony that overlooked the Arc de Triomphe and we were just swept away by the beauty of the City of Lights. The staff was friendly and helpful, our rooms were spotless, and breakfast was excellent. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelerLI
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. Convenient to transportation and great view of the Arc d'Triumphe from our balcony. Staff (Concierge) were very helpful in making reservations for dinner, giving directions or answering any of our questions about Paris. All spoke English well. Room was a nice size and very clean. Bathroom was exceptionally nice. A four star rating by the French authorities was on the mark.

Reviews.Title: “As the name says...It's Splendid.....”
Reviews.Author: Jumpstitch
Reviews.Content: Our stay for four days at this lovely property was really a surprise package. A fine location at the Arc and easy access to the Champs Elysess gave us a perfect opportunity to experience French architecture as well as culture thru their wide boulevards. The hotel was comfortable and our room was spacious with a large bathroom which was perfect for our family of four. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful especially Mr. Farooq at the concierge. The breakfast buffet was generous with all kinds of cheese cereals cold cuts, breads eggs, fruits etc etc.... name it , it was there.... Infact, the hotel took care of all our needs, including booking the Lido show for us at the nth hour. Right outside the hotel was the RER subway station which was a bonus All kinds of travel tours moved outside our hotel including the Air France Airport bus which stopped at our doorstep. Great location with loads of restaurants, bars and cafes. Spoilt for choice. To sum it all, we had a memorable stay and will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in excellent location. Staff were very friendly and helpful too. We stayed with our teenage daughter and great for her to have her own sleeping area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: AngiePang
Reviews.Content: My Husband & i stayed at this "Splendid" hotel for two nights as a stopover before catching a Mediterranean Cruise in Venice and we were absolutely delighted to find how warm and welcoming all the staff were. We arrived early morning from a very long flight from Australia so we were extremely tired and very worse for wear. Our room was not quite ready but as soon as we checked in we were offered complimentary coffees and snacks in the lobby which was very much appreciated! Within 15 minutes our beautifully appointed corner room with full view of L'Arc de Triomphe was ready for us. The view was breathtaking! The room was very clean and spacious and most importantly, the bed was extremely comfortable! The location of this hotel can't be beat - just across from L'Arc and Champs Elysse where we caught the hop-on-hop-off red buses - we used the 2 day tickets the whole time we were in Paris - fantastic!! All in all, we have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this wonderful gem of a hotel with their amazing staff to all tripadvisor readers and we will definitely be returning to 'Splendid Etoile' on our next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: magsTyneWearJarrow
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in october 2011 it is fab hotel room great did not have veiw but our daughters did in another fab room great veiw hotel staff very nice breakfast anything you would want hot and cold the hotel was spotlist would defintly be back if coming from cdg airport use the air france bus it stops out side the hotel just across the road another great bonus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ardaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Splendid Etoile Hotel on July 2010 for one week. It was a regular room for two people. Before making a reservation for Splendid, I looked into and read reviews of 100+ hotels in Paris - and all of them had tiny rooms, barely larger than the bed (which is tiny as well :) However, the room I stayed in Splendid Etoile was reasonably large. The sleeping room itself was smaller than average European rooms, but there were lots of other space inside the room where you could put your baggage or other things. The bathroom was also spacious with a full sized bath. I cannot comment on the food of the hotel, because I have not had any. The most important and best aspect of this hotel was its location. It is 20-30 meters from Arc de Triomphe, which means it is also that much close to the beginning of the Champs Elysee street. This trip was my first one in 12 years to Paris, and I did not remember the city at all, so while selecting the hotel I was concentrated on selecting one with a good location. After spending 7 nights, I am happy I chose this hotel. The Metro station is right in front of the hotel. Also, the Air France buses that go to the airport also leave on the street across from the Hotel. You can use these buses to go to the airport even if you are not an Air France passenger. It is reasonable priced (I dont remember the price, however it was maybe 1/5th of a taxi ride). Overall, Splendid Etoile is an excellent hotel to stay in Paris, if you are looking for a good location and do not want to spend more than 150 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin F
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed! We chose this hotel because of the location and beautiful balcony photos seen on other people's trip advisor pics. Not all rooms have this great of a view, so you must upgrade and request the Arc de Triumph view. It has more of a boutique hotel feel which we prefer. We had what I assume was the best view, room 507 with the wrap around corner balcony. The room is a touch small, but beautifully decorated and the view definitely outweighs room size. This room is ideal for couples, there is no additional room for cribs, etc. There are 2 sets of doors for each window opening, insuring that outside noise and traffic will not be an issue. The bathroom is modern, beautiful, and clean. The staff were courteous, helpful, and spoke English. It is conveniently located, as others have said, with a taxi stand across the street and the Metro/RER across the street. We did not try the hotel restaurant. Some have commented that they did not like the fact that you left your room key with the front desk when not occupying the room. I did not have a problem with this and actually appreciated that I did not have to keep up with a room key. From a safety standpoint/ anti-theft standpoint, I felt that the staff was trustworthy and reputable, so this did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mark b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendid Etoile in early October. What a great place--very clean--relatively large room (superior size)--bathroom was very modern and good size. Very pleasant and helpful staff (Thanks to Farook and Paulo). The location is excellent with a beautiful view of the Arc from our room. Also, the metro stop is right across the street. Can't wait to go back--we will absolutely stay at the Splendid Etoile again.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive, but great.”
Reviews.Author: Cissi S
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time looking for a nice, well located and friendly place in Paris. I'm really pleased with my choice. Friendly staff, free Wifi, good size of the room (stayed in a twin), clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Only drawback is the posh area where the restaurants are quiet expensive, but since the hotel is located opposite the Metro station it's easy to get to all other areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gkcharlton
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time deciding where to stay in Paris - a lot of choices and parts of the city. We are very glad that we stayed at the Hotel Splendid. The Air France shuttle made it very convenient getting to and from the airport. We had a triple room for our family of three and our room was excellent with a view of the Arc de Triomphe, it was so surreal to be looking at it right from our room, it was especially beautiful at night. The hotel was very helpful with dinner reccomendations in the area. (we at at The Hide - very small but great food) We walked to the eifel tower and then spent the day touring the city by using the water shuttle. At the end of the day we got off at the Champs Elysee stop and walked our way back to the hotel. The hotel was perfect for us and all of the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning”
Reviews.Author: MerrinR
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better hotel or location right in the heart of Paris. Service was impeccable, rooms although small were very comfortable, views spectacular, close to all amenities, shops, cafe's and restaurants. The little Italian restaurant on the next street over is well priced and food is very good. Cafe/bar on road behind the hotel(name escapes me but is basically the back of the Hotel) called Crystelles from memory was great! The only flaw is the bathrooms are tiny, but then you don't spend hours in there anyway. To us it was very Parisienne. Oh, and the balconnies have the most stunning views of the Arc and Champs Allysee (not sure on spelling there, sorry)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hotel Splendid”
Reviews.Author: KarenJayne
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews from Trip Advisor, we decided to book this hotel. We had a great experience here. The room was exactly as I had reserved with a lovely direct view of the Arc de Triomphe. We had a corner room with two balconies, and one balcony in the bathroom. Farooq was such a great help with restaurant reservations, recommendations, etc. Everyone at the front desk was super! Comfortable beds and great services overall. The location is so convenient. I would recommend to anyone visiting Paris. Try the restaurant down the street, Caius! Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Air France bus, making transportation to and from the airport quite easy. The Champs Elysees is quite close and the arc du triomphe is right outside your door. This hotel is close to many places to eat and is comfortable after a long day of sightseeing. Service is just ok, but everything else about the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: elpcanada
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel. especially the rooms with the Arc the Triomphe view. very clean and quiet rooms. highly recommended hotel thanks to the staff. The two young Arthurs were excellent . thanks you. dr edgardo perez

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice stay with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: We arrived as part of a 3 night stay to celebrate our anniversery. Our initial room was on the 1st floor which had a nice view but we were hoping that we could have been on a higher floor. Farooq (who was wonderful) assisted in getting us a room (suite) on a higher floor for not that much more money per night which was great. He gave us room options for the same price too...but we chose the room that was slightly more. It was a much larger room and had spectacular views of the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. In addition he put us on the right path for sightseeing in Paris. (The red bus-half block away) worked wonderfully for getting on/off all around the sites in Paris for 2 full days. Great way to see the city and practical. In addition for the evenings the Metro was literally across the street. He also connected us with the airport (direct route) on a charter bus to take us right to the airport (also right across the street) which was extremely comfortable and much less expensive then taxi and/or the on/off train changes (with luggage) for the Metro. Right out your front door was the was the Arc de Triomphe and at the top/north-west end of the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. I have to say that the staff and the service we received along with the location was really nice and we would come back and stay again. Thanks. J & S

Reviews.Title: “No big NO”
Reviews.Author: Engshosho
Reviews.Content: I highly not recommend this hotel. My worst experinece ever anf the rooms is another story OMG soo old so small

Reviews.Title: “We stayed her as part of our honeymoon - was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: Tamsin F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after arriving early morning from an overnight sleeper train from Verona. The reception staff kindly let us check in about 4 hours early to another room which was lovely with a balcony. The room was lovely, really nice decor, good bathroom (but was pretty small), and the breakfast was ok. Just croissants and that kind of thing but fine. We were glad that on the second night when we asked for a restaurant recommendation the young guy behind reception was incredibly helpful and booked a fantastic tiny bistro for us just down the road which we really enjoyed. This gave us more confidence in the hotel as the hotel reception staff from the previous day were really not helpful when we asked them for a restaurant recommendation. We'd even go as far as saying they were pretty rude to us even though we tried speaking in french to them every time we approached them. Needless to say we gave up after they were rude to us. Overall experience in this hotel was good though. Very close to many restaurants, bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “For when comfort is more important than quality”
Reviews.Author: jab513
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable start to your vacation, especially if you are not familiar with Paris, and would like to know that you will be treated well and get value for money (although without the splashes of grandeur of bigger hotels) then this is a good option for you. I just returned from a 2 night stay (for business) at this hotel. (As it turns out I also stayed here on my first trip to Paris as a tourist in 1993.) I found the hotel very comfortable and if you are looking for a relaxing but simple start to your vacation of a weekend city break then this might be a great option for you too. Here are the details The location of this hotel was the primary choice and for those that are unfamiliar with the large city (or like me) were looking to enjoy the odd hour away from work, then this hotel can hardly be bettered. Just next to the Arc de Triomphe and at the top/north-west end of the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es the hotel has great access to several sights, shops, restaurants, bars and entertainment areas. But as Paris covers a large area and has many distinct neighborhoods, the hotel also benefits from being on a Metro/RER line that connects you to every corner of the city. Note that in good weather the city bikes are also a good alternative with parking stations just round the corner. If arriving to the hotel by car or taxi be warned that due to its location you may need to â€˜go around the blockâ€™ in order to be dropped off on the right side of the road. If youâ€™d prefer to avoid this â€“ give a taxi driver the cross streets and just cross the road. As far as facilities go this hotel is quite slim on options. The lobby is small and can get crowded if busy. Next to this is a small bar area with complimentary newspapers in several languages. The bar itself was not used but was small, dark and clearly not used by anyone other than guests waiting for people. Given the location this is not an issue but if you like to get your moneyâ€™s worth out of each star of this hotel then you might be disappointed. The restaurant was only used for breakfast. At this time of day only half the space is used, with only a couple of staff meaning that when full it can get slow and hectic. Nevertheless the breakfast was well appointed with a small hot selection but large cold selection of cheeses, cold meats, excellent fruit, cereals, breads, jams, yogurts and so on. The staff for pleasant and helpful at all times. The breakfast team seemed to only speak French and can get busy when full which while OK for me might bother others. The rooms are mostly a good size with all the modern features. It seems some renovations are going on to upgrade some of the more dated furnishings but even in the older furnished rooms the bed was comfortable. With only 6 floors and 10 rooms per floor there is some variety in the offering of rooms. Rooms ending in 8 (e.g. 408) seem to have a good view of the Arc de Triomphe which for a romantic couple might add that magic extra. I had #xx1 which while at the back of the building (no view) had a lot of space and would be very suitable for a family looking to share one room. Be aware that many of the double beds are two singles put together so if this will be an issue ask at reception and ensure when you book that you specify that itâ€™s a couple staying. Bathroom was modern and clean. Ultimately you get value for money because of its location but as a small hotel its never going to drop its price and you will find little else in the area better. Do shop around and look for rates that include room guarantees or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Miknan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spendid Etoile in may of this year. Our room was very nice, bathroom a little small but bed was large and comfy. Nice balcony. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They went out of their way several times to get us cabs and transportation. I had heard about how unfriendly and rude personnel in Paris were but I found it to be the opposite. They could not have been nicer or friendlier. The hotel was located just a very short walk from the arch d triumph.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew V
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Convenient location. Large comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: There is nothing but great things about this hotel. The staff was very nice, helpful, and multiple-lingual. Rooms were clean and well kept during the stay. Breakfast was included and delicious. It is very convenient to shopping on Champs Ave and George V. It was also next to a metro stop, which made access to the city very easy.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: iamboring
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, the RER was at our doorstep,super near the Arc of Triumphe, had a balcony where we could sit around and enjoy the breeze plus scenery, in a nutshell.. SUPER AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe worth a second chance!”
Reviews.Author: Suffolk07 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and well presented. Good position for Arc de Triomphe and main shopping areas. Reception staff extremely helpful and cheerful; they could not be faulted for their service. Rooms vary around the hotel. Strangely room '10' on each floor was missing! However replaced by room '11' - eg 511 [on floor 5]. Warning about these rooms - they back on to the lifts and you get an early morning call from the mechanisms when the first person in the hotel gets up! The rooms themselves were impeccably clean, kept up by an half an hour cleaning routine during which a room maid will keep you out. Our room decor was brown and dated, however we did catch glimpse of other airier and brighter rooms. They have a well stocked mini-bar and a tv. Breakfast has a good range of cereals, meat, cheese, fruits, bread etc. However the breakfast room itself only has 20 seats - [8 x 2 seater and 2 x 4 seaters], so once 10 rooms are down [estimating 60 in hotel] you can wait up to half an hour in the lounge area for a table to become free! 9 o'clock was the busiest time we found. Due to the lack of space and volume of turn over the staff dealing with these limitations often plummet into chaos. For example - lack of spoons, no tea or coffee unless you asked for it and so on. Ability to speak french also a necessity when conversing with breakfast staff [and rightly so as it is France]. Strangely even though we had arrived at the beginning of August the bar and restaurant we closed. We were never informed of this when we booked. As having a restaurant is one of the criteria of a 4 star hotel, the Splendid Etoile was definitely operating as a 3 star. This hotel maybe worth a second chance when all facilities are functioning, and the breakfast situation improved.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Adventure09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel, right by the Arc De Triomphe at the end of the Champs Elysees, Metro, shopping, cafes and bars all in easy reach

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Roberta090593
Reviews.Content: The location directly across from the Arch de Triumphe couldn't have been better. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and excursions in Paris. Go to Le Hide and La Petite Columbier for exceptional Parisian food. A wonderful hotel to stay in. I would definitely go back to this hotel the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: moboDurhamUk
Reviews.Content: fab hotel very helpful staff very clean would stay here every time been to Paris many times this is the best hotel we have stayed in very good location room was good the only thing wrong for me it was to near the lift i could here it it woke me up early am a light sleeper my husband never heard it would ask for an other room next time but i would still stay here again breakfast was very good they even booked us in at the lido good show the only thing was the bar we never found it open but theirs a very good one over the road you need not look for a better hotel in Paris enjoy your holiday

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - splendid indeed!”
Reviews.Author: carbonexplorer
Reviews.Content: For a wonderful boutique hotel with a view of the arc de triumph, look no further! This was the perfect spot for a trip to Paris! The staff were very helpful and the room was absolutely wonderful! Exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: Bhoops2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes charm and unpretentious service by its staff. Situated in the shadow of the Arc De Triomf on the Champs de Elysses in Paris, it is the well sited for shopping on the Champs Elysses. The room allocated to us was excellent. It was the corner room 107 and had two balcony connected windows. Do remember that the balconies attached to Paris hotels are miniscule in size. The only gripe that we had was the cost of breakfast, an option that we chose to forego in favour of some of the local restaurant fare.The room decor was old world styled, the bathroom very modern. The free internet access was capped. The hotel does not have grounds or swimming pools, and would thus be unsuitable for families travelling with younger children. The sounds of the traffic around the Arc do tend to filter in but the double window closures help to dampen the full effect.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Paris - professional, friendly and always exceeding expectations”
Reviews.Author: pinkilly2
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the Splendit for more then 2 years at least twice a month, sometimes even more. I'm thrilled by the quality of this place - I think I have tried out most of the rooms (the smaller cheaper ones but also the very luxurious Suites) and I just can say - I love the place. Why? - Many rooms have direct view of the Arc de Triumph (like a picture postcard) - if you need a really quiet room just ask for a room to the court - and you will have a quiet oasis in Paris - All rooms are in mint condition - no scratches and everything in perfect shape - Very good beds - now with new duvets - Flowers everywhere - fresh and authentic just from the french countryside but the real treasure are the people there - it would be not fair to pick an individual but the personal recognition and the mission to exceed expectations is anchored in everybody - Thank you for every smile I get from you when I'm there - it's good to be at home even if you are far away! Staff is very confidential - so if you are planning to have guests around don't worry - they will not tell your collegues or your boyfriend ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelerut
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to France, and based on many stories, I expected staff at French hotels to be a bit snobbish and rude, but that was not this case with this hotel! The staff were all very helpful, polite and delightful. One of the maids even helped us with our baggage. It IS a small hotel so do not expect ammenities that come with bigger properties, but it did have free wi-fi and the rooms are surprisingly large, humongous really. The concierge told me it is a renovated old building from the 1800s I think. The exterior is gorgeous and the views are amazing. We could see the Arc de Triumph and the Eiffel Tower from our room. The only downside is that since it is an older building, the carpets are a big dated and the elevators only fit two people. But the room decor is gorgeous! If you are looking for the perfect four-star hotel In Paris, you can stop right now. You will not be dissappointed with the Splendid Etoile. And don't forget to try out the Patiserrie just down the street--the pastries are to die for! Oh, and take a bike tour! It's ridiculously fun!

Reviews.Title: “even better than”
Reviews.Author: peter021
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May again after staying there for a week in 2009. We were given a room on the top floor with a loung room and a lage bathroom with views of the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. The air conditioning was a noisey. The breakfast is very good and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The subway is across the road and The Arc de Triomphe is 5 minutes away. We would stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Animal70
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel, very well situated next to the Arc de Triomphe. The rooms are large by Parisian standards, OK by rest-of-world standards. The decor was tasteful: classic French without being too goopy. The rooms are nicely air conditioned. Everything was clean. Staff were very kind and helpful. Wifi was free. Altogether, a pretty good experience. Things that could have been better: we had a queen bed rather than a king, our room had no view whatsoever, and the room rate was on the high side. Overall, this is a good Parisian hotel that deserves a high ranking, but it is a few strokes short of getting a top vote from me.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCity_MOSheila
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. We requested a room with a view of the L'Arc du Triomphe and we were well pleased. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: prejune
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with a very helpful staff. Ideally placed for the Metro which we used every day .Good buffet breakfast and very clean. Close to the Arc de Triumph. We forgot some pre booked tickets bought on the internet and were saved by Farouk who phoned all the venues and sorted things for us .Difficult to fault our stay.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: FLEVY53232
Reviews.Content: this is our 5th time there.if we cant stay there we will stay home.farouk and staff are exceptional,as is the hotel.location cannot be beat.it is fabulous,the buufalo levy's

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and we will go back !”
Reviews.Author: SettiDarab
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect. Within walking distance (5 -7 minutes) to Chanselise. The staff were friendly enough. (They did communicate in English, with no hesitation whatsoever !!!). The room was very clean. Room service was very good. We only had breakfast at the hotel which was good. In general, there wasn't any area that we could put our finger on. This is a nice and comfortable place to stay . And if we want to go back to Paris, then we would go back to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Etoile for the second time. The rooms are large and beautiful. We had a view of the Arc de Triomphe. It is in a great location, only steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are very clean. We would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on four stars”
Reviews.Author: Vierdank
Reviews.Content: Good, but a bit pricy hotel. Very exactly four stars, spot on. Comfortable rooms, large for being Paris - but that's what you pay for here. Immaculate standard and service. From certain rooms an extremely nice view towards L'Arc de Triomphe - just what a well off tourist (from the states or elsewhere far off) needs to get the "Paris feeling"! Location is good if you are in Paris for the first (or second) time, but actually not the most convenient spot if you want to walk about... We took this hotel because of the AirFrance coaches, stopping just outside the hotel. Perfect if you need to get to CDG early. Nothing really to complain about. Possibly that the bar is closed on Sundays (?!). Not cheap. There's a lot of competition in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Maggedutti
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a proposal followed by a long weekend in Paris in this hotel. It was perfect for the occation! Nice "parisian" room with corner balcony. Lovely view to the Etoile. Very good location close to Champs Elysees and metro station. Very nice and helpful staff. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: TonySwain
Reviews.Content: I will probably say what many have said already. This is a beautiful hotel in an ideal location with amazing views from our room to the Arc de Triomphe. The service is excellent and the head concierge Farouk went above and beyond the call of duty on a daily basis to ensure that our stay was the most memorable and happy experience. The location of the airport bus stop is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cbncd_123
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write many reviews and this one will be short, but I had to sign in here and give it my highest praise. Location, cleanliness, quietness, service, helpfulness and friendliness. I must also mention the concierge, Paulo - he (and the location) are what keeps us coming back to the Splendid Etoile. Paulo is knowledgeable and extremely helpful. We will just mention something in passing and, if he doesn't know it off the top of his head, the next time we see him he will have researched it and has an answer. I think if you read through the reviews you will learn all the details that make this place special. I just wanted to add that the employees also make it special.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location and facilities and staff that set the bar on amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: CHedrick_13
Reviews.Content: I was accompaning my mother-in law. SHE ran the Paris Marathon (whole other story) the location of the hotel could not have been better! It''s location accross the street from Metro and Airport Bus stops made getting around the city amazingly simple and no hauling suitcases blocks from a bus stop on arrival and departure. Just a stroll away from numerous cafe's with good food at reasonable prices (for Paris). A few blocks away to the right and down the hill is a middle eastern restaurant (for commoners like myself) that had the best cous cous w/ baked chicken that I have ever had! All the staff were wonderfully attentave and helpful. But the absolute star of the staff way Farrooq! He set the bar for the rest of the staff with his amazing knowledge of the city and what it had to offer, as well as his ability to speak an amazing number of languages! If I am ever blessed with the opportunity to return to Paris, I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, truly fantastic service!"”
Reviews.Author: helodaddy99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with several friends recently stayed at this hotel as part of a tour package for the Marathon d'Paris. We cannot speak highly enough of the service we received while at this hotel. Every member of the staff treated us as if we were long time customers and went out of their way to ensure that we were happy. In particular, Farooq, the Chief Concierge, was superb. I was meeting my wife for the first time in seven months due to a military deployment and Farooq helped to ensure that every detail was perfect for our stay from helping us secure a room with a great view of the Arc d'Triumph from the balcony or getting flowers delivered to the room before our arrival. The hotel is very nice. Our room was larger than expected and had a fantastic view from our on the balcony. Do bear in mind that as in most european hotels in old buildings, the rooms are not all set up the same. The location makes this hotel a great option but the service is what sets it apart. The service we received at the Splendid Etoile rivaled any I have seen at 5 star resorts. We look forward to a return trip in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Payam
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel last year and again we have experienced like home in this hotel.This time we have stayed in Standard Room which was really comfortable for my family.An extra bed for my son already arranged and it was free. Staffs are really friendly and do their best to help all the guests and create a pleasant stay for them.All of them are good in English language. Really wonderful staff at reception and concierge specially Farroq which is full of energy with a lot of information. Real perfect location, all the transport ways are just in few steps: Metro,RER, Bus, Taxi, Air-France Airport shuttle.There is a lot of different restaurants around you from fast foods to luxury ones. Large rooms with high roof and classic decoration with small but really good view balcony.Plenty of towels and amenities in large bath room. For sure we will be back to this hotel again in our any Paris trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, extremely helpful concierge,beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: traveler52558
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week visiting Paris, and this hotel was ideal in location - Across the street from the metro and connections to all over the city. Room on the 3rd floor had 2 balconies with a view of the Arc d'Triumph, quiet, very clean, extra chairs. The personal attention that we received from the chief concierge was above and beyond what we would have expected. We appreciated the small, cozy feeling of the hotel. Breakfast was a large buffet spread, lots of fresh fruit, meats, eggs, cheeses, well worth the price if you want more than coffee and pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property at an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: rvarg23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in celebration of our honeymoon. Our spacious superior room had a double door balcony with a perfect view of the Arc de Triomphe. The decor was pleasant and elegant; it was modern, with a traditional flair. Bathroom and amenities were very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Of course, the location is amazing, with a metro station right outside the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very well located hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: hdmessias
Reviews.Content: very well located hotel, good service. highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: lcc_1
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed many hotels in Paris I chose the Hotel Splendid Etoile for a three night stay with my partner. The location was excellent and the service from the staff was outstanding. We booked a superior room and were given one with two sets of doors onto a balcony with fabulous views of the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel has a lovely restaurant and there are many cafes and bistros on the doorstep for breakfast and dinner. I cant recommend this hotel highly enough and am looking forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: tcvw
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel...great location, nicely decorated room, and all personnel helpful and extremely friendly. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in February. Fantastic location...Air France bus stop right across the street from the hotel and metro right outside the hotel. Benji, the concierge, was extremely helpful with directions and suggested restaraunts. Received a great rate through travelzoo.com. Rate inclucded breakfast, bottle of wine, and trip on the Bateaux-Mouches. Breakfast was great...with lots of hot and cold items. We were given an upgrade to a beautiful room with a balcony over looking the Arc de Triomph. I highly recommend this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Janeh2
Reviews.Content: You couldnt ask for a better location than this hotel, we caught the ( very efficient) Air France bus from Terminal 2B at CDG which drops you off directly opposite the hotel. The staff were curtious and friendly and the hotel lobby , although not huge or glamourous is welcoming and very clean. We were shown to our room ( 507) which again not huge was lovely and clean and very nicely decorated but the best thing was the view we were directly opposite the Arch De Triumphe and could see the Eiffel Tower which when lit up at night was spectacular. Well worth the upgrade ! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in and the breakfast is nice with lots of choice of breads/fruit/cereals etc and a small selection of hot items which sets you up for the day. The RER/Metro station is also just outside the hotel which makes it really easy to get around. The hotel staff were also very knowledgable about how to get to all the attractions giving us advice on which metro stop was best and recommending brasseries etc. Paris is wonderful and we will definitely be back. We had a night at the Lido which was really good fun having sat next to a delightful couple Phillipe and Sylvie we all got along realy well despite the language barrier!!. Another highlight is the conciererie - a real hidden gem along with Sainte Chappelle - wonderful ! I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great hotel in a great location. The only warning would be that around the hotel/area we encountered a number of people operating a scam where when you are waiting to cross the road/ looking at the veiw they come up and then suddenly spot a gold wedding ring on the floor, they pick it up and try to distract you asking if it is yours while trying to pick your pocket - dont even look at them and tell them to go away loudly -they tried this on us on at least 4 occassions without success so be aware and on your guard !!! other than this small irritation it was a wonderfully romantic and inspirational holiday - go and enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: jorgelopes55
Reviews.Content: great location,accomodation, and great and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marielaure6854
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a step away from Charles de Gaulle etoile metro station. You take the lift and immediatly enter the hotel. Rooms are spacious, clean and beds quite comfortable.But most of all, great view of the Arc de Triomphe. Hotel staff very polite, ready to assist tourists and efficient. Never tried breakfast, wich was rather expensive (more than 20 euros per person per day). Try the Fouquet's cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Just a pity Paris is soooo expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bigfishjas
Reviews.Content: My review is for the hotel only. Can't fault it!! Excellent location, fantastic view of Arc de triumph and right opposite Air France Bus Shuttle. All brilliant. Great location for walking to all key sights. My only criticism is of Paris itself - th Euro rate means everything is really expensive if you are on a bit of a budget. But hey I have been there and done it now just got the credit card bill to pay!! Stay at this hotel and you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChan21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Splendid Etoile for 4 nights in November after reading the reviews for this hotel - and we wasn't dissapointed at all!! First of all the reception staff were really friendly and welcoming and couldnt do enough for you. They even upgraded our room to a large room facing the Arc de Triumph, which has to be the nicest room I have stayed in. The view was breath taking and the room was very clean - no faults whatsoever. The breakfast was lovely with a choice between hot and cold options and fresh fruit. The location of this hotel is fantastic, just minutes away from the Champs and just across the road is a pick up point for shuttle buses to and from CDG airport. Overall a perfect hotel in the best part of Paris and a hotel I would love to return to some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location, small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: flemersDumfries Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated at the Arc de triumph at the top of the chance lysse. Good clean hotel with excellent courteous staff who were all willing to help and give advice. Lots of nice bars and restuarants close by and Metro station outside front door of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View”
Reviews.Author: jgriffin1028
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay very much - the view from the room overlooking the Arc de Triomphe was spectacular - great location. The staff was attentive and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: heggers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Splendid Etoile from 25th - 28th November. Upon our arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to a deluxe room with a view of the Arc de Triomphe! The room was spectacular, with an incredible view and very luxurious. We had a great trip, made even more special by this hotel. The service was fantastic and concierge very helpful, and the location is perfect - so central that we walked everywhere. Even handier is that the bus for CDG airport leaves from literally across the road. All in all a perfect stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid but unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: multerino
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, pretty room with comfy beds, a very nice hotel stay overall. The reception and lounge areas were nice and pleasant, but you wont remember them beyond your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: cooper017
Reviews.Content: Air France shuttle stop across the road, Metro station opposite, very convenient for all the sights. Room nice enough, but too hot and no coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Snowy037
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this hotel is that itÂ´s perfect! It was my first time in Paris and this is exactly what I imagined I would stay in while visiting. ItÂ´s very elegant (more inside the room than the lobby area ) french classic with lotÂ´s of taste in dÃ©cor and colors. Room 104 was very spacious! The barthroom was very big as the room and the closet space. It was also very clean. The bed was soo comfy! TV in english as well as other languages like spanish. The personnel was friendly which always makes the stay of a hotel important! Breakfast was very filling with an enormous selection of hot and cold food. (included with our offer) I donÂ´t think there is a better location then where this hotel is at since the metro station is right across a non busy street. I couldnÂ´t stop saying how lucky we were since it was freezing when we went. This station also has connections to other metro lines, RER and from these lines you are just two or three stops from other monuments. I LOVED this hotel and would stay here again! (I hope one day not too far) We got the discounted offer from travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “excellent very clean”
Reviews.Author: chaengele
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel well situated, somewhat expensive but worth it. We skiped however the beakfast at 25â‚¬ (even in the continental form in the room) and crossed the street to Avenue Mac Mahon where various cafÃ©s provide an excellent french beakfast for 11â‚¬

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MrsFox
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, staff super friendly! We had an amazing stay. Would recommend it! First time ever written on trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Etoile was splendid indeed!”
Reviews.Author: livtotravl
Reviews.Content: Wow - what a find! This hotel was recommended to us by friends who were there many years ago and weren't sure of the quality but it was a nice boutique hotel located only one block from the Arc de Triumphe and the famous shopping avenue in Paris!!! Value was terrific and they had the wonderful large windows and a balcony opening up to overlook the arc - magnificient! Would highly recommend this hotel for a luxurious stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “It could not have been better...”
Reviews.Author: DRTVrMoi
Reviews.Content: What started out as a blind online deal of 150 euros a night, turned into our new Paris favorite. The Air France le car bus stops across the street from the hotel. This allows for easy travel to Orly or deGaulle. The metro was also just across the street. The rooms were lovely and quiet, which is amazing for being so close to the Etoile. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidays1234595
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. I found it on a deal and when looked it up on Trip advisor I couldn't believe how good the reviews were. I let the hotel know before hand we were staying for a birthday holiday and they were so accomodating. The room was fantastic!! So large compared to the standard hotels in Paris and a great view of the Arc d' Triomphe. Unfortunately we had twin beds rather than the double I asked for but the room made up for it and I didn't feel the need to ask for a double. The location was fantastic and perfect for our 2 day trip. However one criticism I do have is the noise in the morning from the lifts and works within the hotel were quite loud. There was drilling as early as 7am. However with that overlooked still a great hotel and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: travelwith2under2
Reviews.Content: amazing location, opened my window and the arc was right in front of my eyes and to the right of the arc you can see the sparkling eiffel tower absoutely gorgeous especially on those cold Parisian nights. Also the christmas lights on the champs could also be seen clearly even the street dancers near the red bus stop, i stayed with my husband and two infants my 1.5 years old loved running around the spacious suite. we went on the travlezoo offer its the best value with the free upgrade and the river cruise about 1 hour long in a heated boat yay. The breakfast buffet was also good compared to other hotels in the area even though i don't eat meat, my appetite was pleased with the great selecton of cheeses and I always requested fried eggs at no extra charge instead of the scrambled eggs they had already in the buffet. Mcdonalds and a few other fast food places 2 minutes walk away also the restaurants on the champs only 5 to 10 minutes walk away. The only problem was no facility to make bottle bottles in my room, had to always request boild water but I must say it always came in a jiffy!! The staff are really great especially Yasser who was always pleasant to talk to. Stay here you will not regret it :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and a comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: lizziechingari
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from staying for 3 nights at the Splendid Etoile hotel in Paris. We got a special deal via travelzoo which included breakfast, bottle of wine on arrival plus a boat trip along the Seine. The hotel was very clean, fabulous location, helpful and friendly staff. Hotel rooms in Paris are notoriously small, but ours was a good size. We did have a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room (albeit through a gap between the buildings, but then why spend time looking out of the window when you can be out there enjoying this lovely city?!). The breakfast was substantial and set us up for a day of sightseeing. The location means that you are within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower (15mins) and most of the other sights (having the Arc de Triomphe on your doorstep is lovely!). There is a metro right outside the hotel which means that everything is within easy reach. I'm picky when it comes to hotels, but I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: heatherben1113
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. For being so close to the Arc de Triumph, it is super quiet. The Metro entrance is right across the street from the hotel. All of the tour buses and local buses are within a close walking distance. Great service. We arrived very early and they were able to accomodate us with a room, which I understand is rare. We had a walk-out balcony where you could see the Arc. The staff could recommend great places to eat, tell you what to avoid, and they were willing to help us settle on a firm price for the taxi ride to the hotel. They were very accomodating!!! The location is superb. The service is superb. Room has a hair dryer available along with soap and shampoo. We did not have the breakfast option, as there are so many places to grab a quick bite as you are sightseeing. They also have one computer available with free Internet, which we used to communicate with loved ones at home. I would recommend the on/off double decker bus for traveling/sight-seeing. The Metro was easy to navigate and most of the tellers knew some English if you needed help. I would not recommend wasting money on the Moulin Rouge show. Everything else we did was wonderful. Notre Dame Cathedral took my breath away. Just an FYI- Watch out for the gypsies. We had 6 different people trying to sell us the same gold band. They will ask you to read a card if you speak English, which asks for money. They will walk up to you and drop a ring on the ground and pick it up to offer it to you. They are not aggressive, but this was annoying after awhile. I would recommend seeing the Eiffell Tower in the evening, and the lights are amazing at the beginning of the hour. You will be bombarded by people selling "black market" eifell towers. Please know, everyone was so nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, friendly , helpful staff, come and stay here.”
Reviews.Author: cavershamtraveller1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night with my sister. I booked a standard room (expensive at 200 Euros but this is Paris..) but was pleasantly surprised and very grateful to David,the receptionist, when he offered us an upgrade to a superior room with amazing views of the Arc de Triomphe and the city. The room (on the 5th floor) was big and spacious compared to similarly classed rooms in other hotels in Paris. It had 2 french doors which opened on to a balcony that had wonderful views of the A de T ,the Avenue Carnot and the Paris skyline. The room is decorated in a classic Louis style and furniture. Not posh or too twee but nicely understated. Bathroom is a good sized one and very clean. Lifts in the hotel are tiny.. but in perfect working order. Its location is super if you need to take the airport bus,taxi,metro and the RER, shopping and eating at the Champs Elysees and ....everything else!!! It was really nice to stay at a hotel like this when we had only 1 day to do lots of things in this city and have to leave first thing in the morning. The staff whom we saw throughout our stay have been very friendly, polite, helpful and spoke very fluent English. One of the them very kindly let us use their reception computer to do my flight online check-in and printing the boarding pass when their computer at the internet booth was playing up a bit. My sister and I have enjoyed our very short stay in this lovely city and this hotel had played a big part in making it a very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, lovely room and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: lizdorset
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Splendid Etoile exceeded all my expectations. It was my first stay in Paris and I travelled as a single parent with two young children and I couldn't have asked for anything better. The location is superb, right by the Arc de Triomphe and a stone's throw from the nearest Metro station. The room we were given was more like a suite, it was superb. The decor was lovely, the bathroom large and spotlessly clean. As for the breakfast, you couldn't really ask for much more of a choice, it was delicious. But what made the hotel extra-special for us as a family was how friendly the staff were, from the chamber-maids and waitresses through to the front desk staff. They were absolutely superb and made us feel very special. They let me practice my abysmal schoolgirl French and encouraged the children to try a few words. In short, I thought they were wonderful and they helped made my family's trip so special. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel and shall be saving up to go back again as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: parrottheadsteveo
Reviews.Content: Bonjour!! This was our first time to Paris. The Splendid Etoile was great. The location is excellent! Near the Arc and Metro stop this hotel is very accessible. The front staff on check-in was very nice. After a long day of touring it was nice to be greeted by Ayed. Ayed always had a smile and wanted to know how our explorations for the day went. And the Chef Concierge Farooq service was awesome!!!!!!!! His knowledge of Paris, the sights and dining establishments could not be topped. We can hardly wait to get back to Paris,this hotel and the Staff!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExpertTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Splendid Etoile for 6 days at the end of our French vacation. We've been in Paris numerous times and have stayed at other hotels, and this has been the best hotel we've stayed in for multiple reasons, i.e. room, location and staff. We opted to upgrade to a superior room, which was much larger than we expected, was very comfortable, had beautiful views of the Arc de Triomphe from 2 large floor to almost ceiling doors, which opened out to a large balcony. The bedroom and bathroom were immaculately clean; and we had maid service in the moning and again in the early evening. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. The RER and multiple Metro lines stop in front of the hotel so you can get to all parts of Paris very easily. The bus stop on the Champs Elysee is 1 block away. And the Air France bus from/to Charles De Gaulle and/or Orly airports stop across the street...and we found this to be the absolute most convenient way to get from/to the airport. Many fabulous little bistros are within walking distance of the hotel. The staff at the hotel was excellent; friendly and very helpful. When we return to Paris, we will plan on staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: fredrikstad
Reviews.Content: A splendid hotel in the best possible place in Paris. A magnificent view of The Arc from the balcony! Lovely, spacious room, with a nice,clean bathroom as well.Delicious breakfast! Polite and helpful staff.Thank you Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good, and excellent for Paris”
Reviews.Author: avardwilson
Reviews.Content: Like most old hotels, the rooms vary in size, and yes, the nicest rooms are the ones on the net, and they cost more. The small, inside rooms are fine if youre just staying for a couple of days and you need a quiet place to sleep in a clean room. But no, there's no view of anything but the next building. And being an old building, the maintenence folks are busy all day. In old hotels, whether Paris, New York, or London, you never know what you're going to get for a problem. My impression is that this Hotel does their best to address them. Taxis. This hotel is right in front of a busy taxi stand. Walk out the front door and take the cab at the front of the line. Calling a cab is unneccessary. Even during the general strike in France, there were cabs available. Carnot Street at the Arc is a major Paris hub for bus and cab, as well as an RER and metro stop. If you get the concierge to call a cab, know that Paris taxis, like most large cities, charge from the moment they start out to pick you up, not from door to door. So, the meter is running from the time the phone gets put down, not from the time the cab shows at the hotel. That's standard, and it can make a 6 euro trip cost 20. If theis is what you want, than be prepared to pay for it. Phone calls. I made a few short long distant calls (direct dialed), and was pleasantly surprised by the cost (total was 5 - 6 euros.) The staff were courteous and professional. The area is excellent. I had no problems. if you plan to spend any time in your room other than sleeping and showering, pay more for a bigger room. If the price of breakfast here is too steep, the cafe across the street has good food (L'Empereur), and 100 feet past that there's a McD's and Quick Burger, of youre looking for breakfast for pocket change. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: purelica
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel tremendously; the room is clean with a good size bathroom. We booked a room on the fifth floor for the view of the arc de triomphe and oh boy, the view was nothing less than spectacular! The double French doors sealed off all the outside noise, so we slept like babies every night. We wouldn't mind staying at this hotel (in the same room) again if we ever go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: tetrisfan
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in, everything was perfect. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. Farouq is famous by now, but again, he made some great recommendations. David was nice too. The suite 606 was better and larger than expected, and the view was to die for: Eiffel from a distance, but the Arc was so close you can almost skip and jump... The suite was beautifully furnished and sparkling clean. The only thing missing was coffee or tea, but it was not a big deal. The breakfast was delicious and included all kinds of breads and pastry, sliced meats, all kind of cheese, fruits, vegetables, cereals, eggs, sausage and more. I cannot remember all the food items, but it was all plentiful and tasty. The Metro is a couple of steps away, and the AirFrance bus is across the street, so you have the ease of going to the CDG without any problems or anxiety. I wish we could stay there for much longer, but we had to go back home after three great days. Paris is magical but do wear comfortable shoes...

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very kind and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: wakame0106
Reviews.Content: The staff was able to be spent very kindly and comfortably though stayed alone. Moreover, because the access of sightseeing is also preeminent because it is the presence of Arch of Triumph, and the limousine bus from the airport is arriving and departing from the hotel presence, it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marianthony
Reviews.Content: Location! Excellent location. We stay on the 4Th floor(corner) with wonderful views to the Arc of Triumph. We find that the the rated of this Hotel is 4 starts but fitted with 2 starts bathroom. The bath tub, very high of the ground with no wall support. When showering the water could became very cold or hot. The quality of the bath room is not a 4 star Hotel, as one expected. Staff very friendly and willing to help every time

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HotTubJohnny
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Splendid Etoile in september 2010. Location: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is adjacent to the Arc de Triomphe and very close to Avenue des Champs-elysees. There's plenty of brasseries nearby with nice outdoor seating. The charles de gaule etoile metro/RER station is right across the street from the hotel. The Air France bus to CDG airport is also right across the street. There's really not much more you can ask for from location. Rooms: The room was small, as most european rooms are, but comfortable. The bedding and pillows were very nice. The shower had great water pressure. There is an in-room safe. The small balcony provided a great feeling when opening up the french doors and looking out at the city. Nit-picks would include: i'd like more tv channels, an alarm clock would be nice, and the hair-dryer could use some updating. Staff: The staff was great. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. They really made us feel at home. The housekeeping staff seemed top-notch as well. The room was very clean, and we never had to call for housekeeping service. It was done in a timely manner each day. Cons: Room was noisy due to upstairs neighbors. In-hotel wi-fi was non-functional 25euros for breakfast seems steep, but i don't know the going rate in Paris hotels To address the previous review briefly, yes the wi-fi was down during our stay. However, the front desk tried to accommodate as best they could. They provided wi-fi from the restaurant, and graciously offered their computer to print Eiffel tower tickets. When i booked, there was no mention of in-room internet on their site, so i don't feel that i was cheated. Given the staff's attitude, i believe they would have gone even further to accommodate if access was a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location, view and service!”
Reviews.Author: jimnovy
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at Hotel Splendid Etoile was 1988 with my mother on the recommendation of a colleague. The hotel has the same spectacular view, central location and outstanding service, but now with free wireless internet. Anyone who is traveling to Paris looking for a "sure thing" hotel will be happy with Splendid Etoile. There are less expensive hotels, but it is worth the price for any first-time or infrequent visitor to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Like a home for me - the Splendit is splendit!”
Reviews.Author: pinkilly
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy staying there as it feels like home. I'm there almost every week for more then 18 month and every time I feel welcome. The rooms are immaculate, choose between Arc de Triumph View which is a little bit more noisy or one of the very silent ones, which face the court. Breakfast is very fresh and french, the staff at the reception desk very helpful and the drink at the bar very comfortable. Very good Wifi-Connection - freely available!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel-wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: VacationChasin
