Reviews.Content: You cannot get a better location in Paris. Situated facing the Arc de Triomphe, the view from my Superior room was breathtaking. Not only did I have a full view of the Arc, but I could also see the top of the Eiffel tower. The front desk clerks were lovely-they were able to accomodate my early check in request, and the room was spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. The staff assisted me with finding a store that I was looking for, and when I had trouble charging my phone, they offered to charge it at the front desk. Also couldn't figure out the a/c, and within minutes of calling front desk, someone was in my room assisting me. The buffet breakfast was great-tons of choices and a nice restaurant with morning sun. I absolutely will stay there again. Bargain for the price and for the service and location. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues who travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitors to Paris? Splendid Etoile - a great hotel location, fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: paulmcelkerney1958
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Paris, our first time there. Let me start with the Hotel Splendid Etoile. This was the perfect location, especially if arriving at CDG airport. I was slightly worried about how we would get into central Paris and find the hotel. I didn't want to pay a very costly transfer but I need not have worried. We flew with Air France and on their site I stumbled across their airport coach service. We got an Air France coach (Line 2) right outside the Terminal for 12 euros return and 30 mins later, after one previous stop, it stopped right across the road from the hotel! The hotel also had a metro and RER stop literally outside the front door - via a lift to the underground station - CDG Etoile. The hotel has charming & clean rooms with a traditional French feel and well equipped - mini bar, safe, bath robe etc. Tea & coffee would have been nice but I appreciate that this is not normally a feature of many European cities. An iron would be helpful for longer than 5 day stays but it wasn't a problem for us. Breakfast was an excellent buffet with a good variety. Staff throughout the hotel were friendly and pleasant. Farooq, the concierge was especially helpful and gave us excellent directions to Palace De Versailles. There was free internet just off the lobby where we could check e-mails and check-in online for our trip home. The hotel was steps from the L'arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees and there we caught the open top bus tour. We paid for a 2-day ticket and with 4 routes it was a great way to see the City. But beware â€“ it is a free for all when the bus stops. The pushing and shoving to try to get on was terrible. We have been on the tour buses in New York and Barcelona and they were well organised â€“ but this phew!! Most of the culprits we experienced were French; maybe they have a thing against tourists. We were told that to eat on the Champs Elysees was expensive but we found a very nice eatery that we would recommend. The Bistro Romain offers a two-course meal for 15 euros or three courses for 20 euros with a beer or glass of wine for only 2 euros extra. This was great value as the food was excellent and right on the Champs Elysees in the shadow of the Arc.. If you are nervous watch out for the pigeons â€“ they were on the top of the canvas looking for scraps and flew down even onto empty tables. On our second time there we asked to be moved inside because a child was throwing scraps and they were everywhere!! At the end of our trip it was reassuring to just walk across the road and catch the bus back to the airport â€“ no hassle. A very pleasant trip and an excellent hotel. Well done Farooq and everyone at the Splendid Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very helpful staff and central location.”
Reviews.Author: john_thompson1770
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and it was very special. The room (307) was lovely with a balcony and view of the Arc de Triumphe. The chief concierge Farooq and every member of staff on the desk were excellent in the way they looked after us. We would recmmend this hotel for it's quality, location and staff and will definitely book again. Mr & Mrs Thompson - Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great deal”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Travelzoo special which included breakfast, bottle of wine and river cruise. I am not sure if we got an upgraded room, but we did have a balcony and almost a view of the Arc. The room was not large, but the bathroom was very nice and the wireless was a bonus. We enjoyed the river cruise and the concierge made us dinner reservations at a wonderful escargot restaurant per my husband's request. The breakfast was filling, but probably would have skipped it if we had to pay full price. The location is really what makes his hotel fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average hotel - not four star”
Reviews.Author: cakeaway
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the location and free wireless internet. My husband and i were very disappointed with this hotel, especially when we saw our room. I think the photos on the internet of this hotel's rooms are actually of the suites, not of the standard hotel rooms. We booked a standard room, and it was tiny.(I do understand that European rooms are generally smaller) Our room only had a view of the building next door, The bed was a double bed (not queen or king size), with very standard bed linen and pillows. The tv in the room was tiny, and not flatscreen. The hotel lifts are so small that some families had to leave their pram/strollers in the hotel lobby as you couldn't fit a stroller and 3 people in the lift at the same time. When you check in you will be given a room key with a huge key ring, which you must leave with reception if you exit the hotel (no electronic keys here). To me this hotel felt like it's stuck in the 80's, and hasn't moved with the times at all. Unfortunately i couldn't recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mimiorange
Reviews.Content: We would have preferred to have coffee/tea available in the hotel. Making toast at breakfast takes a very long time (slow toaster and only one available). Staff are pleasant and very helpful. We were disappointed that the bar was closed not sure why. The location was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, room and location.”
Reviews.Author: bionic02
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to this hotel for her 13th birthday treat. Emailed in advance asking if possible for a room overlooking arc de triomphe. When we got to our room. It had been upgraded to room 608 free of charge. It was a suite on top floor. From our 3 windows you could see eiffel tower, sacre couer and the arc was so near it was stunning. The desk staff made a fuss of us all weekend. Parisians sometimes have a reputation for being unfirendly, but the staff at this hotel were excellent. Breakfast is a fantastic buffet. Not just continental. I had lovely smoked salmon and scrambled egg. If you can get a deal , at this hotel book it. Its fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brandontraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. From the minute we checked in we were treated very well, with the hotel looking to help us with any questions about both the hotel or Paris. The room was not especially large, but it was definitely sufficient for our purposes. The bed was harder than we were used to, but we came to realize that hard beds seem to be the norm in Europe. The morning breakfast buffet was great and provided a nice start to the day, especially when able to sit in the street side area of the dining room, which is completely glass walled. Overall, we had a fantastic stay and would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a nice place to stay close to the Champs Elysees. We did find that the hotel was a little further from the sights than we would have liked, but there is a Metro stop directly across the street which provided easy transportation to all points of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: nieci
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome.It was in a great location we were able to walk to all the sights and shopping. Also the air france bus drops you off right across the street way to arrive from airport and only 15 euros. Taxi stand and metro right out front. Our room had icredible view of the arc with 2 balconeys that we could view it from. Room was clean and nicely decorated. Bed was huge and comfortable Room was very quiet . Staff was great house keeping friendly and good,front desk helpful and gave great choices for dinners and sightseeing. Bar small but intimate. Never ate a meal in the hotel. All in all I highly recomend this hotel it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations and more....”
Reviews.Author: biskaduros
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights at the Splendid. Rooms were great. Spacious by European standards, clean and well appointed. We had a long trip and the room was ready early. Staff were great on check in and it was refreshing to relax and get ready for what Paris offers. Hotel is in a great location close to Arc de Triumphe and metro. Easy walks for shopping, dinner, and just sight seeing. Faroq at the concierge was fantastic on everything for tips, dinner, and everything else. We had problems getting in with the bus strike, but Faroq arranged a private taxi to take us back. Everything went perfect. Some folks complain the breakfast is pricey but consider that convenience, wide assortments, and time begins to seem a bargain when you are limited for time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond our expectations in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: ValTravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: Great service and patient assistance. Able to speak, French, English and Arabic with us, which was a relief for my wife. Help us with our French. Help us with advice for our daily trips around Paris. Clean quiet room on Level 6 with local and district views. Filling breakfast with good levels of choice. Benefits of internet access when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: SNH1301
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location ... THat's what this hotel is all about! Had a wonderful 3 night stay here but the actual hotel I wouldn't rate as highly as lots seem to on here! It was perfect for what we wanted and especially in Paris the size of room was good but just not as amazing as everyone on here raves about! Had a great offer from Travelzoo and for the money can't fault it. We had one of the best rooms with the view if the Arch de triomphe and i would defo ask for that when you book. Also book with a deal - don't pay full price or you will be disappointed! Breakfast was a bit, well, wierd is the only word for it, v odd atmosphere! Some fresh fruit etc and a fry up that had been stagnating for many hours - the lady in charge of breakfast was not very friendly and the room where it was was so empty and you had to ask for extra food to be put out (we weren't that late going down!) If i was going back to Paris and this hotel had an offer on i would go back - i just don't think it deserves to be number 29 in the list!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FLEVY53232
Reviews.Content: this is our 4th time at this hotel and it is great every year.cant say enough about it.it does not disappoint.hope you enjoy it as much as us.the levy's from buffalo ny

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, great area and Faruk at front desk was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: a4orion
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Le Splendid Etoile the last week of June 2010. We loved the beauty, cleanliness of the hotel and the location was perfect with wonderful viewsof the Arc de Triumph. Charming Faruk worked the front desk and helped our family get to our preferred sightseeing destination everyday...We booked through TravelZoo so we also received a fantastic deal on a very expensive hotel room! The daily breakfast buffet was ample and included both hot and cold choices...We loved Splendid and Paris and will return in the future! Thank you Faruk for making our stay in Paris an affair to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jsudre
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasant to stay at Splendid Etoile Hotel from June 25 until July 1 during our honey moon trip! The hotel is great... Perfect! The people were so friendly and they were always willing to help us. Paulo is the best Concierge that we have ever met before! We also were very impressed by the rest of the staff including Farooq (the other Concierge), FranÃ§oise (front desk) and Wael (from the night shift). The localization was terrific... Air France shuttle stop and Metro subway station are a few steps from the hotel. And even with the Metro so close to us, we were able to go by walking to the Louvre Museum, Champs Elysee, Eiffel Tour, etc... The breakfast was great... Lots of options including fruits and several kinds of cheese... The ladies from the breakfast were so kind! Everything was delicious! As for the room... We got a room with a great view from our balcony to the Triumph Arc. The room was outstanding... Very clean and very roomy taking into account the common size of the rooms in Paris. I am pretty sure that the windows had some kind of soundproofing because it was so quiet during the nights even with all the traffic flowing next to the Arc of Triumph. The wi-fi Internet access works great from the room. We will definitely stay at Splendid Etoile again!

Reviews.Title: “The Splendid Etoile Hotel really lives up to its name...it truely is Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Mim2010
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had an absolutely fantastic stay at the Splendid Etoile Hotel. We were very impressed by the Hotel and its staff. We were very lucky in that we booked the Hotel at a special rate (below half the usual price). Despite this we were treated no differently to full paying customers. When arrived at the Hotel at 10am with the intention of leaving our luggage and returning to check-in at the standard time of 2pm. However, we were allowed to check-in upon arrival and the staff had our room ready for us within 10minutes. The room was impecably clean, the beds comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this Hotel and intend on staying there on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, "Splendid" Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: ccumomsc
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. We wanted to stay someplace that would give us easy access to all the spots. We planned on walking the city and were not too sure at first that this hotel was going to be centrally located enough. It was perfect. Only a couple blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, metro directly across the street and several tasty restaurants in the neighborhood. The rest of the "attractions" we split into day walking trips. If someone prefers to travel by metro, it is easy to use. Back to the Splendid Etoile - pleasant, English speaking front desk group, small but more than adequate room and bath. Our rate included the breakfast. It was good, more than ample to get your day started. Never crowded and was served long enough that if you didn't get started early you didn't miss it! I believe it went until noon. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is great - you could enjoy an unobstructed view of Arc de Triomphe from right rooms. The room was seemingly decorated in 1970s or 80s, has nothing to do with "old charm" - it's just rusty. Easily accessible from airport shuttle stop.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, top class hotel, staff so helpful & very polite”
Reviews.Author: kayM_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first class in every way. Wonderful location, staff were amazing, helpful & very professional. Rooms were immaculate. We didn't have any views but the room was very quiet & the air con kept us cool. We were out every day so views didn't bother us. Nothing was too much trouble,if we returned to Paris we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - You could do a lot worse than the Splendid Etoile”
Reviews.Author: atlgeoff
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to rate the Splendid Etoile because many things you just take for granted in a hotel. Your room is supposed to be clean. The TV is supposed to work. Etc. So, it's easy to take these things for granted when everything is as you expect it. The hotel is not extremely special in any way. But, if you're looking for a good hotel that has a great location in Paris, you could do a lot worse than the Splendid Etoile. Location - great. Front desk - great. Room - average (small-ish but clean). Bed - very comfortable. Breakfast - average to good. Overall value - average.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal, staff superb, excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: parizona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just metres from the Arc de Triomphe. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was fantastic, with a great range of foods, including French cheeses. All staff were extremely helpful and friendly, in particular the concierge. Would definitely stay here again when in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God we only stayed one night here”
Reviews.Author: takethatdude
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal to stay here for one night on travelzoo which included free breakfast, a cruise down the Seine and a free bottle of Chablis for a low rate. Let me just say, it still wasn't worth it. A) the hotel is very run down-- our room smelled super musty and hadn't been aired out since the 70's when the hotel seemed like it was last remodeled. B) The staff was mainly incompetent-- we asked the concierge to book us a taxi an hour in advance. He took our tip and said "no problem". Lo and behold, an hour later we come down and there is no taxi so he sends his poor underling to run around looking for a taxi. After awhile we took the metro instead and the poor underling seemed a little miffed we didn't tip him even though he never did find a taxi for us. Hopefully the concierge gave his underling the tip we originally gave him-- yeah right. The bottle of Chablis sucked (we weren't expecting much either), breakfast was okay, and the boat ride was probably the best thing about this hotel. Stay away if you can. We sure will.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: sarahtaylor81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were 1st time visitors to Paris and were told by a friend to stay at this hotel. The location is perfect! Steps away from the metro and Air France Shuttle, 15 min walk to the Eiffel Tower, and 5 minute walk to the most amazing shopping area. It's wonderful to walk out of your hotel and see the Arc de Triomphe everyday! There are many cafes and restaurants in the area to choose from. The hotel staff were the best I have seen! I'm in the travel industry and stay at a different hotel once a week, and these guys really impressed me. My husband and I speak no french and the staff were always able and willing to help us out. We booked all of our tours and Moulin Rouge shows at the front desk which was very easy. They even get priority seating at shows for hotel guests. The rooms are small, but clean and nice. We even got a Welcome bottle of local wine! When I go back to Paris I will for sure stay at this cute, boutique hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel staff with Farooq leading the way.”
Reviews.Author: dash4006
Reviews.Content: Our recent end of May trip to Paris was made even better with the excellent guidance from the Chief Concierge of this hotel Farooq, he is truly a good guy. His recommendations of nearby restaurants and guidance to places of interest in the neighborhood made this trip truly memorable. The staffs at this hotel from the Dining room staff to the housekeeping staff are all eager to please and make you feel welcome from the moment you walk in the door. Breakfast in the sunroom is a great way to start your Paris adventure and knowing the subway entrance is steps from the front door of the hotel is a great feeling. Thanks again for truly making our tip memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt Start Well...”
Reviews.Author: Ace0ne
Reviews.Content: We got a package off of Travelzoo for 189 euros. Hotel looks great on the website. We get there and are shown to our room which was a complete dissapointment. I told the fellow that this room was no better than a high ceillinged motel room. He told me to call downstairs and the girl on the desk was very rude and said they had no more rooms available. I told her that was fine, If she could just refund my money. The fellow told us he would take care of it, we get downstairs he talks to her and voila! a new room becomes available. The new room was much nicer, has a slight view of the Arc, but with the open window/doors is was much more what we were expecting. The only complaints I would have is that the bath/shower is very high, might be a problem for older people and the blowdryer provided is useless. There is internet available. The location was great, closes to the hop on hop off bus and the underground station. Breakfast was provided and was very good.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel ...very clean and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: byerelise
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for location, and value. We booked this on travelzoo and got a fantastic deal which included breakfast and a comfortable room. This hotel was renovated in the early 90s but looks as though it was just renovated yesterday!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, location, breakfast, and concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Fleures14
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is located within a block of the Arc de Triumphe. The neighborhood is safe, convenient to the Air France bus with service to the airports, and has several good restaurants. The head concierge is very accommodating and gracious. The staff are professional. The rooms were in great condition and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: dloncasty
Reviews.Content: metro station right outside the front door. beautiful view from the balcony of the arc de triomphe. walk-to cafes everywhere. very close to champs elysee shopping. staff (all staff, housekeeping, front desk, restaurant) very very willing to assist in every way. ps: get some feather pillows to make the sleeping better

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: ReB0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon. The friendly staff greeted us and immediately informed us that they had upgraded our room as a gift for our honeymoon. The corner room was magnificent, with the most amazing views of the Arc de Triomphe. The room was tastefully appointed with blues and creams, and the marble bathroom was spotless. Our terrace was wide enough to have breakfast on the balcony each morning, overlooking the Arc and the busy streets. The free wireless internet was a treat for allowing us to search restaurants to eat each night. The location of the hotel is great with easy walking access to the Champs Elysses. The multi-line Metro station is right across the street, and there are many great bistros within a few yards of the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable. We were able to sleep with the windows open without undue noise from the street traffic, as the hotel is on a relatively quiet corner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and we will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel enhanced my stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Biker003
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for business, but stayed a few more days for pleasure as my wife came with me for the trip. The hotel is located 1/2 block from the Arch de Triomphe and was visible from my balcony. There is a taxi stand and metro station just out the front door, and a bus stop 2 blocks away. My wife used the Metro to go everywhere. A Les Cars stop is just across the street for easy transportation to and from both airports. Great service. The concierges are knowledgeable and very helpful, all speak English, although my wife tried to speak what French she knew and they even gave some instruction when asked. Room service response time was very fast. The room size was about the size of an average American hotel room, but I understand it was large for a room in Paris. High ceilings, floor to ceiling balcony French double doors which effectively blocked out the street sounds for sleeping. Heating and A/C in the room. Plush bath robes in the room, locking safe in the closet, plenty of space to put clothing. My wife loved the room decor. Good brassierie accross the street for great, less expensive food when we were too tired to go anywhere else. Did not eat dinner at the hotel's restaurent, but their breakfast was very good--room service for one petit dejeuner (breakfast) is enough for two persons if you get an additional coffee/tea. This hotel enhances the Parisen experience if you can afford the price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel Splendid Etoile”
Reviews.Author: sassy340
Reviews.Content: I really don't have a single bad thing to say about Hotel Splendid Etoile. From the location, to the room, to the staff and even the breakfast. We had an absolutely wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: sfsm3105
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family for one week. We had a suite room. The room was OK considering it was a suite but clean and well maintained. I peaked into a single (or double?) room when I passed by and it seemed very small (but so are most of hotels in Paris). All staff I encountered were very friendly, polite and helpful. I really appreciated their willingness to assist us whenever we had requests/questions. The hotel is located a couple blocks from Champ Elysees and there are plenty of cafes and stores around. We had a great view of the Charles de Gaulle from our room. Though I could hear street cleaning noise in the early morning, it was pretty quite. I would definitely come back to this hotel when I have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: s.burns
Reviews.Content: My first time in Paris and got a deal on Travelzoo. Comp. breakfast which was good but would not have paid the 25 euro unless part of the deal. Also a comp. trip on the seine. Room excelent with a large balcony and staff very attentive. Overall a pleasant 2 night stay but will not return to Paris as prices charged for everything there far too expensive. A small beer and a coffee 15 euro!!!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: drharpreet
Reviews.Content: reception staff though cooperative but a bit blunt. our travel agent booked double room for 2 adults, 1 child & 1 infant for 5 days. after entering i was told that hotel does not allows 4 persons even infants in any room & they cannot accomodate us. later they allowed us to stay & provided a baby cot too with 15 euro extra per day. concierge is soft spoken but has vested interest in taxi booking. restaurant is closed after sunday morning. good things about hotel are location near arc de tri. & proximity to metro, breakfast serving staff & room cleaning staff. overall not worth 20000/-per day

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCity80
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations. I got very lucky with the room that was given to me. Excellent view of the Arc de Triomphe. Got a great deal through Travelzoo, would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: jbrynnv
Reviews.Content: Overall we were satisfied with this hotel, the location was great and service was friendly. However our room # 105 was near the housekeeping service room and early in the morning we heard the staff shuffling around in the room. The walls throughout the hotel are thin so privacy is minimal. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was sufficient, the breakfast area is lovely, and the spread changes daily. There are plenty of cafes nearby so you can stroll and have breakfast elsewhere. We can't speak about the view because we were facing the cafe across the way, but the weather was so great we spent most of our time outside enjoying the streets of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location- the best triple room ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Princess147
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, a stones throw from the arc de triomphe and the champs elysees. The breakfast is excellent for a European hotel. Definitely would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with WOnderful Service”
Reviews.Author: AndyHome
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel after a long and delayed trip. Though Paris was rainy and cold, the hotel and staff were warm and helpful. The Concierges were very good and their recommendations were great. The rooms were small but comfortable and the hotel was very clean. They are re-decorating some rooms. We would certainly stay there again and also would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - superb room”
Reviews.Author: CaroEpsom
Reviews.Content: Booked on offer with travelzoo - great deal which included a bottle of chablis, free upgrade and river cruise. Fantasic room with a balcony overlooking the Arc de Triumph. Friendly and helpful staff - we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Hotel, location, service 10/10”
Reviews.Author: ChrisnKarenT
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Arch de Triomphe this typical French Hotel offered everything we could have wished for, Karens 50th birthday surprise was topped off by the attentive and slick service offered in this establishment. Farooq the Cheif Concierge bent over backwards to ensure our stay was one never to forget organising a super romantic dinner trip on the Seine to a once in a life time night out at The Moulin Rouge, in conjunction with Peter the barman NOTHING was too much trouble! In all a perfect hotel to see Paris from book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisienne Hotel, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: Following reviews of this hotel, my partner and I stayed in this property last Saturday and we were utterly charmed and humbled by the hotel's incredibly courteous staff and it's wonderful location and rooms. We were kindly given one of the best suites of the hotel, 606, with four windows with fabulous views over Paris' skyline and the Arc de Triomphe. The location, near Champs Elysees is unbeatable as you might expect, lively and full of shops, cafes and all sorts of entertainment activities and the hotel's deco is very Parisienne, trÃ¨s chic!. Our room was big, bright and incredibly quiet when the windows were closed so we woke up rested and full of energy. I can not recommend this hotel enough for an unforgettable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: MasterDJ
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week long Paris trip. We stayed here in the second half of our trip. The first half we stayed in Westin. 2 hotels so that we are better located for what we intended to do in each half, first the Louvre/Malls/Opera, etc, the second for the Champs Elysee area. It worked out great since we ended up going to EuroDisney for my daughter and RER is literally 10 steps from the Splendid, and the train takes right in front of Disney. Same goes for the shuttle to the Airport.. The hotel has a lot of parissien character, including tiny elevators. Loved it. Room was very clean and furniture might be a bit dated but very well maintained. Had a chandelier even. Felt like staying at someone's house guest room. The view from our 5th floor balcony is like looking at a live Paris poster. We must have taken 100 pictures with my DSLR. The staff is very frriendly. Only thing is that our room did not have a clock.Odd.... we overslept and almost misses our airport shuttle. WIFI worked great, and free. Room Bar charges are reasonable. The star rating for hotels seems to be a bit different from the US hotels, so dont expect too much . Also, contrary to the common perception, it looked like most parissiens knew english well and were all willing to speak, as long as you are not an ugly american, loud and proud, you know who. Over all, very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: LondonScout
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location. The room , staff and overall quality of the hotel was excellent. Huge selection at Breakfast and the food as good as you'll get..extremely well located to walk almost anywhere , the good thing about staying in this location is that you'll always be able to describe it's location to a taxi driver and it's only 10 minutes from Gare du Nord.We had a brilliant time just wandering the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfert Parisien Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Payam
Reviews.Content: Location is really perfect.Just few steps from the Etoile.All transports systems are in front of the door (RER, Metro, Bus, Taxi, Air France Shuttle). There is so many restaurants and cafes around the hotel.From fast food to luxury restaurants which comply with all types of the taste.We have not had our breakfast in the hotel and everyday choose a cafe in around for our breakfast. Staffs are really friendly and do their best to help all the guests and create a pleasant stay for them.All of them are good in English language. The concierge man, Farrokh is wonderful and really help us during our stay. Rooms are so clean and in proper size even with and extra bed.Also the bathroom is so clean and all the towels and blankets smell so good.We have had a nice view from our small balcony to Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & the BEST Concierge in Paris"”
Reviews.Author: gingii
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently spent four days and three nights at this hotel and we were amazed by how helpful, friendly, and overall superb the staff was, especially the chief concierge FAROOQ. Farooq speaks over six languages, always has a smile and knows EVERYTHING about Paris. We had heard that the food was great in Paris but on our own we only seemed to find the bad restaurants, we asked Farooq to reccomend a good, yet affordable, restaurant and he recommended La Fermette Marbeuf. It was AMAZING!!! Overall we LOVED this hotel so much that we will only ever stay there if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Only good location”
Reviews.Author: tripsthetruth
Reviews.Content: I stay here for four nights. Its location is excellent. But NO AIR CONDITION IN WINTER ONLY IN SUMMER. I`ve just known because the temperature of Paris is high to 15-17 degrees celcius. I have to open the door on the balcony. And it is very noisy all night. And the reception is rather cold just do on duty not the service mind. I am very upset for this hotel. It is lower than the standard hotel I expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: RAM1997
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel in view of the very favourable reviews on tripadvisor - not disappointed at all. Room excellent, with balcony looking towards the Arc de Triomphe. If you arrive by Metro or RER, exit subway at 'Charles de Gaulle Etoile' station by lift to 'Ave Carnot' - three steps to hotel ! The Louvre is closed on Tuesdays. Be aware of the gold ring scam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent views of the arc de triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Emmmmmmmmmmma
Reviews.Content: Was so impressed with how easy it was to find! Excellent views of the arc de triomphe from our balcony. Lovely staff who were really helpful. Very nice breakfast too. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - choose the right room”
Reviews.Author: TheRoliingMcStones
Reviews.Content: Super-easy to find - immediately opposite the bus stop from CDG airport, friendly welcoming reception; walked into bedroom with shuttered windows, opened the shutters and found a jaw-dropping view of the Arc de Triomphe, from a room on a corner with a balcony - even the loo had the view! Unbelievable! Very comfy bed, excellent bathroom, and very good breakfast. Colleagues did not fare so well with their rooms. Also I was not aware of air-conditioning, and it would not be a good location to sleep with open windows becasue of the traffic noise. But windows shut in winter, no problemo!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Indeed”
Reviews.Author: pmarti
Reviews.Content: Great location. Shuttle from airport dropped us right across the street and the metro is also across the street. Great room with view of Arc du Triomphe. Good service from staff, clean and roomy in our superior grade room

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SandrineLondon59
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and every single time, it is perfect. Great staff, great room, lots of good sleep because it is quiet, great bed, powerful shower, great views on the Arc de Triomphe, great breakfast - also very Parisian in style, a great insight into Paris overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,best view and great service”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUK_London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Spendid Etoile Hotel in Paris and was so happy of my journey. Located at 2 mn walk from the champs Elysees and 10 mn walk from the Congress Center Porte Maillot where i attended a congress.Air France buses are just in front of the hotel and can get you to the airport in 30 mn.Taxis,Metro and buses also in front of the hotel.Of Course, best is walking along the champs elysees until the Louvre! I had a great room facing the Arc de Triomphe, wich was absolutely wonderful specially at night.Rooms seemed to be recently renovated, large, bright and elegant. Special word about the service wich was very good.They were all friendly,available, helpfull. Very good breakfast and chic restaurant. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ECXELLENT !!! One of my best place to stay .”
Reviews.Author: dcjdmlc
Reviews.Content: Great city location, Amaising view on the " Arc de triomphe " , big rooms, very nice, superbe marble bathrooms, great staff there ! very good restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: travellady18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our friends just returned from a wonderful trip. We found this hotel through Travelzoo and can not be more pleased with it. We arrived from an overnight flight from the US and were greated by Farooq and the other staff with smiles and laughter. They were able to check us in early (2 rooms) and to top it off, they upgraded our rooms to the balcony with the most amazing view of the Arc. We had the deal through travelzoo that included breakfast, bottle of wine upon arrival, and tickets on the river cruise. We were extremely pleased with the rooms. the staff, and the location of the hotel. The rooms were very clean, although as mentioned in some of the reviews the walls are a little thin. But it's an old building in Paris, what do you expect. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again on our next trip to Paris! Thank you to the staff, you were all so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “central location to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ali097
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband spent 3 nights here last November. Location is perfect. From the aerport we took the air france bus which stopped directely accross the street from the hotel, just beside the arch de triomphe. No need for any taxis. Our bedroom had a balcony from which you could see the arch, beautiful sight. We spent the following two days on the red bus - hop on hop off - which stopped at the arch also. Had a bit of trouble finding the exact spot of the bus stop on the first morning (it is right at the top of the Champs Elysees) this gave us the freedom of the city for the two days. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel so cannot review the food in the hotel. Service was perfect, rooms were perfect, location perfect - a little costly! but then you tend to get what you pay for. No problem walking at night - very safe area as far as we could see.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: BOBK888London
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here over the New Year Holiday,we could not have been more pleasantly surprised.Excellent only begins to describe every aspect of the hotel.The location is the best,the property is perfectly naintained,the room was far better than the price and the staff would make any owner proud.We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Maceo69
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and felt in love with the typical haussmann architecture of this Hotel. It is so close to the Arc the Triomphe and The Champs Elysees that our stay was a delight. The surrounding streets and area appear to us very safe and very close to many main Paris sites. The well renovated room and bathroom suited our needs perfectly and was charming, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast offers various choices and enough strength for a long day of visit througout the streets of Paris. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. We are very happy with our stay at this Hotel and for sure we highly recommend it to anyone who wants to spend some nice days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowPopy
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal from Travel Zoo for this hotel. Got the Air France coach straight from Charles de Gaulle airport to the Arc de Triomphe. Hotel was directly opposite. Room lovely-balcony allowed us to see the Arc de Triomphe to the right. Bottle of Chablis chilling on arrival and 2 free tickets for a Seine cruise-all part of the TZ deal. Staff were lovely and very helpful. There is nothing to dislike about this hotel. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RW254
Reviews.Content: Splendid Etoile was a great little hotel. Great service, very pleasant people. Room was spacious, very nice and charming . Everything was clean. In from of Champs Elysees , and right around from the Metro. Very convenient location. The breakfast buffet was amazing. Tons of delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “BE AWARE”
Reviews.Author: lboniface
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in december and i will confidently say i will never stay here again, we had the most expensive room in the hotel and and the service was awfull. For a start when we arrived there was someone in our room fixing the radiators, then the heating did not work so they gave us boiling hot electric heater even thought they knew we had a small child running round. the room service food was not good, there was no coffee making facilliies in the room, and the shower was not working properly. Upon checking out i told the reception management all these thing as was told that i was wrong in everything i said and even thought we paid Â£400 for one night would not do anything about the price. I have one word for this hotel APPALLING!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cookingmdmom
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel at an excellent rate through a deal on the internet,. It was excellent value, inculding breakefast, bateaux mouches, upgrade if available. One room was upgraded, the other was not. We added a third person to one room and the staff accomodated that nicely. there is a cozy bar off the simple lobby of the hotel. the staff was very helpful and friendly. We particularly enjoyed Farouk. we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Christmas Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jwboyde2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this Hotel mid December and we had the most excellent break. The Hotel is situated slap bang next to the Arc de Triomphe and has metro line 2 right ouside the front entrance to the Hotel. Breakfast was included in the nightly tariff we paid with Travelzoo. The actual price of our room per night was actually 390 Euros but with Travelzoo we paid a mere fraction of this. Breakfast and the hospital of all staff was excellent and would very much want to come back here the next time I venture back to Paris. 10/10............spot on!

Reviews.Title: “the most romantic geaway”
Reviews.Author: rads127
Reviews.Content: we stayed in their superior double room which had a direct view of .the arc the triomph from the room and the balcony.at night it use to look so beautiful and the view wasjust mind blowing .imagine saying at champs elyees and getting a view of th arc the triomph fm theroom wha else does one want!

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: diggerypots
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for Paris. The location is great, right next to Champs-Elysees. The staff are really friendly, Farooq in particular. Our room was super, with a view of the Arc de Triomphe, from the balcony - although it was chilly! The hotel can be expensive, but it is possible to get good deals in advance. Try to get a roon upgrade if available.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Dappealman
Reviews.Content: I will preface this by saying that there are a lot of positives to this hotel. The hotel location is excellent...it's next to the Arc, feet from the metro, and literally caddy corner to the Air France shuttle to the airport. Convienence is important, and this hotel has it. The staff was also excellent. They were very nice and informative. Still, at some point you must analyze the hotel itself. We stayed at the hotel 3 nights. The hotel room suggests a 340+ euro/night rate. Anyone thinking of paying that should be institutionalized. You can hear through the walls, hear the water run when someone showers/flushes, and the temperature controls in the room were limited. When I went downstairs to ask about the room temp, I was told nothing could be done, so we had to open the windows to avoid sweating. Maybe that's 4* accomidations in France, but it's below average accomidation in every other major city I've been to. And 25 euro/person for breakfast is unconscionable. I am not a negative person (see Villa Emilia barcelona review) and do not like being negative about this hotel considering the kindness of the people. We got a great rate on travelzoo and breakfast was included, which made the overall rate acceptable. But there is no way on this earth that this hotel is 4* material in any other major city I've been to. High 2, low 3*.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amoras
Reviews.Content: This 4* hotel is situated almost on the Arc de Triumph place! Thatâ€™s why its rooms have a fantastic view! Especially those were on the upper floor as the 6Th, where we stayed (Suit 608). It costs 400â‚¬/night, however there are budget rates. The Arc is Great â€“gorgeous-impressive & under the lighting it becomes very Romantic! How it canâ€™t be so beautiful when you have this view exactly in front of your window? You can also see the half Eifel Tower on the right, playing with the light & having its 21:00 show. Because of the Area, there is a little bit noise, however itâ€™s gotten past by the closed windows. The decoration of the room is in Parisian style so itâ€™s cozy & romantic. Bathroom is very big and all space is clean. There is room service & the staff is very friendly! Breakfast is also good! The Metro of Paris serves your city tour (as a tourist) & itâ€™s so plus to have a station outside of the Hotel (Red Line A, Saint De Gaulle-stop-)! Also there is an underground crossing that gets you at the beginning of the most Glamour & Romantic Avenue of the word, thatâ€™s of Chumps Elyse! It is sure I would stay again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoolsideBoston
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-night stay in Paris with my husband and daughter who is studying in London. What a great location! Steps from the Metro station and the Arc de Triomphe. Got a great deal through Travelzoo. We had a 2-room suite with plenty of space. The bathroom was spacious and modern and our room had 2 floor to ceiling windows with balconies. Our rate came with a bottle of wine, 2 tickets for the Bateaux Mouches boat ride on the Seine (which was fantastic, especially at sunset) and a substantial buffet breakfast. The staff was fantastic -- friendly and accommodating. The hotel was spotless! Another great perk is the airport bus pick-up directly across the street. The ride costs 15 euros and only makes one other stop on the way to the airport. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lulumidlands
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 night break at this hotel with my husband and sons. Transfer from Paris airport was good with Air France bus leaving from directly outside airport building-13euros each o/w taking us directly to outside the hotel (approx 30minutes on Saturday) leave at least 1.30hrs for any midweek return. Also metro/train link available but you will have to change and not much cheaper. If you are going to The Moulin Rouge direct metro to Blanche directly outside hotel. Try for front hotel rooms which have great views especially of the Arc de Triumph and no street noise. Good breakfast and plenty of choice. Excellent reception staff and would definately go there again-hope we do!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Polly-the-Scot
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights. Overall very good hotel. The hotel had an aura of quietness and elegance. Booked a superior room for 3, was extremely clean and comfortable. With the feeling of a small suite, the 3rd bed was located in the attatched lounge area, with TV/table. Both rooms had attatched balcony. Bathroom was lovely, couldn't fault it. Staff were very polite and welcoming, and all on the reception desk spoke good english. We were even offered an umberella, which it was raining. Breakfast was included in our stay, and we had the choice of going to the resturant for a buffet breakfast, or having it delivered to the room. Very quick and efficient service by waiting staff with lots of choice. Excellent location (as previous reviews have stated) with the Arc de Triomphe a 2 minute walk away. Tip- Visit in the evening, wonderfull views from the top, especially of the Tour Eiffel (with its light up show) and the Champs-Elysees. Tip- for British people, most resturants/cafes in the main tourist parts are extremely expensive, considering Â£1= 1 Euro. A drink of coke = 6 Euros!!!so be prepared to spend. Overall a lovely stay, with impressive buildings and lots to see.

Reviews.Title: “A truly splendid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: imawati
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hotel Splendid, and I continued to be amazed at the attentive service they provided to us. We traveled with our 10-month old baby girl so we want to be sure the accomodation was comfortable for our daughter. We got a spacious room # 507 with wonderful view of Paris. A nice, clean and sturdy crib was ready for the baby. We wish we could stay longer. We stayed in Paris for only one night before catching our flight back to U.S. But our stay at Hotel Splendid really put a memorable ending to our 10-day vacation in France. We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: BostonLatcho
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. I booked this hotel with the breakfast package. The room is not big, but not so small that you canâ€™t move when you put your luggage in the room. The bathroom is updated and clean. If breakfast is not included, donâ€™t need to spend â‚¬25 for it. Itâ€™s cafÃ© everywhere even across the street. Currently, i guess due to the low seaon, they've use the restaurant for breakfast area, but it pretty nice. it's a continental breakfast, you can't expect too much. The air france bus is right across the hotel. If youâ€™re taking the train, thereâ€™s elevator can go up in front of the hotel. Just buy a train/metro pass, you can take the metro to everywhere. I take the metro to Versailles and even the outlet mall. People at the hotel is friendly. Too bad the internet charge is â‚¬8 per 2 hours. So I walk down to mcdonalds (which 2 blocks away from the hotel) itâ€™s free wireless, but no outlet for your battery. If you just want to check your email quick. Thereâ€™s a small room at the lobby, you can use it for free, but the keyboard is in Frenchâ€¦â€¦. One other thing is you have to left your key at the front desk whenever you leave the hotel. â€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: citygalyorks
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay 2 nights in a 3 star then through a Travelzoo offer I received spend our last 2 nights in a luxury 4 star. The hotels were worlds apart in every aspect. A beautiful hotel, classical in it's design, luxurious and every detail taken care of. The staff were very attentive greeting us with a free bottle of Chablis as we went up to the room and presenting us with our free Seine boat trip tickets (all part of the offer). The rooms were very spacious - huge bed, large bathroom and the option of breakfast served in the room which we took full advantage of. The restaurant served excellent fine-dining cusine and seemed to attract alot of outside custom as well as hotel guests. Okay it was extremely expensive in the restaurant and bar but if you fancy splashing out as a special treat this is a fab hotel to visit. The Arc de Triomphe is practically on the doorstep as is the metro only a few steps away. The bus stop to CDG airport is just across the road and you can buy your tickets from the hotel reception. I loved it here and would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel,”
Reviews.Author: ilovemyholidays80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Splendin Etoile Hotel for our honeymoon and truly loved it. It has the most courtious, friendly and efficient staff we have come accross in a hotel in a large city for a number of years. Benji could not have been more helpful when we wanted to book tours; or when the noise of he painters upstairs woke us too early (8.00am), Farouk moved us immedaiately to a room with a better view. You guys are great and it was our pleasure dealing with you.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at the hotel was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jamnotts
Reviews.Content: We had just one night at the hotel it was a surprise for me from my husband he requested a room with a view, we got a wonderful room with a fantastic view it could not have been more perfect,the room wasn,t massive but it was lovely decor and spotlessly clean,the staff were very helpful and did everything to make sure my stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: LLSL
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room at this hotel, which is marvellously situated literally feet away from one of the exits of the Charles de gaulle Etoile metro station. The room was a reasonable size (for Paris), split into two, so that the extra bed was in the living area. It was very clean and comfortable, and magically quiet for being so close to the Arc de Troimphe. The reception staff were always friendly and pleasant. The room cost 310 euros per night without breakfast which was a whopping 25 euros (so we ate at nearby cafes). pricey, but perhaps we were paying for the sound -proofing? Overall however happy to stay again if the pound starts to recover against the euro!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sfminhas1
Reviews.Content: I traveled with family and we were allowed a better room by the concierge, who is amazing and is very helpful. Ask him if you need any help on where to go. We did not go to the breakfast they had because we thought it was a little pricy, but there is an enjoyable patisserie or bakery where you can find amazing croissants and pasteries at the end of the street. The room was amazingly comfortable also, although we did not get the room with the arc de triomphe view because we had three people in our group, but right when you leave the hotel, you see the beautiful structure. Also, there is a shuttle bus from the airport that stops in front so you don't have to grab a taxi with all of your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: markpowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights late September for wedding anniversary treat. only an hour on the train from CDG - very easy and the train stop is across the road from the hotel [dont worry its underground you cant hear it] our room had a view of the arc de triomphe - we didnt pay any extra for this! hotel staff lovely and very helpful - couldnt do enough to help. breakfast was great too. couldnt fault it, close to tourist attractions - 1 min from arc, 15 min walk from tower, champs elisee 1 min walk, bars etc minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with a very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: janeneottaiano
Reviews.Content: This was easily the nicest hotel for the money that I've experienced in my numberous trips to Paris. The hotel was elegant, clean and located centrally to many attractions. The staff were very helpful in providing directions, calling taxis and giving general information. The room was large and very comfortable with beautiful decor. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR VIEWS AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: rom76
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were on our 10 yr wedding anniversary trip and i selected this hotel from the reviews on the hotels website. AMAZING. We werent disappointed. We requested Room 507 (as suggested in some of the reviews) and we were NOT disappointed. 3 balcony doors and a breathtaking view of the Eiffel and the Arc de Triumphe. The hotel Conierge, Farooq, was exceptional. He booked our Moulin Rouge show and the River Cruise and it was amazing. He was extremely helpful. We would Definitely stay here again on our next visit to Paris. Location a hop, skip and a jump away from MANY things, especially the Champs Elysee shopping strip. Dont go past this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Margil6559
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the Travelzoo Top 20 list and couldn't have been happier. The hotel is beautiful. It's less than a block from the Arc de Triumphe and the service was outstanding. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: LeighOkc_ok
Reviews.Content: Front desk service was outstanding, great attention to every detail and service. Room was clean and all service items were at hand. Location of the Hotel was a plus because of ease of access and egress.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid intro to France at the Splendid Etoile!”
Reviews.Author: 2hounddogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Splendid Etoile for 4 nights at the beginning of September and had an excellent time. For us, with a deal from Travelzoo, it was a great value for this hotel. The hotel is just a block from the Arc de Triomphe and as we had an upgraded room, we were able to see it from our balcony. Beautiful! The staff at the hotel was very friendly and the service was great. They even helped us with our French phrases when we asked. Our room was very nice and good-sized by French standards. You really can't beat the location. As I mentioned, right by the Arc de Triomphe and a metro station is right across the street. Most of the lines to the major sites go through that station, so it was super convenient. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris with a smile”
Reviews.Author: JSJ1
Reviews.Content: I must admit that we got a special rate thru travelzoo which included an outstanding breakfast (really the best that we've had in France with eggs and smoked salmon). The room was reasonbly large with an excellent bathroom and a view of the arch de triomphe from the balcony. Even though we faced the street, the double-paned windows kept the room very quiet. Even though it is near the champs elysees,the neighborhood was very real. But the thing that makes it an outstanding hotel was the warmth and helpfulness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: jbmm
Reviews.Content: The Staff was wonderful! The location ideal. Everything was great except the mattresses in the room. Very uncomfortable...need to be replaced with better quality. Our backs hurt each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - excellent position - wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HamlynTenerife
Reviews.Content: We both enjoyed the trip immensley - pity we are not able to go back to this hotel as I need a "walk in" shower because of my disabilities and this hotel doesn't have a room with one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Dannydoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendid Etoile for our anniversary. It was perhaps the best location. Close to one of the biggest subway stations in Paris. Room had all the amenities we would expect in the States. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Room was small but very clean. Shower had great water pressure. We were able to check in at 9:30am. This was huge after having traveled over night from Philadelphia. I was very happy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelalotnow
Reviews.Content: We had a problem the first night b/c the a/c was broken and room extremely hot. Desk person was not helpful at all. The rest of the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Also it is extremely expensive to use wireless in the room. There was a terminal in a closet by the lobby that was available but it was hot and uncomfortable to use. We were told that most European hotels are providing free wireless and were disappointed at the charges here. We stay in contact with our office and needed the computer and brought a laptop but the way the cost structure was it was not good for the business traveller. The room was very small but for what we paid it was an excellent value. We found the rooms and the entire property to be very clean. The breakfast was excellent and in our case included with the room. The location is great too!

Reviews.Title: “I was hoping for good and I got great”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyMaryland
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at the Splendid Etoile. Our rooms were lovely, with balconies and great views of the Arc de Triomphe. The staff were incredible. They went out of our way to make our stay perfect. They were so nice to all of us. The location is excellent. It is right across the street from the metro. The breakfast buffet was tasty and had something for everyone, including hot dishes. I travelled with my husband, 7 year old son and mother-in-law who has difficulty walking long distances. The tour buses were right around the other side of the Arc; very convenient. The rooms were decorated very nicely and were a good size. Everything was clean. The balcony windows were made well and blocked all the noise from the street. The mattresses were comfortable. There are a good number of restaurants close to the hotel - all at different price points. We travel a lot and I was not expecting such a great hotel, with such great staff and such a great location at the price we paid. If we go back to Paris, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable pillows”
Reviews.Author: JoJo889
Reviews.Content: Personally I prefer the standard pillows. The square shape pillows provided are good for looking at but not comfortable when sleeping on them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Staff and Location!”
Reviews.Author: loriperth
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel which was located just steps away from the Arc de Triompe - fantastic for transportation with the RER and Air France coach service just steps away. Also the hotel itself and the staff were fabulous. We lost our luggage on arriving in Paris and the staff were extremely helpful letting us make calls etc and also tracking our luggage via the website. The rooms were of a good size and the airconditioning worked! The breakfast was also very good with a wide range of choices. I would certainly stay here again if I ever went back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Jumped up and down with excitement”
Reviews.Author: lovestravel15
Reviews.Content: Upon entering our 4th floor room we were stunned with how tasteful and inviting the decor was and then when we stepped out on to the balcony I jumped up and down with excitement over the amazing view of Arc de Triomphe/Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. Concierge staff were extremely helpful, breakfast was decent. Bathroom was gorgeous. A great value for the price. Would stay again and recommend to friends. Very conveniently located next to the bus stop for the air france bus to/from airports too.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieBoo
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic spot in a fantastic city. Although it is expensive, if you haven't been to Paris it is an ideal way to experience it in a a typical Parisian hotel with great service, beautiful rooms, and that view of the Arc! To be able to step outside the hotel door to all required transports is brilliant too. Paris is obviously a city to walk around, but it is nice to be able to get a direct and inexpensive bus from outside the door to the airport/return. Only extra I would like to see is internet available in room for free - the pricey room charge should cover this little requirement to make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: m_toshi
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, facilities and service. Right next to Champs-Elyse, and convenient for night life, great cafes and restaurants including breakfast. Station and taxis and even airport bus are very close as well.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back to this hotel anytime I am in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheClan88
Reviews.Content: My friends and I engjoy the time that we have staying in this hotel. It is very convience for shopping, eating, and others. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. In addition, I will go back to this hotel whenever I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “In Paris I'll never stay anywhere but Splendid Etoile Hotel ever again!”
Reviews.Author: santamonica51
Reviews.Content: We had the most enjoyable stay EVER at your hotel last week. Your front staff - especially Benji - helped make our touring easy and fun! He was so helpful to us and gave us many good tips to get around Paris. Thank you for a beautiful room with a fabulous view. Thank you for making our little Paris holiday the best! Laura Strauss

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smilad
Reviews.Content: I got very interested in the hotel from reading many positive feedbacks on trip advisor and honestly they all came out very true. 1) Great location: I got the superior double room I reserved over the net and it was perfectly located right in front of the arc de triomphes; just glorious. 2) Great service and hospitality: everyone of the staff was so friendly and helpful when it comes to guiding us to find our way in the city. 3) Room was perfect: not very large but it just fit us perfectly (my wife, baby daughter and myself). We weren't in need for more space as we weren't spending much time in the room. I didn't try the breakfast there it's a bit expensive but overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: Prolix50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 20-25, 2009. Rate via Travelzoo special was 141 Euros/night (this was an August special I think), including an upgrade to a superior room if available (it was) and breakfast. (Breakfast otherwise at 25 Euros/person was way overpriced. The continental portion was good, but the eggs, bacon, etc. were unappetizing. If breakfast isn't included in your rate, go to the cafe across the street which has a continental breakfast for 1/3 the price, or a full one for 1/2.) The superior rooms were very large for Paris - the standards looked small per the fire escape maps in the hallway. Bathrooms were modern (tilt the glass shower wall a bit into the tub to avoid water all over the floor), but the room looked a bit tired. We were on the first floor and could only see the Arc by leaning way out the balcony. The hotel's website has good photos, but make it look a bit more spiffy than it really is. Others have said the windows are soundproofed, but they are not. There are just two set of French door style windows which do block out a lot of the sound, but on the first floor, the cars could easily be heard. It's far enough from the Arc that you don't hear cars from there, just on the streeet, and August traffic wasn't bad. Noise from adjascent rooms is easily heard - we couldn't sleep two nights due to a Nigerian party of some sort in the rooms above us. We complained to the front desk to no avail; other than that, they were helpful. There's a free computer in a booth off the lobby for internet access, but the French keyboard is a bit of a pain. The location is great with the metro/RER stop right out your door, as well as Air France coach buses to CDG or Orly. The RER is cheaper and faster to CDG though for sure and the connection at Chatelet - Les Halles is easy - just cross the platform. So unless you have a lot of luggage, I'd suggest the RER. If you do take the bus, buy a round trip ticket to say about 6 Euros/person. Best nearby meal we had was at Le hide, one block down Carnot then first right, and right at the next block intersection on your right. Great food for 2 or 3 course menus for 22/29 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LTDiaby
Reviews.Content: When they say a room with a view, this truly lives up to it. Great location, staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely. My only criticism would be that the bathroom could do with a slight updating - tile grouting was grubby. Not something that would spoil the visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: kngo
Reviews.Content: As many of the other reviews had mentioned, the view from the hotel rooms of the Arc were amazing!! I had a 4th floor room and the view itself was worth the money. It was definately not a cheap stay. There is no free internet and the hotel staff speak enough English. The elevators are quite small. The housekeeping staff entered our room several times during the day while we were gone and personally, it was a little uncomfortable. The room was pretty quite, considering it's location, except for the teenagers next door who were causing a lot of noise! Don't know if I would stay again, but the views of the Arc are worth experiencing once.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Normally_happy_Irish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Arc the Triomphe and therefore lots of good Metro/RER options. Rooms are clean and a little "opulent" apart from the size (e.g. antique style light fittings/furniture). It it an expensive part of town so breakfasts etc in the area tend to be pricey. The "standard room" is small but quiet (looking out over the "courtyard" i.e. other buildings). No real amenities in the hotel so you might be better off with a well rated 3 star hotel - closer to Notre Dame if you want a bit more life and less upmarket prices. All in all, not a bad hotel though. Staff were friendly and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErnieBerlin
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed our stay in the hotel Splendid Etoile even though the description of its location was misleading. We walked around the whole Etoile with our luggage and could not find the place and nobody knew it. In the end it turned out to be just in the next street to where the busses from the airports ORY and CDG arrive. (The bus driver didnÂ´t know the place either). We think, that the official rate of 380 Euros for the room is a bit over the top, but who cares- we paid much less, thanks god ( or :Travelzoo). We liked the breakfast which was almost german style, we liked the bottle of Chablis in the room that we finished off on the little balcony at night with the view to the beautifully illuminated Arc de Triomphe included. And we certainly liked the location so close to Champs Elysees and all the major attractions and the Metro-Entrance in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our room had a spectacular view of the Arc de Triumphe”
Reviews.Author: bwlee
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Splendid Etoile Hotel - the location was convenient (close to the Metro) and even though we were so close to one of Paris' largest tourist attractions, our room was very quiet, as was the general area. The view of the Arc de Triumphe was amazing and the room was clean and comfortable. The beds, however, were not what one would expect for a 4 star establishment. We upgraded to a superior room thinking we would have a larger bed, but the upgrade must have been the view because we had 2 very hard twin beds pushed together with substandard pillows. All in all, however, we thought this a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: sotasan
Reviews.Content: Took the wife down to Paris for her birthday (based on reviews here), and we weren't disappointed. Location is great with Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee a short walk from the hotel. View of the Arc from our room was breathtaking. Area is relatively quiet. Our room was clean and bigger than we expected. Hada little trouble with the lights tripping off at night. Room service had it sorted out within 5 minutes. Front desk staff extremely polite and spoke great English. A bit pricey (our room was EUR185/night, but you get what you pay for. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Splendide Etoile est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: katfone
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved everything about this beautiful hotel. The view from our 5th floor room was terrific - we saw the Arc de Triomphe right out the window and the Eiffel Tower just to the right. This was especially breathtaking at night. The balconies on every room allow for great views no matter which floor. Our room had a sizeable bathroom, which was a bit of a pleasant surprise. The front desk staff were extremely courteous and professional. They were willing to help us with any concerns, and though we tried our best French, they offered assistance with translations as well. The hotel was a recommendation to us from friends who traveled here last year, and we are anxious to speak to them and thank them profusely for their wonderful advice.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Splendid stay in a truly splendid position”
Reviews.Author: A.McMurray
Reviews.Content: With stunning views of the Arc de Triumph and placed directly oppsite the Air France Bus stop (runs every 15 mins and only has two stops) you would need to look hard to find a hotel in Paris with a better position. Added to that the room was very clean, positively huge by Parisian standards and comfortable with a good sized bathroom. Farooq from the Concierge found us some fantastic places to eat well away from the usual tourist traps. My only gripe would be the breakfast - so after the first mornings frugle overpriced offerings we stumbled upon a marvelous Pattiserie 50 yards down the road and 40 euros cheaper! That said overall this hotel is an excellent base from which to explore Europes prettiest capital..

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough good things about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jtlivin
Reviews.Content: One block from the Arc d'Triomphe, across the street from the Charles DeGaulle metro station, and easy walking distance to Champs Elysees. The location is impeccable. The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful during our 6-night stay here. The room was certainly large enough to meet our needs, was very clean, and our balcony had a birdseye view of the Arc. We had a free buffet breakfast with our stay which was excellent. I can't say enough good things about my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Indeed”
Reviews.Author: PSFarquahr
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in the Splendid Etoile and this time was even better than the last. We booked early enough to take advantage of a Superior Room with a view of the Arc d' Triomphe. Not only was the view fantastic, but the room was clean, quiet and commodious given it's exceptional proximity to the Champs-Elysees. The other wonderful thing about this hotel is that the metro is literally right outside the front door. The breakfast is a bit pricey but the food is excellent and provides a substantial start to your days of touring. To top it off, the staff is very friendly and incredibly helpful. I highly recommend the Splendid Etoile!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in PARIS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ukesoccer
Reviews.Content: We spent our first week of our honeymoon at this hotel, it was expensive, but worth every penny. The location can not be beat, We were on the 5th floor and we could see the Arc from our bed. If money in no issue, dont spend a second longer looking for a good hotel this is it. Close to Metro on the corner from the most famous street in the world and view of the Arc... truly magical...

Reviews.Title: “Would never go anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: ottawalove2travel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I very much enjoyed our time at the Splendid Etoile. We spent a week there and the only negative thing I would have to say would be in regard to the servers at breakfast. They were the only unpleasant people we came in contact with at the hotel (and in Paris), and even after a week of smiling at them, being pleasant and speaking french to them, I couldn't break the barrier they put up!!! The hotel was beautiful, the front desk service amazing (especially Farooq), and the view from our room (306) fabulous!! The room and bathroom were much larger than I expected, and even though the beds were a little harder than we were used to we actually never slept better! Don't look anywhere else!!!! You won't regret your stay here!!! (Oh, and make sure you check out the stairway - absolutely remarkable!!)

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jmajka4
Reviews.Content: I was referred to the hotel by a friend who had stayed there last summer. I am a very picky customer when it comes to accomodations and amenities. To say I was completely satisfied is an understatement! The hotel itself is small and inviting. The room was ample size and spotless. As for the staff, each individual was more than helpful and spoke perfect English so we never felt "lost". Overall, an amazing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Parisrocks
Reviews.Content: Our room was adequate. Housekeeping was excellent as was the concierge service. Breakfast was included but not particularly exciting. The same runny scrambled eggs and undercooked bacon were served everyday. Actually, all of the food items were the same everyday. We stayed nine nights so it was pretty monotonous. The breakfast room staff members were very kind and willingly provided eggs to order, hot chocolate and cappucinos. We were close to a supermarket, metro stop and patisserie. It was great fun to stroll down the Champs Elysses, which was a 10 minute walk from the hotel.
