There was a laptop set up near the lobby with free internet and we used it often to check email, weather and flight information. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MMVMom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a great rate through TravelZoo. It included breakfast, bottle of wine, and boat ride for two on the Seine. There is a metro elevator right outside the door and you catch the Air France Bus right across the street, and you can purchase your bus tickets at the front desk. The staff was helpful, the hotel was spotless and spacious. It was also quiet, even though it is half a block from the Arche - I would NOT recommend driving around the Arche to get there as my friend did - my life passed in front of my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location, and bathroom including”
Reviews.Author: Michaelgogo24
Reviews.Content: A few more english channels for the lingually challenged traveler ;-) Overall the staff was very good and friendly. They accomodated my every need and that can be no small feat!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better - seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Irvine-Robbie
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport at 2:30 on Bastille day and the room was ready. There were to people working the front desk and one of them brought our luggage to our room. The room was AMAZING! It had a direct view of both the arc de triumphe and the eiffel tower (about a mile away). The gentleman who brought the bags said that it was the nicest suite in the hotel (room six hundred and six). Be aware that the suites are far smaller than American hotels, however, it comfortably fit 4 people. You should also note that the stay was not cheap (Four hundred twenty euros total - we paid extra to fit four in the room). But for a first night experience in Paris on Bastille day to watch the Eiffel Tower fireworks from our room was pretty great! You should also note that we are pretty low maintenance travelers. We ask for food recommendations and that is about all. If you want to be pampered because you are paying a boat load of money, perhaps this place is not for you. It does not appear to have a huge number of services beyond a beautiful room (in our case) breakfast (which we did not eat at the hotel). We used the wireless web access for 2 hours which costs 9 euros. We had difficulty signing on and someone showed-up at our door within 2 minutes to help us connect. I thought this was very good! My entire family loved the hotel. In fact, they wanted to stay there for the entire month of our vacation, but I told them that twelve thousand euros was a bit too much!

Reviews.Title: “awesome view!”
Reviews.Author: sroy1110
Reviews.Content: our room had an amazing view of the Arc! The room was beautiful and well maintained and the staff was knowledgable and willing to answer every question we had! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, expensive area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: bee50
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay. We went on a promotion that indicated a room upgrade possibility and were disappointed not to receive one. The room was well appointed and a good size, especially for Paris. It is a good location for the Metro, right across the street. The restaurants in the area are expensive and not that good thus the area was a disappointment but the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and superb view in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SSR-RI
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, my second stay there for business. I love the location - right across the street from RER, Air France shuttle stop, lots of great walking, shopping, and eating in ANY direction. Breakfast is good, beds are comfortable, the front desk staff is extremely nice and helpful. One wierd thing happened - a woman came to my door around 6 pm one night, saying she was doing a "room inspection". She spoke no English and couldn't tell me why she was there, I wouldn't let her in. I was on my way out the door so I never mentioned it to the front desk, I don't know if she was legit or not. I really wish I didn't have to pay for internet access here - its free in so many hotels, you would think a high-end hotel in Paris would offer it as well. Particularly since the entire city seems to be a free wireless zone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: KEBmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience staying at the Splendid Etoile Hotel while in Paris. The location can not be beat. The room was lovely and very comfortable. We could open the window onto a small balcony. We booked the room after seening an add on Travelzoo. The price was hard to believe for such a nice hotel. Breakfast was also included. The metro is directly across the street. We would go back without hesitation...it was tres bon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: rwaites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid on our first visit to Paris. The location was amazing - across the street from the Arc de Triomphe, right on the Champs Elysee, and a Metro station entrance next to the front door. Yet, the hotel is tucked into a quieter tree-shaded corner of a very busy part of Paris. The sleeping rooms were much larger than any of the new or newly remodeled hotels in central Paris. Thankfully the hotel had not been "remodeled" like many others which in the process cut their room sizes in half. The hotel staff was just great. Anything we wanted was provided within literally seconds. The concierge staff was very helpful. We really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Room was spacious, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: spicyone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. We were treated very well and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary European Trip”
Reviews.Author: RarinT0G0
Reviews.Content: Our 5-day stay at the Splendid Etoile in Paris was the second leg of our trip. Our room was lovely (and immaculate), with a small balcony and view of the Arc de Triomphe. The location is fabulous (metro stop in front of the hotel), and the hotel staff very helpful. The breakfast (included) was excellent, but with a 5-day stay, a little variety would have been nice. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lindabend
Reviews.Content: Look no further than this hotel for a guaranteed perfect stay. The location was superb, one min from arc de triomphe and cart rouge tour bus stop. Great restaurants nearby. Hotel had very efficient air con and we needed it at 37 degrees. Staff were nothing short of superb, friendly, helpful and genuinely interested in making your stay perfect. Nothing was too much trouble, ever. I consider myself fussy but cleanliness was exceptional. Buffet breakfast was inc in our price making it a super deal. I would recommend it 100%

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel near to many places”
Reviews.Author: George81Lyon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb, very clean, the room had a view at arc de triomphe. The staff was very helpful. The location of the hotel is very good, near to metro station, near to champs elysees street. Very good location for shopping as also for traveling by metro.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Couple0703
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! They answered any and all of our questions throughout our stay. They also helped us book some fantasic seats for the Moulin Rouge! My only gripes are that the walls are very thin, so on two seperate mornings, we could hear the person in the adjacent room getting violenly ill, not a pleasent wake up call at 7 AM. Also, we had purchased a package online for our room that included a free bottle of Chablis. We ordered it and enjoyed it, but at check-out they tried to charge us for that and the use of our mini-bar, which we did not use. They did however fix the mistake and did not charge us for those items. Overall, our stay was lovely and we would return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, nice rooms, friendly service, a gem”
Reviews.Author: fvusa
Reviews.Content: Once again enjoyed my stay, they did everything they could to accomodate I had room 508 which means higher floor, thus quieter, lighter and better view. Room 507 has a better view of the Arc de Triomphe but a one bedroom. Room 508 still has a great view (partially obstructed) but the room is bigger (bedroom + small living area with fridge-desk-sofa). King bed was comfortable. The breakfast was fine, breakfast staff could be friendlier (hey, you're in Paris...) but they are efficient overall. I still can't figure out why the coffee pitcher has a little hole at the top, and thus drips on the table cloth every time you put it back on the table. Go figure Internet is available downstairs in a small room without a chair: eventually I thought it was a good idea as you did not have to wait as long to get access to the computer Elevators are SMALL, thus you make friends in there, very close friends :0) I tried quite a few hotels in Paris, and I must confess that it is a great hotel per parisian standards: the rooms are quite large (always ask for higher floors), the staff friendly and helpul and the view can be wonderful. Of course if you want the most incredible experience, ask for the suite 608 which has the best view and is quite romantic (not high tech or trendy hotel) A gem in my opinion Great little hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: bfit80
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on ratings from Trip Advisor. It could not have been more conveniently located for our 3 night stay in Paris. We took the Air France shuttle bus from Charles De Gaulle airport, which dropped us off right outside the hotel, for 15 euros per person. We could have taken the same shuttle bus back to the airport when we left, and booked it at the front desk, had I known this was available. There is a metro stop right outside the front door of the hotel, so each morning it was very easy to travel to whatever part of the city we planned to visit that day. A bit confusing on the way back if you don't pay attention, because if you exit the metro in the wrong place you can end up far away from the hotel and it can be quite a walk around the Arc to get back. But we finally figured it out after the first day. As other travelers indicated, the view off the balcony was spectacular, and totally made the trip: the Arc d'Triomphe is right there! The metro runs very consistently, so you are able to get anywhere in a matter of minutes: you could even visit Versailles on the metro. Just be sure to buy the Visite Pass which includes Zones 1-6, not just 1-4. The front desk staff was very helpful, despite our broken French, and helped with booking restaurant reservations. The room, though small, had wonderful full length windows that opened onto the balcony; when closed they totally soundproofed the room. We had a triple; 3 twin beds all pushed together in the center of the room. The beds were small for my husband and 23 year old son, and rather firm (I had bruises!) but you are so tired from walking all day it doesn't matter. The shower, as we learned later in the trip, was very good: a handheld system but anchored to the wall above your head, with a full shower curtain. Most of the other hotels we stayed at in France had the low-set handheld unit and no curtain, which made showers a challenge...lots of water on the floor. Good water temperature and pressure. There is a fridge in the room, which is nice if you need to keep anything cold. Overall we were very pleased with our choice. FYI: If you plan to visit the Catacombs, as we tried to do on our last full day, note that although they state they are open until 5 pm, they stop selling tickets at 4 pm. Even if you are in line before that time, they will not let you in after 4 pm. There were about 24 of us in line at 3:45, thinking that if we were in line by that time we would be OK. But the men working turned us all away at 4:00 sharp. So be sure to get there early, because you will be disappointed if you don't. Also note that many things are closed on Mondays; be sure to check on those things that are critical for you to see, to make sure they will be open when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: SH2727
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location. We booked a standard room and were very pleased when we checked in to be given a room overlooking the Arc du Triomphe. It was so close we could almost touch it, but thanks to good double glazing couldn't hear the traffic. The room wasn't overly modern, but that is it's charm. We ate in the restaurant in the evening. Whilst the food was quite good, the restaurant was lacking in atmosphere. It was incredibly quiet with us being the only ones there at one point. Breakfast was a bit disappointing with a few bits of cold meat and fruit and a basket of bread. It looked like it needed replenishing but no-one did. However, all in all I would recommended this hotel for it's charming rooms and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: submariner66
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and service. We wished we could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Malkahase
Reviews.Content: Though the room was very small (typical of Paris), and lacked sufficient drawer space, it was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The breakfast was excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: DanDans
Reviews.Content: My partner and i were swept away by the charm and romance of Paris and this hotel most definitely played a part in that. The staff were very helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast was fabulous. This hotel is in an excellent location within easy reach of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. You can get the shuttle bus straight from Charles de Gaulle airport to the same street the Splendid Etoile is on (the bus stop is opposite the hotel) so this saved us taxi fare. We would stay again and would both go back to Paris in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, service, room & food - Mom & 14yr old daughter”
Reviews.Author: SDLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Helpful, courteous, English-speaking front desk. Steps to Metro and Air France Bus! Great location-felt safe. Wonderful breakfast - get it included. View of the Arc de Triomphe from room balcony!! Great cafe across the street open breakfast till late evening! (also great service there) Large bathroom, spacious room w. 2 balconies & high ceilings. In room safe. No problems at all. Only negative was the room, though non-smoking, had odor of cigarettes. I would love to stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Easter . . . EVER”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Our parameters for staying in Paris were simple . . . something centrally located, two rooms - each with a roll-away, and clean rooms. This hotel met all of our expectations and beyond. The Metro stop is literally right outside the door of the hotel. Views of the Arch di Triomphe were amazing AND there were several places to get an inexpensive breakfast with great service (however the place directly across the street should be avoided). The staff were always courteous and even gave the boys business cards with the hotel's information should we become separated. Overall, the stay was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “I ll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: frogy22
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for few days and decide to stay at the â€œSplendidâ€� hotel due to its prime location & good recommendations (from French colleagues). I booked a standard double room for 2 nights at (April 24th & 25th). It has been a long time since I did not sleep so well in a hotel!!! I travel a lot and I believe Silence, Cleanliness and Comfy Beds are a must. I was not disappointed â€“ I had a illiant stay!!! The room was spacious & comfortable; personnel were friendly and very accommodating. Here is a four stars hotel with a four stars services and location: I ll be back

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaECalifornia_USA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean, location was great concierge was helpful, as another traveler wrote WiFi should be free considering cost of room that was a disappointment I was not going to pay 9 euros for 2 hours of usage go to McDonalds around the corner for free or any park.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: johnyboyEarth
Reviews.Content: we used the hotel for three nights. great location, very nice and clean room with view of the etoile. quality breakfast and most of all - fine service. All personnel were friendly and helpful. Most of - Yasser - who suggested great ideas for the kids - thanks! I will certainly stay there on a future trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Splendid etoile”
Reviews.Author: hdjgihgfs
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good and very friendly staf. Rooms are clean, big en comfortable beds. Nice view (arc de triomphe) RER station in front of the door.

Reviews.Title: “This a hotel will make your stay in Paris fantastic”
Reviews.Author: silkyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally located for the underground ,airport bus, Paris sightseeing bus,restaurants and a great pastry shop at the bottom end of the street. The concierge is the best I have ever struck. What a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: tomeden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, it is clean and has everything you need for a stay. Staff were very helpful. Mini bar was well stocked and cheep compared to the rest of Paris. Would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms, great view, friendly staff, and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AG02Traveler
Reviews.Content: We got the superior room with the view of the Arc (worth it). Room was good size by Paris standards (much bigger than my friends shoebox by the Louvre) and very clean. Staff was nice and helpful. Good breakfast included with our room (we booked through the hotel's site). Location is INCREDIBLE. Large metro station across the street. Air France bus from airport drops off and picks up next to the hotel (lucked into that).

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view of Arc De Triomph”
Reviews.Author: Spry_teacher
Reviews.Content: Actually a stirring view of Arc de Triomphe from my room! My room number was 407(superior room), and I was able to take a wonderful look at the arc itself and an illumination-lined vista of Champs-Elysees at the same time from the balcony. The room was not so spacious, but tidy and cozy. It's very convenient the AirFrance bus stop for "Les Cars"(shuttle buses to and from CDG) is right in front of the hotel. And I was really glad to hear that one of the hotel clerks spoke to me in some Japanese like "Oyasuminasai (meaning "Good night")".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishC0uple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Splendid etoile for 3 nights over the New Year. I can thoroughly recommend Room 606 (The apartment) as both the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower can be seen from the room. This hotel is ideally located if you want to go to Paris. It is right beside the Arc de Triomphe and the Air France bus stop (bus runs from Charles de Gaulle Airport to the Arc de triomphe). A metro stop is also less than a minutes walk from the hotel which is great after walking around all-day. A special mention must go to Chief Concierge Farook - he couldn't have been more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “love the service and cute room at splendid etoile hotel paris”
Reviews.Author: tetsumaru
Reviews.Content: when we are travelling there are 2 things we expect from the hotel, first the service and second the room. Splendid etoile hotel paris has made us felt welcomed in foreign country and foreign customs, the concierge was very friendly and helpful and the room although it was smaller than we expected was cute and charming with the chandelier on the ceiling. we think the lobby interior need to be improved by making it brighter and as charming as the room, to get more luxury appearance .Lobby is the first area that guests would see and first impression is important. In Indonesia specially Jakarta and Bali, the hotels lobby are always luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid by Name, Splendid by ...........................”
Reviews.Author: kevinsteer
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of this hotel on this site we were expecting a very nice hotel and were not disappointed. The location, just off the Arc de Triomphe, across the road from the nearest Metro (Charles de Gaule E'toile), was excellent. The rooms warm, welcoming and very nicely appointed. The staff friendly and helpful. The breakfasts catered for everyones tastes, cold, hot, cereals, fruit, cheese, meats, eggs, bacon, sausages, croissants, juice, tea, coffee etc etc. We went to Paris for 3 nights to celebrate the New Year and had a wonderful time. We travelled on Eurostar and the only down side to the whole trip was the huge queues for tickets for the Metro once we arrived at Gar du Nord. Had we known we could have bought them at St Pancras once we had checked in for Eurostar, won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Found friendliness in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ginge-Barney
Reviews.Content: Rooms and breakfast were very good. Chief Concierge Farook deserves a special mention - he couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Very limited French was not a problem in this hotel. Just outside the front door was the Arc de Triomphe. Could walk to some attractions but Metro just outside the Hotgel's door. Went to Paris for the New Year celebrations and to celebrate my birthday with 6 friends. Excellent location to see New Year celebrations in Paris

Reviews.Title: “good location and service”
Reviews.Author: yaoka
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with the services and circumstances of the hotel. Sure to come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerr'smeadow
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel. We specifically requested the same room as our last trip (our little secret) which was granted. The first week in December was very cold and I was delighted to find that the room remained at a comfortable temperature 24 hours. The hotel is perfectly situated, close to the metro, airport bus, restaurants and of course, the Champs Elyses. Would love to see Tea and coffee making facilities intoduced to the rooms, otherwise I would not change a thing. If the Splendid Etoile is the 'Crown' of Parissien hotels, then the jewel in that crown is the chief concierge, FAROOQ. Nothing is too much trouble to Farooq and his knowledge of Paris is infinite. His restaurant recommendations were spot on and were based on our tastes. Can hardly wait until our next visit to the Etoile.... Peter and Valerie Whiteside, N.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hollyday”
Reviews.Author: eutuelnoivoiei
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Slendid as ever”
Reviews.Author: marvfish
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to The Hotel Splendid Etoile and we found it as splendid as ever. Beautiful, spacious, well maintained rooms, friendly staff, convenient location, what more can you ask for? We have traveled all over the world, including seven trips to Paris. The Splendid Etoile has become our "Paris home."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MaxGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Etoile for 5 nights in October 2008. We chose the hotel for its location and on the basis of favourable traveller reviews. It turned out to be a great choice! The hotel is small, quiet, yet centrally located on one of the avenues radiating from the Arc of Triumph. The metro/RER station (Charles de Gaulle Etoile) is right outside the main entrance of the hotel. From this station you can get directly on the RER going to Eurodisney; the jounrey takes about 35 to 40 minutes. The Air France bus service from Charles de Gaulle airport runs from just across the street. There is also a taxi rank just a few meters up the road. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for 23 euro per person (which is somewhat expensive) but does have a good selection of croissants, baguettes, cake, cheese, ham, cereal, scrambled / boiled eggs, fruit, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. The hotel also has a restaurant open for lunch/dinner and there is a great variety of cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Our room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean. The gentlemen at the reception were very friendly, polite and eager to help, give directions, call a taxi etc. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the Splendid Etoile and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Lift Episode!”
Reviews.Author: melianfinz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location and the view from our room (no 606 ) on the 6th floor was fantastic. We however got stuck in the lift on our first day for 10 minutes which was very very frightening. The notice inside the lift says 4 people max, so my husband, myself and our 2 friends got in and promptly got stuck !!! The reception staff got us out THANK GOD within 10 minutes but they were very upset for us as they have been asking the hotel management to either upgrade the lift mechanism or place a notice stating a max. of 3 people in the lift for ages and they have done nothing so far. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable and the staff are very friendly. The breakfast was good with lots of choice. My final commets are that the bar should be open on Sunday nights, not closed and there should be tea and coffee making facilities in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: Debbie024
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Splendid Etoile hotel to celebrate our 28th wedding anniversary. What a wonderful time we had. The hotel was great, rooms lovely and comfortable, nicely decorated and the breakfast was very good too. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Farooq the Chief Concierge. We went on a fantastic dinner cruise on the Sunday evening, recommended by Farooq. Champagne on arrival, then we boarded the floating restaurant for 2 hours cruising up and down the Seine whilst we were served a wonderful meal. The lights of Paris by night were fantastic. We also bought a 2 day pass on the open top tour bus, which took us round all the main sights. You can get on and off as you please. We also visited the Louvre which was amazing. On our last night we found a great restaurant - La Cave Lanrezac, just round the corner from the hotel, serving fabulous french cuisine. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Paris. What a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed!”
Reviews.Author: sandknitz
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at Splendid Etoile and am so grateful I did! Since this was my first trip to Paris and I was a woman traveling alone, I did a lot of research and read many reviews prior to booking my hotel. Splendid Etoile far exceeded my expectations! While it may seem a bit pricey, it was worth every penny! First, its location is incredibly convenient . . . the Air France bus from CDG drops off right across the street and the RER/Metro station is a few steps from the front door. In addition, I was easily able to walk to the Arc, the Champs-Elysees, the Bateaux-Mouches on the Seine and the Eiffel Tour. You can also catch the les Cars Rouge minutes away on the Champs-Elysees near the Arc. I was very fortunate to get a corner room, so I had a magnificent postcard-like view of the Arc de Triomphe through my floor to ceiling windows which I left open during my waking hours while in the room. Day and night, it was mesmerizing. I appreciated the intimate lobby. My room was lovely and spotless. The staff was very attentive and the concierges were all so helpful! The perfect ending to my magical trip happened my last afternoon there. After returning to my room and throwing open my windows to breathe in a little more of Paris, I was treated to a sun shower immediately followed by a huge double rainbow out my window over the Arc. This was a life long dream fulfilled, and the Splendid Etoile truly enhanced the entire experience. I look forward to the day when I am able to return with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Etolie is splendid indeed!”
Reviews.Author: mariavp
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the hotel. The staff were helpful, courteous and professional. I was very impressed that a room was ready for me at 9hrs as I had just arrived from an overnight flight. Room was very large especially for European standards, though the hotel is older, it has nice elegant French charm. Location could not be better- lots of boutiques, restaurants and bars nearby, plus shopping at your doorstep. I would highly recommend and would certainly come back to Splendid Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Etoile is Splendid”
Reviews.Author: ErnieNW
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave us excellent service and is in a fantastic location for access to all of Paris and transportation to the airport. The only possible deficiency is the hardness of the mattress on the bed and that is a personal difference that others may disagree on what they like. It was a great experience and I would plan to use the hotel anytime I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location!”
Reviews.Author: PennyDubai_UAE
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed in this hotel was due to it's wonderful location and reasonable standards of service and quality of establishment. We read quite bad reviews of other nearby hotels and this hotel seems well rated. We did not get dissapointed since we already got familiar with the Europe hotels in this case Paris hotels being crampy with small bathrooms and stuffy too. But Splendid was great! The view was not as expected since we upgraded our room but nonetheless I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good location at a reasonable price. However, don't judge the hotel by the pictures on the internet which in most cases they take the best room pictures and they have many types of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Friendly Staff, A Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: camp708
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Splendid 4 times over the past 6 years. Each visit has been consistenly good. But price escalation is becoming a big issue. Looked at several other hotels in the area with better pricing which will be given greater consideration for my next Paris visit. Cannot beat the location and convenience to transportation. The room, staff and cleanliness were all excellent. Take the Le Cars (Air France Bus) from the CDG airport which drops off across the street from the Splendid! Nice restaurants in the area on the side streets from the Arc de Triomphe. Overall a great choice if price is not a huge consideration. Great website for direct booking.

Reviews.Title: “a decent, predictable hotel but there may be better options”
Reviews.Author: Cilantro_and_Lime
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 5 nights at the Splendid Etoile Hotel in September of 2008. I'm being generous by giving the hotel at 4 rating, but 3 wouldn't give it justice either. I guess I expect a lot, seeing as it is my vacation. Our room, an upgraded twin double, had the largest room of any we stayed at during our month-long excursion to Europe. If you are looking for a good tourist hotel where you want something predictable but good, I'd stay here, but there are better options for my tastes. The guy who greeted us was extremely friendly--he's the one previously mentioned by others. We were able to book the hotel at the last minute, which made me worry just a little bit. While I couldn't really find fault with the accommodations or the hotel (yes, the bathroom needed a little updating, and the bedding was only average), I felt that something was missing. As this was my fourth visit to Paris, I have something with which to compare this visit. First of the all, the location is not my favourite; although it's right next to a Metro stop, the place is away from the action so you can't just stroll to anyplace except chain stores and tourist restaurants. You're likely to see a lot of people from your own country, if you know what I mean, which might not bother you. I much preferred staying in the St. Germain area where we stayed at Hotel de Buci one night before renting an apartment in the area. It's much more interesting. Second, the hotel obviously catered to North American tourists so much that it lacked a certain Parisian flair I was expecting. It was a little too predictable for my tastes. On the plus side, the service was attentive, courteous, and made us feel welcome, the room was huge and very clean, and the view when you leaned to the side of the balcony was great. On the down side, the location was a little boring, the decor was a bit tired, the price was expensive for the experience. If you are planning to stay for a week, which you really should plan for, consider renting an apartment in the St. Germain area. Don't we all want to pretend that we live there? This way you can shop for your own breakfast, have a nap in the afternoon if you want, and buy your own flowers for your table. Oh, by the way, the Hotel Splendid invited me to leave my comments here. Kudos to them!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zadny
Reviews.Content: All the staff were great - so friendly and helpful. They even managed to get us tickets to the Moulin Rouge even though we asked at 5pm on the same weekend as the Tour de France with all sessions already fully booked. The rooms were great - nice and quiet, and the housekeeping staff seemed to clean the room and replace the towels every time you left it. The location next to the Arc de Triomphe can't be beaten. Only 2 minutes walk to have a bottle of champagne on the Champs Elysees. We loved every minute of our stay and will definitely return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome first experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: megmarc
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was my wife and I's first trip to Paris, so I have no perspective on what other hotels are like and my compete basis of comparison for making this reservation was TripAdvisor. The location is awesome, because it is on the Champs Elysees, but also because it is right across from a Metro, which we learned will take you anywhere. The areas around the hotel were great for finding great shopping, cafes and an afternoon bottle of wine. We stayed a week in late September in room 309, a Jr. Suite located on the 4th floor. We did not have a view of the Arch but knew that and preferred the Jr. Suite. I must admit that our first impression of the Jr. Suite was disappointing as it did not look as grand as the picture on the web site, but we soon got used to it and were very very happy with our choice. It was a bit expensive, but I'm guessing that is just Paris. The bathrooms appear to be reasonably new and are very well appointed. I was pleasantly surprised just how well done they were. We asked that the twin beds be converted to a king which they took care of for us. The appointments are minimal but very efficient. We had two very grand windows, one in each room, that opened up onto the street. Our view, while not of the ADT, was of a normal Paris street, and we found it very nice. The adjacent room was small but also very efficent and included a TV, mini bar and small table. All better than we expected. The in room internet sucked but they have a free internet station downstairs that was almost always available and it worked great. We did not request the breakfast package and did not use the bar, so I dont have any thoughts on those. The strength of the Hotel Splendid is the staff. They are remarkable. Some of the nicest people I have ever encountered in a hotel. We have traveled extensively and I would match them up against anyplace we have stayed. The front desk staff made you feel at home every time you entered the hotel. They helped us with everything from how to ask for something in French to how to request a refund of the VAT tax on purchased items. They were always friendly and helpfull. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDCS
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in September. I have stayed in a number of different hotel in Paris and this is by far and away the best. The location is fantastic - views of the Arc de Triomphe as other reviewers have mentioned. And the Air Fance bus from the airports will leave you practically at the door of the hotel. The rooms are a good size ( we were able to fit an extra bed with no problem), and spotlessly clean. Beds are comfortable. Again - bathroom is a good size and very clean. Breakfast was included in our rate and is very adequate. I was worried about whether the room would be noisy from traffic outside but this is not the case at all because the rooms are double glazed with shutters. The staff are to be highly recommended - they could not have been more helpful with any queries we had. And special mention to Farouk who went out of his way to accommodate us. Overall I would say that in its price category you will not do better then the Splendid Etoile in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pres13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six nights in September and had an absolutely wonderful stay. The staff at this hotel are absolutely world-class, always friendly, and go out of their way to assist with any and every detail large and small. Special kudos to concierge Farouk (hope I'm spelling that correctly) who arranged a wonderful dinner cruise for my fiancee and I on the night of her birthday and was most helpful with our every request. The room was spacious, spotless, and outstanding, offering a wonderful view from the balcony of the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is located in a great area, with several terrific restaurants and bars all withing walking distance and the Metro is literally right out of the front door of the hotel. I have visited Paris on several occasions in the past but have never enjoyed a stay as much as I did this time. This is our hotel in Paris from now on, without a doubt. Can't say enough about the place and the staff. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The4Amigos
Reviews.Content: We booked the Splendid Etoile after reading other reviews on trip advisor. We stayed for four nights and had a fantastic time. The hotel was excellent, staff friendly and helpful, rooms beautiful and spotlessly clean. It is ideally located; the Air France bus stop is right outside, as is the train station. It is within walking distance to all the sights and there are many nice bars and restaurants within the vicinity. The hop on hop off open top buses are a great idea to get around Paris priced at 24 euros for two days (the bus stop is at the top of the Champs Elysees) We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Oh so splendid”
Reviews.Author: Wendixie
Reviews.Content: After a months travel thoughout France, my goal upon returning to Paris was to find a hotel that was 1. near the Air France Suttle to the airport (13 euros one-way) 2. not over priced and 3. close to the Metro station so we can move around Paris easily. The Splendid Etoile Hotel exceeded all of my requirements and then some. This is a fabulous hotel with an excellent staff. Upon our arrival, the hotel manager upgraded us to there best suit (Room 606) and when I walked in, my month dropped open. I could not believe the size of this suit and to top it off, the view was spectacular. We not only had a view of the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower, but also on the day we stayed we could see from our window the TOUR DE FRANCE because the suite also has a view of the Champs-Elysees which is about 5 minutes from the hotel. It was not the best view of the race, but at least I can say I saw it up close and personal. Oh I forgot to mention that they have FREE access to the internet if you use there system located on the first floor. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Splendid is a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: IGOR_F
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel! As a gift to my parents I took them to Paris for a vacation, and we stayed at Hotel Splendid, which I found online through parishotels.The pleasant experience started from the reservation confirmation email by Francoise, fully accomodating my additional requests and making me feel comfortable and sure of their customer service. Upon our arrival, the chief consierge Farooq was pleasant and extremely helpful in helping us settle in, describing the surroundings, making great recommendations of sights for us to visit and best ways of getting there. I must say that the whole staff of the hotel is absolutely terrific and assisted us with every single detail of not only staying at the hotel, but making other trip arrangements as well. The room on the top floor was spacious for three, bright and turned away from the busy sounds of the Champs Elysees. The view of the Arc de Triumph through the window added a phenomenal charm to our stay. Room service was terrific in detail. We came down every morning for a hot breakfast, which included all the major palette teasers - from fresh pastries to cold cuts, the cheeses of course and sea food, fresh juices, omelette or cereal, great coffee and friendly staff. I can go on and on, but one thing for sure - the stay was terrific, hotel offers great accomodations, the staff is professional and courteous, and I am definitely coming back! -Igor Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Maybee520
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to Paris, my husband and I booked a superior room, requesting a direct view of the Arc, at the Hotel Splendid Etoile. After much fretting over whether or not the hotel and room would live up to the reviews, that I poured over on this site, I can report that our 9-day stay (7-21 to 7-29-08) at this property was absolute perfection. We checked in to Room #507, which had a wrap around balcony accessible from both the bathroom and the bedroom, and the most beautiful and direct view of the Arc de Triomphe that anyone could hope for. As a bonus, because we were 5 floors up, we also had a view of the Eiffel Tower. The view literally took my breath away, as I had not expected such a treat. We had a large closet with multiple shelves and full length mirrors, a safe, mini-refrigerator, both a desk & table with chairs and a large double bed with a great mattress. The bathroom was huge, with the best water pressure of any shower I have ever experienced in a hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and I didn't want to leave! Right outside the front door was the Metro, a taxi stand, the Air France bus stop, and access to the RER. Everyone of staff that we came in contact with, were attentive, friendly and welcoming. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Excellent Etoile!”
Reviews.Author: Finaghy_blue
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Splendid Etoile Hotel for six nights in July 2008 and cannot over-state how wonderful a stay it was. The hotel is located just a few yards from the Arc de Triomphe and so very handy for site-seeing in this area, it is surrounded by great bars and cafes with plenty of choice but at the same time quiet and peaceful at night. Just across the road is the Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro station which meant that getting around Paris by train was very easy and handy so this hotel is perfect for the site-seeing in all the different areas of the city. The staff at the hotel were always friendly and wonderfully helpful. Special mention must go to Farooq the Chief Concierge of the hotel who was charming, helpful and friendly in everyway. If you are going to stay at the Splendid Etoile seek him out and he will help you arrange everything to make your trip to Paris a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but..”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of June in room 309. The hotel is about 1 block from the Arc de Triomphe, but unfortunately our room wasn't on a floor where you could see it. The building in front of us blocked the view. For the price, I expected softer beds. Other reviews mentioned that they are hard. They really are hard and low to the ground. We had a 2 room suite. The first room had 2 twin beds and the second room had 1 twin bed. The second room would have been nicer if there had been an air conditioning vent in it. It got fairly warm in there. Each room had a small balcony. They were nice, but you couldn't leave the windows open all night since Paris seems to have endless sirens going. Besides the sirens, the hotel is next to busy streets. With the double windows closed, this is no problem. The bathroom was nice. We never did figure out what that one fixture was (it didn't seem to be a bidet). It was hard not to get the floor wet since the shower only had a half door. It also took a while to get hot water. The staff was pretty nice, especially when we had trouble opening the door, danced on the entry stairs, when the air conditioner lost power, and when we filled the bathroom with wet clothes (they later found us a nearby laundromat). The elevator really only holds 3 people, so they have to bring your luggage on a separate elevator. We never tried the breakfast. The location is convenient for several restaurants, a convenience store, and of course the Champs de Elysees. The hotel has Wi-Fi, but we didn't bring a computer. We enjoyed their free internet computer, but it was in something of a closet with no air conditioning and you had to stand. Overall, it was nice, but having stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regencia before, I would chose that one instead.

Reviews.Title: “terrific place, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrazAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to Australia after a 4 night stay at the Splendid, and Splendid it was too....echoing all of the favourable comments on this site, I would add that I was more than pleasantly suprised by the size and style of the room, and can confirm again that Farouk is extremely good at his job- by the way, he used to be a fast bowler in Pakistan, and was considering going to Australia for coaching by Lillee and Thommo- he chose Paris and the hospitality industry- good new for all of us I'd say.... Anyway, back to the hotel. We stayed in a superior room, room 403- with the exceptional view of the Arc from the balcony- probably fairer to call it a balcony rather than a terrace by the way, wouldn't really be able to hold a cocktail party out there! The room was MUCH bigger than I had expected, should even impress Americans. It had an entrance hall, bathroom off it, and a door to the bedroom that could be shut, so there is an extra level of privacy from the bathroom to the bedroom if you get my drift. Good size wardrobe, good flat screen TV, but dodgy air conditioning- we couldn't get it to move from freezing or off, but to be honest we are low maintenace guests, we reported it once and then didn't worry about it again. Fussy people would probably be whingeing round about now I expect. Tiny lift up- as per usual in Paris- charming lobby, bar area, and a little ( unairconditioned) phone box size room with an internet connected PC ( free to use) for all those people who aren't bringing laptops on holidays with them, but still need to check emails etc. As per this sites advise, we didn't eat at the hotel- Farouk in fact pointed out a great breakfast cafe down the road a bit , where he goes- much better than the place over the road. It really is ridiculously handy for transport- RER station right outside the door, Cab rank 10 metres away, metro stop 200 metres, and the 14 euro Air France bus to CDG airport just over the road- brilliantly located. We strolled under the Arc to the Champs Elysee for people watching, and visited quite a few of the local bars/ bistros where the Euro's were on TV every night. Anyway, I would stay there again like a shot- that's how good it is- well priced for what you get, and fully worth its high rating on this site- au revoir Hotel Splendid Etoile!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gem of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eklektra
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a fantastic, quiet neighborhood just one block from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and is surrounded by many fabulous cafes and restaurants. The front desk staff is fantastic and attentive even when the lobby is crowded with people. Farooq is a national treasure and went above and beyond with assisting us. The Air France bus stops directing across the street which provided easy, hassle free transportation to CDG/Roissy. They dropped at our terminal. There is a cab stand and a metro stop steps from the hotel... actual steps not a 15 minute walk steps. A walk to the Eiffel Tower took about 20 minutes. The Louvre and other places of interest for us took about 45, but Paris is a city for walking. All rooms do not have a view of the Arc. Sadly ours did not, but it was spacious and comfortable just the same. If I recall 207, a superior room, had the postcard view from the terrace. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bernardbbk
Reviews.Content: We came for the second time and I must say that the service has improved A LOT. We were greated with a smile and everybody was FRIENDLY AND ATTENTIVE. We will CERTAINLY come back . KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK

Reviews.Title: “A Nice weekend in Pairs”
Reviews.Author: Unver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the very center of the city just across the famous Arc de Triumph. Acess to the hotel from the CDG airport with the buses of Air France is very easy. They stop just at the corner of the street. The buses are comfortable and cheap relatively to taxis. The room I stayed was a superior one with a balcony and a view of Arc de Triumph. The room was quite large for a couple even with a child. The only bad experience we had was about the hair dryer in our room. It was not operating and when we asked for a new one they said that they can not get a working one and they did not. Altough the room was clean and well decorated it requires a renovation in coming one or two years. The concierge was helpfull and depending on whom sits on the front desk you could get english speaking stuff (This is something extraordinary in France) Overall, it is not cheap hotel but if you want to be in the city center and have ease of access to both metro and buses it is good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful and amazing”
Reviews.Author: Stanislaw
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the base of superb references on tripadvisor and I made no mistake at all! Nice staff, nice rooms, absolutely SUPERB location, most of rooms have view on Arc de Triumpf, you are directly on metro and bus connections to airport and street is quite quiet! For the same price you can get much worse hotels in Paris. I would definitely return to this hotel, and please note, I Â´m quite demanding customer.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in paris”
Reviews.Author: chopper1Dublin
Reviews.Content: have been to paris a number of times but this hotel is the best i have stayed in---the staff including the concierge are amazing-farooq is friendly,helpful and the best front man a hotel could ask for. rooms are spotlessly clean -well provided with good viiews and a great location right beside the arc de triomphe with a metro station directly across the road--even air france have a stop for coaches to take you to cdg airport. we will be going back here sometime soon--well done!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--everything you want to know”
Reviews.Author: feminic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights here in November of 2007 for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We booked our flight and hotel package through Travelocity and decided not to upgrade from the standard room. We bought the round-trip shuttle bus tickets from Air France, at the airport, to take us to the hotel. Visit the Air France Shuttle website to find where the ticket window is in the terminal. It was very, very easy as it drops you off across the street and the buses run very early in the morning until very late at night and it's got to be the cheapest way, less then 20 Euros each. Our room was small, #408, but a good size for a European hotel. It was just the right size for us. It had a very roomy closet and safe. We had a double bed instead of 2 twins. We had a beautiful balcony overlooking the VERY busy street below, but when the doors were closed we heard nothing! We had a very, very partial view of the Arc de Triomphe and were satisfied with that. There was a mini-bar which we used to store our leftover cheese and wine. We used the wine glasses from the mini-bar every night and they were replaced with new ones each day. The bathroom was spacious except for the toilet area behind the door--it was a little tight. The hot water was reported as coming and going, but we didn't really have a problem with this. Sure, sometimes it fluctuated, but not intolerable by any means. What we were not told upon check-in was to drop the GIANT room key off at the front desk when you leave the hotel for the day, so keep that in mind when you head out. The staff was very helpful, kind and English speaking. Our room was always cleaned promptly and sometimes twice a day! The hotel is in a good location. Don't fear the metro--very easy and we were there during the transportation strike. We walked everywhere--Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, Pompidou within 30 minutes, 45 for farther out places like the Pompidou-- and it is very doable except for the Sacre Couer area---too far by foot, VERY easy by metro and the metro pops up right in front of the hotel, or take the stairs around the corner from the hotel door. For affordable wine and cheese, turn left out of the hotel doors and head to the end of the street. There's a grocery store there with a good selection. There's a patisserie across the street from there with good bread and pastries. For a great meal, head straight out the hotel doors, cross the street , go to the end of the block, cross the street again and have the Etoile plate at the Etoile restaurant. You get an appertif, appetizer, entree and dessert for a good price ( not so good with the sinking dollar). For breakfast, there are Brioche Dorees on every corner and they have excellent coffees and breakfast foods at good prices 1.5 to 3 Euros. Paris is very easy to get around and nearly everyone knows some English. It is nice, however, to try to use the limited French provided in travel books. We only had one negative experience with someone who was slightly rude. I spoke French (un peu) and was received well by nearly all.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Paris from your balcony”
Reviews.Author: dropie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based upon the reviews from this website, and was most pleased with our stay. We were afforded a balcony view of the arc d' triumph that was one of the highlights of our Parisian experience. Farooq was as good as advertised, one of the best concierges I've ever encountered. Balcony views are limited, and we booked months in advance with a specific request for a balcony room. This hotel is one of the most convient locales in Paris, with a subway stop across the street and the bus transport to the airport also just across the street. Great dining is within walking distance from the hotel. The photos posted on tripadvisor don't do the view justice. The rooms are clean and large by Parisian standards, and surprisingly quiet. My wife spent her 40th birthday overlooking Paris from our balcony sipping Tattinger champagne and enjoying Belgium chocolate...a memory I will always cherish...Randy Hill

Reviews.Title: “Excellent surprise break”
Reviews.Author: jambo38
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading reviews from tripadvisor for my parents 40th wedding anniversary. This was a surprise present and I was hoping that the hotel lived up to some of the excellent reviews. My parents have returned from this mini break in Paris and they were absolutely delighted with the hotel. They stayed in room 507 which was a superior room and they said this room had excellent views. They could not speak highly enough of the hotel and staff. They would not hesistate to recommend. I found booking the rooms directly with the staff at the hotel amazingly easy and they were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: surf-snowboard
Reviews.Content: Booked it after reading reviews, and it was exactly as described. The lobby was small but the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Going up in their tiny elevator made me have doubts about the rooms, but walking through the door put me at ease. The room was BIG. We had a view of the Arc and got some great night time pictures from the window. The bathroom was 1/2 the size of the hotel room, unbelievable! Great location, and every evening we were able to walk down Champs Elysees. Wouldn't eat at any of the restaurants on the street though. Loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay - trust the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Hacklin1979
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay. We stayed here for three nights over Valentine's day, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris and I would stay here again on my next visit. We stayed in Room 606 which was a suite, and it surpassed the pictures on their website. You walked into a small hallway before entering a large living room, which had many windows that looked unobstructed onto the Arc de Triumph and also in the distance to the Eiffel Tower, this room had a large couch, a coffee table, 3 chairs and also a desk, mini-bar and TV. You then waled through sliding double doore to a huge bedroom, with plasma tv, double bed (the bed could be more luxurious), and then through to a large bathroom with bath and seperate toilet. The location is superb as you are literally a 30 second walk to the Arc de Truumph and 3 minutes to the Champs Elyesses. Also the metro is accross the road. The staff were all extremely helpful, polite and accomating in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kristysf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I selected this hotel after reading the reviews here and were 100% thrilled with it. The room was, by European standards, HUGE and well appointed. The view of the Arc and Eiffel Tower was unbelievable. Everything about it was romantic and perfect. I had never stayed in Paris before, and this hotel was everything I had ever envisioned. The location is definitely not in the "center of it all," but it's literally next to the Arc and Champs Elysees, AND metro station and taxi stand, so it's easy to get anywhere. I've never bothered to write a review for a hotel before, and am doing so just to encourage others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was friendly, room was fine.”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night due to family committments, but the hotel was well appointed and nicely located. The internet did not work in the room and had not worked all week. It would be nice if they would realize that some people do "need" the internet. The hotel is well built, the room would have been probably quiet except I had the windows open! There were two single beds "twin" moved together to make one double bed, and this was not optimal. However, the staff was friendly, the room and bathroom were nice, the facilities pleasant. and the location was good. We didn't eat breakfast there because we had to leave too early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLT9
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, central enough for walking to many must see sights. The balcony and view of the arc make for some memorable photos. We had to wait to get into our room, but the front desk ordered us complimentary coffee and chocolate for the short wait. The rooms are a good size for European standards, but a little cramped with a roll away for a third person. We loved the ease of the shuttle bus stop across the street from the hotel when arriving from the airport; however, if taking a train out of Paris, be sure to pre-order your taxi in plenty of time for an a.m. pickup in front of the hotel. It takes a little time to get to the train stations in morning traffic and we nearly missed our train to the alps due to the fact that it took 30 minutes to get a taxi. Overall a very nice stay. Next visit I think I will split my time between this hotel and another closer to the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Stay HERE”
Reviews.Author: JobiJuJuBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel view was amazing. We opened the balcony and BAM - the ARC. This hotel is just normal without the view so book ahead and get the right room. Check out my pictures from the room - AMAZING. Staff was good but not the nicest. Go to the bar right down the street called the Etoile - pricey but worth it to dance the night away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Zasha
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very convenient location to transportation. We left the CDG airport via Air France Bus which stops right outside the hotel across the street. The Metro is also right across the street. We stayed in room 507 based on another review we read here and we loved it. The room was nicely decorated. We slept with the balcony doors open for the cool breeze and it was relatively quiet, except for the occasional ambulance passing by. The view of the ARC was awesome! When I stood outside on the balcony I felt like I was looking at a painting. There was even a balcony in the bathroom although you could not see the Arc from this balcony. The room and bathroom both were large for Europe standards and they were very clean. Staff are very friendly and efficient. I will definetly stay at this hotel on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EmyKris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris for the first time and couldn't decide where to stay, in the old-world part of the city, or the metropolitan area on the Champs Elysee. So, we decided to divide our vacation in two - we spent half our time in the 6th district and the other half at the Splendid Etoile. After staying in both districts, I know I'll go back to the the Splendid Etoile! We decided to spend the extra money for a superior room, and it was well worth it! Our view was spectacular! We opened our terrace to a great view of the Arc de Triumph! Even our bathroom had an amazing view of the arc! The bed was comfortable, the mini-bar was stocked with goodies, the provided robes were soft and cozy, and the turn-down service was excellent! They also have an amazing restaurant with delicious food and the best rose champagne weâ€™ve ever had! The location is ideal for those who want to shop on the famous Champs Elysee, and thereâ€™s an underground not far from the hotel, so you can easily get to the rest of Paris. While staying near the Arc, take the time to climb to the top so you can see all of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JimD_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was literally across the road from the nearest metro and very close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs- Elysees. We booked a standard room but were lucky enough to have a room with a view of the Arc de Triomphe. Staff were efficient but not as friendly as we had been led to believe from other reviewers. Breakfast offered a good selection but this should be expected based on the cost of the same. We ate in the Hotel Resturant one evening and enjoyed a good meal with good service at at a reasonable price compared with eating on the Champs- Elysees itself. Our room was very clean and decorated to a good standard without any major signs of wear and tear. Overall I would recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed deal”
Reviews.Author: newpip
Reviews.Content: Having spent much time researching which hotel would be best to take my parents to, i felt reasonably confident with my choice in the splendid etoile. Upon arrival I was generally impressed though found the hotel to be somewhat of a mixed bag. Having booked two rooms we were able to experience both sides of what is offered at this hotel. We were given both a room that was well appointed, spacious and with a lovely view and a room that was cramped,damp with a view of an alley. Otherwise the hotel was clean, convneiently located and had friendly staff. I think if you go with realistic expectations and don't fall for the website photos I think you will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Splendidly too quiet for me, though nice for the right person.”
Reviews.Author: Zippyzazoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months ago. It was my first time traveling based on reviews from Tripadvisor.com Well, I learned that I am not looking for the same things as most travelers. Everyone seems concerned with how posh and quiet it is. I am only 34 and when I go out of town, I want to experience the city. The hotel plays a large part in that experience as I am always going too and from it. The neighborhood is nice, but a sleepy bedroom community, for Paris that is. While sightseeing you have to pass all the fun communities with plentiful cafes and parks to come back to the Splendid. I would have preferred a hotel in the 6th, 5th near the Pantheon or Ile de la Cite, after visiting them. There you have more cafes with the chairs on the sidewalks in rows, and art galleries and tons of unique boutiques, bakeries and more. That being said, it may be the perfect hotel for those who want peace and quiet ( though there is a bar down the sidestreet, that you can hear drunks yelling sometimes. I ran to my balcony to watch, excited by the prospect of life, they were too far to see though.) The streets had few people and no street life. Granted, it was August. The Champs is very close, but mostly just a bunch of shops I have here. Walk through it on your way to somewhere. The Arc de Triomphe is close, but once you have seen it... The hotel was nice. I paid a little more than I wanted to because of the reviews on here. I would have gladly paid more for a more idealized Parisian neighborhood and atmosphere. Like on TV, and that is what you get in the other neighborhoods I mentioned. I had some form of junior suite. Walk through the door,then a little cloakroom or place to put luggage and hang coats with a door that shut it from the bedroom, then the bedroom, pretty windows that sealed off traffic noise, a balcony, then to the right of the bedroom is a little sitting room, and off of that the bathroom, which was very nice and large for Europe. Semi-mildewy shower curtain. The room had a balcony and a view of a pretty Cap-Gemini Consulting office building. Nothing at all to look at to the left or the right. Breakfast was good! I liked it. Not too different from other hotels I have stayed at in London. Bins with eggs, bacon and sausage in one small area, and a longer table with breads, meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal and beverages. The entire breakfast room is smaller than most master bedrooms in the U.S. I look forward to breakfast as I like to see the other travelers and get my bearings for the day. There is not a bar that I noticed and no place where other patrons congregate or one can talk to the staff in a less formal manner. Overall, a nice place, but not worth the #8 spot on here in my opinion. Not even close. Tripadvisor needs to come up with a better ratings system besides singles, families and romance.

Reviews.Title: “Big let down”
Reviews.Author: SiWoking
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend and booked a room with a view of the Arc de Triumphe. Lets just say this trip was a massive disappointment. Checked-in and went to the room to find that not only did the room not have a view of the Arc de Triumphe - it didn't have a view at all. It literally looked straight onto a white wall of the adjacent building 5 feet away. I complained at reception that I'd asked and been promised a room with a view of the Arc de Triumphe and had paid a premium - was told that all rooms were fully booked and there was no possibility of being moved. Apart from the room, the breakfast was very disappointing as well - the whole place was just a let down considering we'd been expecting such great things following the reviews here. I've visited Paris with my other half quite a few times and have always been very pleased with the quality of the hotels. What made this experience even worse was that i'd planned to pop the question, but the room put such a dampner on the whole weekend that i decided to leave it for another time. Will return to Paris but wouldn't go near this place again. Avoid, unless you like to fork out a fortune for a room with no view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: MDMORG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Splendid Etoile for our Honeymoon at the end of October and we could not have been more pleased. The hotel staff were warm and attentive. They took wonderful care of us. Our room was beautiful and the view could not have been beat. We stayed in room 507, and I highly recommend it! It was beautifully decorated, and was larger than most European hotels. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was large and luxurious. We would definitely stay there again. The location of the hotel and the easy access to public transport made it a winner all the way around! I can't wait to go back! My husband even said before we left that it seemed like a lot of money for a hotel, but afterwards he said it was so worth it. Definitely the best place we stayed. It was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikkiosu
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to Paris in October and stayed at the Splendid Etoile. The location is fantastic, and the hotel was even better than we anticipated. I had read the great reviews on tripadvisor and was pretty confident that we would enjoy the hotel, but my expectations were really exceeded. The rooms are much bigger than others I've stayed in in Paris and the view can't be beat. However, it was the staff that really made all the difference. Not only were they accomodating, but they were great people with whom we enjoyed talking all week. The concierge, Farooq, is simply a treasure. We talked to him at length a couple of times, and it was as if we had a good friend in Paris. He had great insight on Paris, traveling, and life in general. We will stay at this hotel again whenever we visit Paris and look forward to seeing Farooq and all the members of the staff. Highly recommended, you can't go wrong with this hotel and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: norcal9003
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on all the positive reviews on tripadvisor. Boy, were we disappointed! It was completely NOT worth the 300 Euro we paid per night. The front desk staff were RUDE and deceiving. We had booked a room with a double bed. But the room we were given had two twin beds and were extremely small. When we requested to change to a room with one bed, the front desk staff replied that they could change our bed to one bed instead of moving us. We were happy but we returned in the night only to find that they had not changed our bed to one bed but instead had used one sheet instead of two. We felt cheated. When we talked to them again, they said we either deal with the two twin beds or we had to move to a room in the back facing the courtyard. Our room had PAPER THIN WALLS. It was very noisy. We could hear conversations from neighboring rooms and people walking around and opening and closing doors. In the morning we would hear loud noises coming from elevator and kitchen. The door to our room had no dead bolt or chain link. One time the MAID WALKED IN ON US while we were sleeping. The bathroom was extremely small. The bathroom sink drained poorly. The shower water pressure would change depending on usage in other rooms so the WATER TEMPERATURE COULD CHANGE FROM VERY HOT TO VERY COLD as we were showering. The hair dryer handle would get so hot that I needed to wrap it with a towel in order to continue using it. The AC IN OUR ROOM DID NOT WORK AT ALL. One night when we got back to the hotel, the hotel staff were trying to pry open the ELEVATOR DOOR WHICH GOT STUCK WITH PEOPLE INSIDE !!! Did I mention we were charged 6.40 Euros for a short local phone call to reserve a boat tour. Also one time while we were returning to our room, we saw ONE GUY PEEING RIGHT OUTSIDE THE HOTEL in public. The bad for this hotel far outweigh the plus. Please do youself a favor and refrain from booking this hotel. We made the mistake and would hate to see other people from making the same mistake. There are far superior hotels in Paris for far less money. If we could do it again we would go for some place such as Latin quarters with breakfast and transportation to/from airport included.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingprince
Reviews.Content: Got back 10-25 -07 from Paris, and 4 nights at the Hotel Splendid- would have liked to stay longer but the World Cup rugby finals took all the rooms months earlier. The only negative(get this out of the way)-- The room is average by Paris standards- a little small to me- first trip to Euroupe. The room is beautifully appointed, lovely furniture, chandeliers, flat screen tv, decent closet space. The view is great- The hotel is next to the Arc de Triumph- ask for a view room- its worth it. Very quiet inside(double pane windows)-- Three sets of balconies. Spotless, -little touches- like the great key , towel warmer, bidet??, robes, extra thick towels. The tub is deep and long enough but if you're hips are over 40" you might get stuck. Great location-- Up the Champs Elyssis- the metro literally 10 steps from your hotel- 5-7 minutes to most of the sights. A great cafe across the street- 9-13 euro's for a great breakfast. Hotel charges 22euros( I didn''t think it was worth the difference-- they're was much more food than I could eat. ) The service is 5*- Farooq the head conciege is dedicated to making everything go smoothly- storing our luggage when we planned to go away- calling cabs( even when they're impossible to get), helping with any excusion or transportation plan you can think of. Free internet which came in handy while we watched the fires burn near our San Diego home- and kept on track with our 3rd aniversary vacation. There's even a shuttle that leaves all day and night to the airport for 25Euros for 2. Farooq personally helped drag all five peices across the street to the shuttle. The stuck-up rude to Americans French were not anywhere near this place. It was worth it to me to pay a few more Euros to have a beautiful setting,convienyent location, and great service. And yes- Our home it ca-va-(o.k.)

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a fantastic property, fantastic location, and caring staff!”
Reviews.Author: deputysher
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to previous reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. While comparing the rates, we decided to splurge for a suite and we were not disappointed. We had the corner suite which overlooked not only the Arc but also Rue de Carnot. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom beautifully appointed. We loved it. The view from our room was fabulous -- we could see not only the Arc but also the Eiffel Tower -- you just can't get any better than that! We felt so charmed and special and delighted by this! We loved having the suite because with jet lag, sometimes one of us was up in the living room reading or watching TV, while the other was in the bedroom sleeping. There were pocket door separating the two so it was very handy. Other reviews mention the busy traffic and quietness of the rooms. We were astounded by the fact that the thick curtains, which are drawn at night over closed windows, TOTALLY blocked out the sounds of traffic, sirens, and helicopters. Yes, helicopters! The first morning we were there, there was some type of traffic accident or medical emergency on the round about around the Arc. Many, many emergency vehicles came including a helicopter, presumably to remove the injured. Traffic came to a dead standstill, and probably caused havoc throughout this part of Paris. We walked to the Eiffel Tower at night (the concierge said it was about 15 minutes but that must be in 'french walk speed' as it took us about 30 minutes. We thoroughly enjoyed the walk and especially loved seeing the tower lit up. We took a cab back and it was only 6 euro, well worth it as our feet were tired by then. We also got brave and took the Metro (subway) to the Louvre, based on Farooq's advice. The entrance to the Metro is right next to the hotel - it can't get any easier! We also took the Air France bus from DeGualle Airport based on Farooq's advice and were happy we did. It was only $13euro each and let us off directly across from the hotel. That was amazing! The evening concierges recommended two restaurants that were very good. One was a brasserie just 2 blocks away, and the other was a small restaurant about 3 blocks away. Both were excellent though the bill at the restaurant was scary -- $188 euro, but we chalked that up to being in Paris! I would definitely stay at this hotel each and every future visit to Paris. We previously stayed in St. Germaine des Pres, but the service here was outstanding and really made the difference for us.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Delight”
Reviews.Author: KarlaF
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel Splendid Etoile at the end of a 3 week trip in various parts of Spain and France. The location is outstanding - about 100 yards from the Arc de Triomphe on Avenue Carnot. Metro is across the street; lots of cafes, patisseries, brasseries are within walking distance. Though our room had a lovely view of the Arc - and its very busy roundabout - the soundproofing was so good, the noise did not disturb our sleep. The Hotel staff is excellent, knowledgeable, friendly and very helpful for non-French speakers. Faruk was especially gracious and professional. When our traveling companions lost their passports, Faruk helped shepard them through the process to obtain travel documents. We thought of Faruk and the rest of the staff as Ambassadors to their guests. We would highly recommend this hotel and will look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: piecyk7771
Reviews.Content: We spend a week here on our honeymoon. Loved the view of the Arc de Triomphe from our balcony. The location is wonderful. A couple of minutes walk to the Champs des Elysees and the Metro. The room was small but we didn't care. The bathroom was very modern and clean. The concierge was always helpful and recommended a wonderful local restaurant. Breakfast very overpriced at 22 Euros, but there were plenty of other options all around the hotel. Elevators were tiny, but were part of the charm of the hotel. Not inexpensive, but worth the price. We plan on going back here on our next visit to this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Paris excellence”
