Reviews.Author: lad2709
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in a large superior room. Could not fault anything, room was clean and well presented, staff always helpful and seemed eager to please. Super location, comfortable, and good value for Paris. I would certainly recommend this hotel. Did not have breakfast which seemed a little expensive at 22 â‚¬ and given the locally available cafes

Reviews.Title: “This Is The BEST Hotel Ever !!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiaCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from The Splendid and I must say this is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Everything was excellent from the wonderfully helpful, kind and attentive desk staff to the beautiful room (507 corner room) and ideal location. You can walk a very short distance to all of the major sights. If your thinking of staying here.....do yourself a huge favor and stay at this little slice of heaven. A special Thank You to the lovely desk staff from your Canadian friends. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Desk Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: trvlfish
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed one of the rooms that faces the Arc, I think that speaks for itself. Everytime you came into the room, open up the baclony windows and...WOW. The room was great, the bathroom was spacious and clean. Everything was good and very French. The hotel desk and Concierge could use some help though. I know the French are a little reserved, but c'mon. I don't think the level of effort to pry the information out, or the quality of that information was a cultural or language thing. It was simply a useless effort to continue trying, so we went about it on our own and we were better for it. All in all the view more than makes up for some of the shortcomings....Go ahead and book it, just do your research ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bonne”
Reviews.Author: jjWirral
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Paris after staying in the Hotel Splendid. We would like to express our thanks to the lovely staff including Farouk!! The hotel was in a fantastic location, the open top bus stopped round the corner and the Metro over the road. We had a fantastic view of the Arc and the Tower. We would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel to anyone. As in most hotels in france they do not have tea making facilities and if you are like me needing one as soon as you wake up then take a little portable kettle with a couple of sachets (this sufficed till breakfast). We found the staff helpful and friendly. Hello Farouk from Mr and Mrs David Barnes (Liverpool)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: goodtrips01
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my visit to the Splendid Etoile. My husband and my parents and I had 2 superior rooms on the 5th floor. The view was amazing! Made for great photos especially at night. The rooms were very nice and of good size for Paris. The staff was most wonderful! The front desk ladies were always cheerful and remembered us and our room numbers. I still don't know how they did that. Farouq the concierge was really nice and helpful. All the concierges were very helpful. I e mailed the hotel several times with requests for dinner reservations and a dinner cruise. They were very prompt with replys. My father said as we left the hotel, "Man. those people are SO nice! That was a great hotel!" I think he sumed it up nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wen_kel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel based on reviews in T.A. in Aug. The views from the room was better than we expected, we were on the 4th floor on the corner and had a great view on the Arc and Eiffel Tower. Although the room was smaller than we were expecting, but this didn't really matter too much to us. We caught the Air France shuttle which dropped us at the front door. The metro was across the street so it made travelling to the other sites easy. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, we preferred to have our coffee on the run. We found a nice restaurant about 10 mins from the hotel, a little pricy but we were in Paris. There are many places to eat close by. The front staff were always helpful, although we didn't meet the legendary Farook.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: VladimirSPb
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 4 star hotel in an excellent location with an excellent service. Not a cheap one, certainly - I paid 255 euros per night. If you enjoy the views, this hotel is superb as it offers views on Arc de Triomphe - one of the main Paris sights. Though, due to huge distances in Paris centre, you will need to use the metro to reach other places of interest. Metro is just a step away from the hotel. Restaurants of all kinds are plentiful in the area, though, rather expensive. I booked a corner room on the 3d floor that had a corner balcony with one side on avenue Carnot and another side on rue de Tilsitt - which had a direct view on Arc de Triomphe. This was probably the best room in the hotel. Staff was very helpful in all occasions and everyone speaked good English. Room was very clean, very well furnished and comfortable. For internet access I used Wi-Fi Orange service (15 euros for 10 hours of access within 30 days, free from 3pm to 5pm). The hotel offered, if I am not mistaken, 19 euros for 24 hr access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous133
Reviews.Content: Before our stay I had several correspondence with the concierge who I found very helpful and once we arrived this continued. We had booked an apartment room - we had a fabulous view on the sixth floor, all our three windows looked out onto the Arc de triomphe and to eiffel tower in the distance - which looked even more spectacular at night. However the rooms were ok, very clean but not wow!!! We had our breakfast in our room which was pretty good and prompt as we had heard the breakfast room was quite cramped. The facilites were quite limited but overall it is a situated in great location, staff were helpful, rooms were fine but if you can splash out would highly recommend an apartment room especially one over looking the arc de triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: ekmcler
Reviews.Content: After several other wonderful hotels had so exceeded our expectations on our European vacation, the Splendid Etoile did not live up to our hopes. The location was stellar, and the view was fabulous, but the staff was not very helpful, and the check-in clerk was down right unpleasant. Let me say that I speak very limited French, but I try very hard to make a real effort (we were in France, after all!) However, when I ran across some words that I didn't understand, I asked if she spoke any English (in French) and she glared at me and stated that 'we speak French.' She did eventually give in and speak some English to us (though she was clearly fluent), but it was clear that she was not happy. She was the only Parisian that we met during out stay that was seemed put out by my lack of fluent French -most were kind and friendly. There were 3 concierges that we met, two of which we dealt with. We feel that they must of had some sort of agreement with a nearby restaurant. We had asked each one separately to try to get us a reservation at one of TEN restaurants that we had chosen, and they both said that ALL of the ten were likely closed for August- though they never picked up the phone to check. We then explained that we wanted a very fine dining experience (after all, we were in Paris!). They both opened the cabinet behind them and promptly pulled out the exact same flyer and told us this was the place to go. We acquiesced, and one of them made the reservation. The restaurant was decent, but certainly not fine. The food was overcooked and the menu was limited. The room (room 405) itself was a decent size (Paris standards) and nicely appointed, but the bed was hard as rocks and the pillows were almost useless. There was a nice desk, a large closet, and an in room safe. One very positive note was that the metro station was right across the street, as was a delightful cafe (better than the 'fine' restaurant!). The L'Arc de Triumph was one block away, and afforded a spectacular view. Our experience in Paris was lovely, and I hope to return soon, but I will certainly look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Few Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: DaniellepwALES
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel based purely on T.A. reviews and must say the location cannot be faulted. However, I am surprised that the reviews did not mention the b/fast area. The hotel has approx. 57 rooms but only 8 tables in the b/fast area!! We waited for15 min. one morning for a table and thereafter went down REALLY early to get a table without having to wait. The staff in the hotel are friendly but I must say that the lady who runs the b/fast room made our stay very unpleasant. she run it like it was a military and it was very regimental-it would not have hurt her to smile once in a while. Two tips - I agree with a recent review that complained about 'rip off' taxi fares. We approached taxi driver directly outside hotel to ask how much it would be to take 4 of us to CDG, he quoted 30-35 Euros. When I asked Concerige, he said it would be 70 Euros, so you can guess who we chose!! So advice is, you are better off arranging your own taxi. Secondly, we decided to take the Air France shuttle to hotel on arrival ,again based purely on T.A. reviews. The only problem with that is that if you arrive in Terminal 3 as we did, you have to lug all of your luggage to Terminal 2 to catch shuttle. You have a long walk then catch the CDGVal to get shuttle. The journey from the airport to hotel, which stops right outside door, took one and a half hours, hence the reason for taking the taxi back to CDG. This might not bother some people but it's worth mentioning. The lift only carries 3 people which again is a problem if there are more of you in your party and during our 5 day stay, the bar was not open at all. All in all, our stay was a pleasant one and I would probably stay there again if only for the location but I was slightly disappointed that it didn't entirely live up to all the hype which is a shame. Also, I did not meet the celebrity that is Farouk as maybe it could have turned my stay around!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: natashan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Metro station is 1 minute away and Air France shuttle stops in front of the hotel....of course not to mention that Arc of Triumph cannot be closer. We had a room with the Arc of Triumph's view. Our room and its bathroom were perfect: big (compared to European room size) and clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We noticed that the safe in our room was locked, when we arrived. The staff showed up 5 minutes after we called and opened the safe's door. Breakfast was normal and simple but plenty. The breakfast room is small but not "claustrophobic" as one of the reviewers wrote.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Theroomnottaken
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here the weekend after Valentines day. Having read the reviews on trip advisor i had selected this hotel as it was my girlfriends first trip to Paris, we were both not disappointed. The staff were brilliant, i requested a room with a view of the arc de triumph which we resultantly got with an amazing view, especially at night !The view was fantastic, the room was lovely in its rich old world decor and the staff could not have been more helpful. The location cannot be beaten, you are a walk away from all the main attractions, with a metro station across the road also. I could not recomend this hotel enough, especially for a romantic get away !

Reviews.Title: “I'm sad to say that I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MadameKUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was my THIRD stay at this hotel (I loved it the first two times) and that I booked my stay directly with the hotel rather than one of the discount sites. You should also know that I speak fluent French so there was never a misunderstanding due to a language barrier. First of all, the beds are hard as rocks and instead of bed pillows, they only have shams on the beds - a big change from my last stay. The concierges' recommendations for restaurants were in most cases not worthwhile choices. More importantly, beware of the practice of some of the concierges to make arrangements with the hotel car driver to rip you off for local cab rides. We had agreed on a 30 Euro price one night ,(there were 5 of us) but were charged 50 Euros when we got back to the hotel! Farouq (the head concierge) met with me, apologized, and said that he knows the concierges should not try to rip off tthe customers by conspiring with the car drivers to pad the bill so they can make extra money, but beyond his apology, nothing else happened. After that, I called for our own cabs. When we checked out, we were charged for internet service in our rooms (when we had no computers with us!!) and over 35 Euros for long-distance phone calls which we did not make (as we used only our cell phones to make satellite calls). They took off the computer charge, but not the phone calls. When I returned home, I e-mailed and wrote the General Manager of the hotel (in French) and asked for a refund. I never even received a response, let alone a refund. The view and location are wonderful, but for the price of this hotel, I will stay somewhere else next time ---the Splendid no longer lives up to its name!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: MartinAB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Splendid Etoile for eight nights in a superior room. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel. First, it is in a very convenient location for traveling from the airport and getting around the city. The Air France bus shuttle from the airport stops right across the street and the Metro entrance is also within a block. We often took the Metro to our destination (Louve, Dâ€™Orsay, Latin Quarter etc.) and enjoyed the walk back to the Splendid Etoile taking different routes each day. Our room, number 503, had a nice view of the Arc and a pleasant balcony to enjoy the signs and sound of Paris. The room was a reasonable size and clean. The housekeeping staff is very good and on numerous occasions returned while we were out for dinner to tidy up the room. The concierge staff was fluent in English and provided friendly and helpful guidance. There is a nice convenience store just a block away which was great for morning fruit and yogurt. Unfortunately for us the bakery located at the end of Carnot Ave was open for only one day and then closed for vacation for the balance of our stay. It is a superb option for breakfast coffee, bread and pastries. We tried several of the restaurants within a short distance from the hotel and found Lâ€™Arc, Lateral and Grande Armee to be decent. However, because you are so close to the Arc and Champs Elysee the local restaurant tend to be a little bit touristy. We would certainly return to the Splendid Etoile should our travels take us back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic Location”
Reviews.Author: tracey_jones
Reviews.Content: Visited last weekend for our 10th Wedding Anniversary - had the Apartment suite which was beautiful. Could not fault the service given by all staff but mostly Farooq. The local is perfect and the view was amazing. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: jdVancouver
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. Totally agree with all the compliments made by previous visitors. We booked an "upgradable" special (based on availability) through Expedia. We were disappointed when we arrived when we were given a smaller room, but absolutely delighted when we were upgraded to a much larger room with a balcony view of the Arc de Triomphe for the remaining 3 nights. The hotel staff was warm and welcoming - kudos to Annabelle and the much cited Farouq for their friendliness and eagerness to please. To give you an example of their level of service, we had subscribed to the Orange WiFi but it wasn't working, so Annabelle arranged for us to have free internet access iin our room for a day. Farouq helped us carry our bags across the street to the Air France airport shuttle. To give you a sense of the convenience: the Air France airport shuttle, taxi stand, Metro/RER are all within steps of the hotel's front door. This is the most conveniently located hotel in Paris I've ever stayed at. For those of you who like to picnic by the Seine, we found a wonderful patisserie, boulangerie, and boucherie at the end of the block. The Splendid Etoile is indeed splendid - we definitely will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience And A Good Employee”
Reviews.Author: Creative_7
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience in Paris by staying at this hotel. The hotel is very close to the Arc de Triomph (about 200 meters). I took a superior room; it has a small balcony with a lovely view to the Arc de Triomph (especially at night). The hotel was comfortable and clean, and the employees were friendly specially (Mr. Farouck), who helped us with arranging our tours and gave us suggestions and advices. Also, he helped us to solve a problem. The only negative in the hotel was the restaurant where you have your breakfast; it was too small, but the good thing that you can take your breakfast at your room. In general, I advice you to stay there and enjoy your time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SEFLMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Splendid Etolie. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30am and was surprised to find our room ready. They gave us a room on the 3rd floor, after riding up the smallest of small elevators we found clean, simple room with high ceilings. Like most small Europe hotels the bed is 2 twins pushed together. The decor of the room wasn't the most exciting, but the room was large, and had the best view I have seen in a long time. A small balcolny looked over the main street and to the right we had a fantastic view of the Arc de Triumphe. We got free breakfest with our room and thought it was great. I don't know if I would pay 22 euros for it, but with it included in our room rate we took full advantage of it. Thanks too all who have reviewed this hotel, I took alot of your advice and got the room upgrade and learned about the Air France bus being right across the street. The staff was pleasant and welcoming. This was the perfect hotel for our short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but beware of 1st floor”
Reviews.Author: pingpong888888
Reviews.Content: The website through which I booked the hotel could only give me standard room so I had to try my luck when I arrived to see if there was a superior room. On the first stay (I had to check out the next day for meetings outside of Paris, and then checked in again 2 days later) I got a superior room. Everything was ok but I cannot say the room was new. As a matter of fact I do think the room itself needs renovation. Before I checked out, I asked to keep a superior room for my return. I was told they would try, if no superior room they would give me a junior suite at the same price. I gladly said thank you thinking about the photo I saw from the "candid travelers' photos"...only to be disappointed later. When I returned (late in the evening), the only room available was junior suite on the first floor...I went in gladly, only to find out it's a standard room (with no TV), attached with a small room that looked nowhere like the "candid traveler's photo of junior suite", that had no door in between, that had a make-shift kind of sofa bed with the TV and the bathroom. Wait...the most terrible thing I found was...there was no aircon but a big monster "cooling" machine about the size of a mid-sized fridge, which ridiculously split hot air out from the back of the machine back to inside the room!!! I could not open the window as it's on first floor hence too noisy. Apparently they told me all the rooms on 1st floor were all equipped with such monster only. I asked to change to a standard room but they said they did not have other room anymore. So they left a note for the front desk to arrange another room the next day if available. I was so upset...fortunately when I returned the next evening they gave me the magic room X07!!! That solved all the problems. I must say all the staff had very good attitude. The only problem I had was when I asked for a 10% hotel discount card for Lafayett the staff that had all the cards had disappeared "for a coffee!!!". After waiting and the hotel paging without any sight of him, I had to leave for the shopping without that card (so I could not get discount on skincare items which were not on sale at that time)... The excellent location made up for the unpleasant experience. However, I will probably not stay here again. For that price I would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Atldobbins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to Paris and everything was perfect, starting with this wonderful hotel. The staff and the room, we had seven days in one of the apartments and it was better than we had anticipated. Bathrooms were big, sitting room had spectacular views, and service was impeccable. We already have good friends booking rooms here for their first trip in September. We took the advice of others and ate breakfast on the street and that was great advice. Directly north of the hotel, opposite direction of the Arch and at the end of the street, is a wonderful pastry shop and a must. The district for the hotel is very French and we found the locals to be very friendly and courteous. Also, various wine vendors at the end of the street and great wine for the room can be purchased at very low prices; however, wine is about the only thing that is inexpensive, but it is worth it. We experienced none of the parisian attitude stories that had been told to us by others. Also, take the Air France bus from the airport as it stops directly at the base of the hotel. We took a taxi, lost the address and spent an hour looking like lost tourists: bus is a better option. Canâ€™t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: Ohmaid54
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best deal in Paris. 4 *+ for 3* price. Nothing negative to say. Great location, clean comfy room, good breakfast, friendly staff and hey, I don't even own the place. If you are booked in here, look forward to a great stay, if not, you should be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Bit!”
Reviews.Author: sophia_houston
Reviews.Content: As a French Native, I always look for the best places to stay while I'm in Paris. And eveytime I go to Paris, which is quite a few times, I choose Splendid Etoile Hotel. It's very modern, and the price is agreeable. The hotel is located right next to the Arc de Triomph. Which makes any view from your hotel room, a very nice one. The front desk is very quick in service. They check you in, and get all the information they need, very quickly. Which is good, when you come from a 9 hour flight. Last thing I want to do is take a long time to just check-in. The people who work at the check-in are very welcoming and helpful. The lobby is not to large, but very elegant, and a homey feeling. You can either take the stairs or elevator to get to your room. A word of advice, the elevators aren't to large, actully quite small. The rooms are just magnicent. Very elegant, and modern, like the hotel itself. There small rooms, like any french hotel. My overall experince is great. I always and will continue to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: dizzy007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for our 10th Wedding Anniversary and it was a truely pleasant stay,it was our first trip to Paris but certainly not our last.The hotel is in a superb location,and the view onto the Arc de Triomphe is magic.The rooms are quite large for Paris I'm told,the recption staff were helpful and friendly especially the Concierge.The metro is directly across the street from the hotel,which is how we arrived but when we were returning home we took the Air France bus to the airport ,it can be found a little way from the hotel on the other side of the street ask at the reception of the hotel and they will tell you where to catch it,its free for Air France passengers but there is a small charge for any other airline passenger.All in all I would say a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: beentoeurope
Reviews.Content: Date: July 01,2007 Reviewer: Been to Europe,California, USA. We just returned from Paris and Splendid Etoile was a great choice. The room was large and comfortable, bathroom good size. Our room had two windows that overlooked a Paris street and the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel location was near the airport bus stop, taxis and metro lines which made getting around the city easy. Best of all we were near the Champs Elysees and the beautiful surrounding streets.This was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience at the Etolie”
Reviews.Author: TexasEXtraveler
Reviews.Content: We statyed at the Splendid Etoile for 3 nights are were most pleased. We dealt directly with the hotel for reservations and recommend this method as the staff's English is much better than my French. We carried our luggade via the Metro from Gard Nu Nord because we had read in this forum a Metro entrance / exit is directly across the street from the hotel. This is correct, the Metro is directly across the street. Please be forewarned the trip from Gard Nu Nord, changing to the Metro, and exiting via Charles De Gaulle Etoile Station involves numerous steps requiring alot of lugging and lifting. On the return trip opted for a taxi which worked much better for us. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded to a room with a balcony and view of the Arc de Triomphe. Like so many of the reviews in this forum, the staff was professional, courteous, and most helpful. The daily breakfast was excellent and the cafe across the street is very good, too. Being our first time in Paris, we relied solely on Trip Advisor review of the Hotel Splendid Etoile and were not disappointed. With the Metro across the street access throughout Paris is effort free and it's a 10 minute stroll to the Champ Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our stay in France”
Reviews.Author: frequently_away
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience at the hotel. We stayed for three nights at the start of our vacation. What made the experience so good was the friendly and helpful front desk staff. They went out of their way to help with our mobile phone and with restaurant recommendations. The room was clean and well-decorated. Had a safe and internet access. The area was good with a selection of restaurants and bakeries. Many English speaking guests at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My first hotel stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: luvs2run27
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. I have not stayed anywhere else in Paris so I don't have a great reference point. In America, I've stayed everywhere from a Motel 6 to the Four Seasons, so I have a broader base of reference. The pluses: Location, wonderful! We had a corner room overlooking the Arc and it was pretty much the one pictured on their website under the category "Superior". Our room didn't have a flat screen TV though. Very convienent to things. Comfortable, clean room, friendly staff, nice bathrobes. The minuses: Only have a couple and again, probably because I have nothing to compare it to. The toilet paper was so stiff. This may just be Paris. I have no idea. The bath towels were of the quality found in a Best Western. Pretty thin. There was no coffee maker, ironing board, etc. in the room. Would have been nice, but may not be standard over there. We did not have breakfast or go to the restaurant. 22 Euros for breakfast was ridiculous to me and their dinner menu seemed limited. We had absolutely no trouble finding patissries (spelling?) and an abundance of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tunis_Boston
Reviews.Content: My sister, mom, & I stayed at the Splendid Etoile in May 2007. We absolutely ADORE this hotel and would definitely stay there again! The staff is incredibly helpful and attentive. Chief Concierge Farooq granted us an Arc du Triomphe-facing room with balcony upon our request. The view was amazing! He was also incredibly helpful and patient in making reservations for us to restaurants and shows. Also, all of the staff was very helpful with giving us directions to points of interest, either by metro, car, or on foot. All of the staff is incredibly helpful and kind. The rooms were also fantastic. Our triple was huge by european standards, with incredibly high ceilings, beautiful french doors leading out to balcony, and a huge marble bathroom! The location of the hotel was spectacular! Ideally located at the Arc, and a few steps to the train station for both the metro and RER. There are literally dozens of fantastic cafes & restaurants within walking distance. The neighborhood is upscale and very sophisticated without being pretentious. And its a 5 minute walk to the Champs Ellyses. Overall, an amazing experience and we will without question stay there again on our next trip to Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwynz
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time after deciding upon this hotel for our honeymoon. The staff were lovely, they upgraded our room to overlook the Arc because I emailed them in my poor French. Metro station to the Central Line wonderfully close, beautiful views. It was noisy though in the mornings with a lot of doors banging shut and cleaning going on, but hey we didn't care - we were on honeymoon! Just one thing - if you have long hair like me you might want to bring a hairdryer as the one in our bathroom was very weak and the handle heated up after using it a while. All in all we will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel I've found in Paris. Great location, uniformly nice and helpful staff, nice decent sized room where everything worked well (great flat screen TV, powerful adjustable AC, good internet connection, clean ....(although no view at all from x01 numbered rooms). Not perfect: mattress on bed was really too soft and breakfast could be better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a view + great location + helpful staff = a happy guest”
Reviews.Author: tervs
Reviews.Content: Although we could only stay for one night, the Splendid Etoile lived up to my expectations...which admitedly were a tad high thanks to fellow reviewers. We arrived about 11 am via the AirFrance bus, but our room was not ready yet. The clerk told me we were getting a very nice room and it would be worth the wait (and it was!). We were able to leave our luggage behind and went to explore. Upon our return to the hotel, we were given the key (darn, I should have taken a photo of the key! It's a great big heavy thing which you leave at the front desk when you leave) to room 407. Our luggage had already been taken upstairs. We boarded the tiny elevator (lovely wood and brass, but if you're claustrophobic you might want to take the circular stairs) and arrived at the 4th floor. 407 is one of the corner rooms - it had three balconies -- two off the main room and one in the bathroom. The view of course was incredible - talk about ambience! All the balconies had French doors with double glass which truly blocked the sounds of the streets below. We opted for the noise of the city and enjoyed a lovely breeze. The beds were comfortable, with crisp linens and extra pillows that were found in the closet. The bathroom, as many have noted, is very long and narrow but more than adequate. We did not take the breakfast - there are many cafes within easy walking distance and a wonderful bakery/cafe 2 blocks away. When we were checking out, I mentioned that we'd probably take a cab to pick up our rental car which was on Avenue Foch. Farouck, who is easily one of the most upbeat people I've ever met, offered to walk our luggage down to the rental office! So off we went, bags in tow, following him to our destination -- it's a memory I won't soon forget! Overall, our brief stay at the Spendid Etoile was wonderful. My only regret is that travel plans did not allow us to stay another night. The common areas are not large or fancy - if you need an impressive lobby, go to the Meridian or the Westin. If you want a clean room with an outstanding view (yes, splurge for the superior room, it's worth it!) easy transit options (bus from the airport on the corner, taxi stand outside, RER a few steps from the door and the metro up on the corner) and a friendly, helpful staff, the Splendid Etoile will do very nicely.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcatral14
Reviews.Content: A little late to the party but I just want to say that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would not hesitate to do so again. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Great location, fantastic view, friendly staff and reasonable (for what you get) rates. I couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay with a friend at the Splendid and it was just that, Splendid! The room was very large (which was a good thing--we had many shopping bags taking up space) and the bathroom sparkling, updated and also quite big. The ceiling was high with great detail, and we had floor to ceiling windows--fabulous! The location is also terrific. The cab stand (with bench) is steps away. A block down are terrific restaurants and an incredible pastry shop. Two blocks away we found--what else ?--great shopping. The area has a very residential feel which is a huge plus as well--relatively quiet at night. The hotel staff met all of our requests with a smile and helped with our various dinner reservations. They handled what could have been a difficult situation--an area wide gas ( and hot water )outage with a sense of humor and frequent updates. Hint--We booked through the hotel web site--I always do this now, as I feel you get a better room. It is probably a few extra dollars, but after a few bad experiences I truly feel this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and vacation experience!”
Reviews.Author: beeMarshfield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Paris and absolutely loved our hotel...we had a corner room( superier room) found it to be clean, well decorated, updated, good sized with three balconies...and a view of the Arch de Triomphe...it was heaven...the bathroom was very good sized, all marble with all the amenities...the staff was excellent! We followed all their recommendations for dinners and had them make reservations, some of the best dinners we have ever had...All in all, it was terrific..I would hightly recommend this hotel, it was worth the 245 euro we spent per night... and would definatley go back there...and the convenience of the RER, and metro and the Air France bus to the airport...couldn't be better!

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule rooms - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: spoonius
Reviews.Content: Great location couldn't be better. Rooms were miniscule - you could hardly swing a cat. Expensive for what you get. Breakfast very average. Green scrambled eggs, cheap smoked salmon, no condiments on the table,noisy service with servers banging around when re-setting the tables. Staff quite friendly considering it was Paris..The friendliest was an Indian guy! It was clean and as I say you couldn't beat the location. BUT definitley not a 4 star; I would say closer to a 2 star. Was quite disappointed actually,mosty because of the size of the room and the bed.

Reviews.Title: “It's True!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomariemd
Reviews.Content: It's true! We booked this hotel b/c of the amazing reviews and it was exactly what we expected and fabulous. We stayed for 4 nights and the room (507) was the best! The view was amazing, the size of the bathroom for Paris was big, the staff was very helpful and spoke good english. It was clean and soooo convienient to everything. The metro was right out the door and the bus to the airport was also across the street. I would stay there again. BOOK FAST because believe me they sell out fast!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star status unjustified - very overpriced, tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: UkKenttraveller
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our room which was vastly overpriced at 270 Euros. It was clean, but tiny, dark , "tired" and looked onto a very unappealing courtyard. Whilst the range of foods available for break fast was good, it was served in a very cramped, claustrophobic room with no windows. Priced at 22 Euros breakfast was, again, hugely overpriced. Whilst the hotel is undoubtedly well sited for exploring key sites and the staff were reasonably friendly, we failed to see how the 4 star hotel rating is justified and would put this hotel as no more than two star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam from Virginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 2 - 8, 2007. We enjoyed our stay very much. We booked a "superior" room through Travelocity (with an airfare package) for about 175 Euros (225 dollars) per night. For a 5th floor balcony room (503) with a full view of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris right next to a Metro stop and an Air France express bus, it is a steal! Our room was OK size for Europe, with two twin beds pushed together. (Hard foam mattresses that we liked, although the linens were very cheap feeling/scratchy -- definitely not the Westin Heavenly Bed!) Very nice marble bathroom with a tub/shower with very powerful water pressure. To get a good feel for the superior rooms in comparison to the regular rooms, go to the hotel's website -- they show them both. A great thing about this hotel is that the front desk staff and the concierge speak English. Before we left for Paris, we heard that "everyone speaks English." We can tell you that this is nonsense. Everybody speaks English there like everybody speaks French in the United States. So having hotel staff that can get you pointed in the right direction when you arrive was very helpful. So the rooms are nice; the front desk staff are great; the lobby is cute (although smoking is allowed there); the maid service was exceptional; and it has an in-house restaurant for breakfast and dinner (it seemed vacant most of the time). We cannot comment on the food because we didn't eat there. However, we can tell you that the breakfast is 22 Euros (which based on the current exchange rate is about 29 dollars). Who needs a $29 breakfast? We ate the best baguettes/coissants we have ever had and a cup of coffee for breakfast like the locals for about 2 Euros. This leads us to tell you about the hotel's location. It is about perfect. It is surrounded by a hundred nearby restaurants of every type and plenty of convenience stores for snacks, beverages, toiletries, etc. Also, we found the French people to be courteous, friendly, helpful -- simply wonderful. Everywhere we went there were proud Parisians anxious to share their beautiful city. We felt honored to be among them all. One sidebar on the hotel reservation process to tell you about: We paid for a superior room and confirmed a high floor with a view of the Arc de Triomphe by email and by telephone. But when we arrived, they assigned us to a 1st floor room with a view of nothing. If you pay for the superior room upgrade, stand your ground like we did and we think you will find the staff willing to accomodate you appropriately -- they accomodated our request with little fuss. All in all, it is a very nice little city hotel in a great, safe, residential and commercial neighborhood near one of the city's greatest monuments. We highly recommend it and would stay there again (although maybe not at the current Superior room rack rate of 300 Euros!)

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place I will stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bbotch
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things about this hotel, but I will highlight the most important: 1) Coincierge staff is fantastic and set you up with reservations at great restaurants, off the beaten path of regular tourist traps 2) the view of the Arc d'triomphe from your bedroom. Nothing could have been more beautiful to look at before you go to bed 3) Metro access to ANYwhere is right in front of the hotel The breakfast is great too and the room was very clean, new, and nice. I stayed in five hotels in France and this was the most pleasent surprise I had. All were chosen via Trip Advisor recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms/views but hotel lacked atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: My mum and I spent two nights, 28-30 April at this wonderful Hotel. Chose this Hotel based mainly on Tripadvisor's high ratings. We knew we were going to arrive at close to midnight from Venice, by Air France coach, hence the obvious choice was to choose this Hotel since we simply cross the road and the Hotel is located right at the corner of Ave Carnot. We were rather happy with our request for a corner room, which offers us 3 balconies with superb views of the Arc de Triomphe. Room was large even by European standards, bed was really really comfortable and the bathroom was simply long and huge! The view at night of the Arc was especially memorable ..... Location wise, it is very close to the Metro/RER and shopping in Champs Elysees. Even the Lido Cabaret show was very nearby. However, beware of the underground tunnel closing after 10pm or 11pm. When we were walking back to the Hotel after the Lido show, at around 11.15pm. We had to back tracked and walk above grounds instead. I was a little annoyed cos I emailed the Hotel before my trip and was told to walk back to the Hotel via the underground tunnel? As for breakfasts, managed to catch a glimpse of what's on offer - in my honest opinion, doesn't seem to be worth 22 euros. Right across the Street, you can find nice Cafes which offer breakfast sets at 7.50 or 8.50 euros per person. Finally, I did not grant this wonderful Hotel a full 5 stars rating cos of the lack of atmosphere in the common areas. I thought they should invest some money in decorating the reception and common areas so as to create a cosy/romantic Parisian ambience, which is why millions are visiting Paris each year. After two nights here, we stayed another two nights at the Paris Le-Grand near the Paris Opera, which is by far the most beautiful Parisian hotel I had stayed at (see my review under Paris Le-Grand).

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SMC514
Reviews.Content: After countless hours of research of Paris hotels..Splendid Etoile was our choice. We stayed in Room 508 and I highly recommend requesting it because of the view. A few reasons you should stay here: -The hotel staff is outstanding. The front desk staff and bellmen were very welcoming on our arrival. We also got to meet the "famous" Farooq while checking in. He always answered our countless questions with a smile. He knows everything about Paris and is a huge asset to the property. - The Air France shuttle drops you off right across the street (buy a round trip ticket upon boarding at the airport) .The metro is also across the street and is very easy to use (buy a carnat of 10 tickets to save $) -The view was breathtaking from our room. Even though you probably won't spend alot of time there..it is nice to see the Arc de Triomphe each day you wake up and go to bed. -The room was better than expected. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. It was larger than a normal European room. The bathtub was the extra long too. -The coffee at the hotel is some of the best we have ever tasted. Order it through room service. -You can bypass the crosswalks to the Champs Elysees by taking the tunnel under the Arc de Triomphe. The stairs are on the same block as the hotel To do: * buy a museum pass * don't miss Montmartre (Sacre Cour) * Arc at night * Louvre early in the morning before it opens * L'Orangerie Museum (Monet) * Rodin Museum * Take the double decker bus tour for one day if it's your first visit to Paris. Then take the metro back to the sights you saw Overall a great hotel!!! Not one dislike or complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Clare_Charnley
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor.com and booked a superior suite on the hotel's Web site. This trip was a first-time stay in Paris for both my husband and me, and I felt a bit risky doing it all online. However, not only were we awarded the most amazing view I've ever had from a hotel room (the same one w/the view of the Arc on all of their collateral), but we left absolutely singing the praises of the entire staff of the hotel. The pictures we took from one of our three balconies are the first pictures I show anybody who asks about our trip to Paris. The staff was extremely friendly, courteous, and patient. The location is great and very central. There is a metro stop right across the street as well. The rooms are fine space-wise, especially for Eurpean standards. The bathroom was large and had it's own balcony. And, of course, the room was very clean. My husband and I are in our early thirties, and enjoy good food and wine, both of which were easy to access from the hotel. Not only can I not wait to return to this gem of a hotel, but I am recommending it to anybody who visits Paris.

Reviews.Title: “All One Could Ask For”
Reviews.Author: amorphous
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Paris, and having heard many more horror stories than positive experiences, I was terrified about selecting a hotel. The Splendid Etoile exceeded every expectation I had. Staff was friendly, courteous, knowledgable, and very helpful. They were excellent English speakers, and put up with our poor attempts at speaking French. The Air France airport bus stops, literally, across the street. Stations for both Metro and RER are right outside the front door. Beyond all that, the view out our window was of the Arc de Tiomphe. Lots of great restaurants and small markets are within just a couple of blocks. All of this combined to make the stay a spectacular one. I was traveling with a spouse, a sister-in-law, and a 16-year-old daughter, and had absolutely no concerns about safety or security inside or outside the hotel. Most interesting, although not most relevant, was that the shower was far better than just about any I have experienced in hotels in the US or other European destinations. Plenty of room, good water flow. Beds were comfortable, windows opened, room was as large as it needed to be. I simply couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful Chef Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Almostpensioners
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, well appointed for Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. Rooms large, airy and clean with excellent soundproofing. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKHarris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendid Etoile last week to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We chose it because of the excellent reviews on this website. We contacted the hotel direct and requested a superior room with a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The room was lovely and spacious by Parisian standards and WOW....what a view!! We had an uninterrupted view of the Arc and could also see the top half of the Eiffel Tower as it twinkled at night. Very romantic sitting on the balcony, sipping bubbly, looking at these wonderful landmarks. Farooq gets a lot of good press on previous reviews, and rightly so. He makes you feel very welcome. However, without exception, all staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic with easy transport access from the airport and a metro station right outside. There's also a fabulous little boulangerie/pattiserie at the bottom of the street with cakes and pastries to die for!. This hotel has everything you could want for a short break in Paris. Without a doubt, when we go back, we'll stay at the Splendid Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Gim29
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. recommended for couples. Everything was perfect, the rooms are small but very charming. Perfect for a romantic getaway. Pay the extra for a room with a view, its worth it. Great location aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tandmatlanta
Reviews.Content: Anyone visiting Paris should stay in this hotel, the location is perfect, the hotel is immaculate and charming and we cannot say enough about the service. Farooq and the entire staff were welcoming, helpful, and very generous. If you want an amazing Paris experience, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephaneb
Reviews.Content: The Splendid Hotel is 10 minutes away from the Champs-ElysÃ©es and is closed to the Avenue des Ternes which is apparently one of Paris's famous merchant avenues. The room was beautiful and we had a good enough view on the Arch of Triumph (by night it is magical). Besides, after days of research, the best price I had found for this hotel was on a local website which is called 123france [-]. The basic price was 200 Euros, which is 30% less than what the other websites offer for the splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff were everything that I had hoped for. Welcoming english speaking staff ready to help with anything. Rooms were great and found a good price on travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: willrich
Reviews.Content: Researched this hotel through trip advisor and pleased that it lived up to high expectations. Best deal available was via U.S. Otel site rather than a UK agent. If flying into CDG airport don,t bother with a private transfer from airport. There is a bus service that stops right outside the Hotel. Would have been quicker and cheaper than the private 'airport connection' shuttle we used. Be prepared to queue for a long time to get into any of the main tourist attractions!

Reviews.Title: “A Find!”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
Reviews.Content: Right near the Arc de Triomphe, blocks away from the Champs, with the CDG bus stop right in front. A good 4-star, with rooms ranging from smaller to very nice (with some having a view of both the Arc and the Eifel Tower!). Front desk is helpful. Newspapers, Internet and a solid breakfast (although Euro 19 if purchased on site is quite expensive) are included. Bathrooms comfortable. The rates go up quickly, but deals can sometimes be found on the Internet. Recommended for both personal and business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Farooq makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: mscSingapore
Reviews.Content: Splendid location! Metro station is just in front of the hotel and this made the travel in Paris so much easier. The concienge Farooq offered excellent service. He had all the answers of your questions. We will definitely stay in this hotel again because of Farooq's service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Romantic Atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: knocktophernights
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel, my husband and I spent our 35th anniversary at this Hotel last April, the staff were excellent . The only dissapointment was the Breakfast very limited, but everything else was excellent , on booking I requested a room with a view of The Arc deTriumphe which we got and what a view !

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: patdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Etoile for our friend's 50th birthday celebrations on 11th March. I chose it based on the reviews here and I can assure you that you can believe all the positive comments you read about it. We booked direct and paid 250 euros a room. They are traditionally furnished and well appointed, but to be honest, we hardly spent any time in them, so good was the weather. Room 307 has a perfect view of the Arc de Triomphe; it was a delight to see our friend's face when she saw it! Farooq was charming and very efficient and, yes, he did walk us round the corner to a brasserie he recommended. Use the Air France bus for CDG- at 20 euros return it can't be bettered for price and convenience. Didn't eat breakfast in the hotel - too many cafes around such as the Beer Station where we could sit outside in gloriously sunny weather. We ate well for a very reasonable price at L'amazonial restaurant near Chatelet metro and had a fabulous night out at the Moulin Rouge -it's not cheap, but it's a knockout show you really shouldn't miss. Farooq will book it for you, but as someone else pointed out, he does charge a fee, which wasn't made clear at the time. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid what a view”
Reviews.Author: TammyTwinkle
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from staying at this hotel. We must say the room was very nice, big bathroom, very clean and the view was out of this world of the arc de triumpe!!!! Breakfast was lovely and the staff really went out of their way to help you!!! Location was great for walking and the metro!! Everyone is correct the hotel is spendid!!! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so special and would definately use the hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a better choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: After a semi-disastrous stay out in La Defense, my wife and I moved to the Splendid Etoile based on reviews here. We couldn't have made a better choice. A couple of things to be aware of... Like most European rooms, the bed is two twins pushed together and they are a bit low, but not uncomfortable. The pillows were a bit flat, so we got a couple of more, and the AC doesn't work, but they brought us a fan. Having said that, we were in room 505, the top floor that has balconies (there is a 6th floor). Our balcony gave us a wonderful view and the white noise of the traffic and night breezes made for great sleeping. (closing the two double-doors eliminated all but the loudest noises) You can step out the front door to an elevator to the metro/RER station (Charles de Gaulle Etoile). An RER train and two metro lines go through here, making it extremely convenient. Less than 50 meters away is a convenience store to get water, sodas, fruit or snacks that made it highly convenient. The service is just superb. The staff is incredibly gracious and accommodating. When we asked about the AC, they explained it didn't work and there was a fan in our room when we came back. The concierge, bellman and desk people are all wonderful. The room itself is spacious, a nice size bathroom, a tub/shower with an adjustable spray head that can be hand held, incredible water pressure and scalding heat if needed. The closet is spacious and there's plenty of room for your luggage. A flat screen TV with three news channels in English, they don't have in-room movies, but we didn't miss them. There is in-room wired internet for 14 euros / day. There's also an Orange France hot-spot with a 98% signal that you can use with subscriber plans like T-Mobile. For price, location and convenience I just can't see how it can get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DevaEboracum
Reviews.Content: Everything written here in previous reviews about how good this hotel is are totally accurate. The hotel is in a perfect location - 1 minute from the Arc D'triumph. In fact, from our room (406) you could open the window, walk onto the balcony, and there it was to the right. In addition there were plenty of bars and restaurants and cafe's within just a few minutes walk. Access to the RER rail system was just outside the front door, whilst the nearest Metro station was only five mins away. Check in and check out were quick, efficient and friendly and the reception staff were all extremely friendly and more than willing to speak (very good) English. The room was a good size, well decorated, comfortable and clean - as was the bathroom. No doubt the hotel is great - but there was one minor irritation which is why I've not given it a 5 rating (I've probably been a bit tight with my scoring, but 5 should be perfection). The cleaner has a store cupboard next to the bathroom of our room (406). The cleaners started banging around in the cupboard at about 8.00am and because it was right next to a hollow, fully tiled bathroom, the sound was quite loud. So my only quibble is - if you want to have an undisturbed late lie in bed, room 406 is not the room to have.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mbm27
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for 3 nights earlier this month, and it was everything and more than I could have hoped for! The room (407) looked directly onto the Arc de Triomphe, the decor was perfect for the building, spotless, comfortable and the bathroom the same. All staff we met were more than helpful, and answered our countless questions, even walking us to the door to show us which way to go on several occasions. Stupidly I forgot an adaptor which they gratefully leant me. The RER and metro stop is literally outside your door - which connects you everywhere! If coming from Charles de Gaulle, definately use the Air France Coach, as a taxi could not drop you closer!!! We eat in the restaurant one night, I was a bit sceptical from previous reviews, but again, we found the food to be some of the nicest we tried. The bar, was very quiet, but nice to sit for a drink before or after a meal. Again, I would like to say how great the staff were, I can't emphasise how much we enjoyed our stay.. I would reccomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent! Geat location and service!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexⅅ
Reviews.Content: We are so thankful for the Trip Advisors service that led us to this wondeful hotel. The staff was exquisitely polite, friendly and informative. The concierge Farouk single-handedly was responsible for making our stay in Paris an absolute delight. He personally escorted us to two wonderful neighborhood restaurants (one for lunch and one for dinner). Our room had magnificent views. From one window we were on top of the Arch de Triomphe and the other displayed the magical twinkling color spectacle of the Eiffle Tower! No breafkfast included but plenty of reasonable nearby breakfast bistros. Just ask Farouk he won't steer you wrong. Also check out the nightclub Club E'toile down the street - people were lined up outside for four blocks on Halloween - I would get there by 11 to beat the crowd on the weekend.. We agree with those before us that this is a very good hotel in a great location. Taxis are just outside as well as Public Transportaion and plenty of great places nearby including the Champs d'Elysees!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarrior
Reviews.Content: You can't go far wrong with this hotel. From a warm greeting on arrival, cheerful help and guidance during our stay to a fond farewell, the staff were attentive and friendly. Given it's fabulous position, it's excellent value for money. Yes, expect rooms to be cosy by many country's standards but they are well-equipped, clean and many have great views which allow you to feel like part of Paris life rather than down a back street or in a suburb. Good breakfast, American/British as well as continental and well worth having although if you are on a budget you can do better in the local cafes. Get the Air France bus from the airport and it drops you just across the road. I used this hotel for business a few years ago and it did me just as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: VegasRoller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Splendid Etoile over four days in late January '07 so that I could join my girlfriend during her business trip. This was my second trip to Paris. The last time I stayed at Hotel Lutetia on the left bank. The Hotel Splendid Etoile has a classic Parisian facade. It is very clean throughout. The common areas (lobby, lounge, breakfast room) are small, but nice. The the rooms are relatively spacious (by European standards - American's may find the rooms a bit cozy.) The beds were firm, but comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and modern. Wireless internet access is available in the rooms, although the connectivity, like that in may hotels, was sometimes spotty. The elevators are very small as in many in older properties where they were obviously retrofitted. Three normal size adults will fit snuggly inside without baggage. Two adults with standard roller bags will fit. So be prepared to smile and make friends. Forget what people say about the French being rude. The staff at this hotel is very courteous, attentive, and helpful. Desk personnel politely switched to English when ever I stumbled over my French. The concierge was cheerfully able to accommodate my requests for last minute dinner reservations at some of the city's more popular restaurants. A buffet breakfast is typically included with the room. The breakfast room is small, but was never overcrowded. The offerings were well rounded including all the necessities for a proper English breakfast or classic American breakfast. A small restaurant is attached to the front of the hotel. But there are many other great dining options within walking distance so be adventurous. The hotel's location is great. It is within steps of the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. So getting a cab is easy. It is also just a few blocks away from the city's convention center. A metro station is located directly across the street from the hotel. Regardless of whether you want to take in the sights or attend meetings, getting around town from the hotel is easy. Getting to and from the hotel from the airport is also easy. Taking the advice of another TripAdvisor reviewer, I took the Air France shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. The bus picks up and drops off across the street from the hotel. The cost is just 13e each way - 4e cheaper than taking the RER and Metro and a lot less than taking a cab. You can buy tickets on the bus or from the hotel's front desk. Air France provides an attendant to load and unload your luggage from the bus. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. It was perfect for my quick romantic rendezvous, but also efficient for my better half's business needs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Splendid !”
Reviews.Author: daltonb
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve in this wonderful Hotel. We were able to watch the festivities from our room as we sipped champagne and celebrated the beginning of 2007. A marvellous hotel with the chief concierge, Farooq, being incredibly helpful and knowledgable. He is an amazing source of information. Just ask him and he has the answers !! We will return to this wonderful , splendid hotel soon !

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettablly Splendid indeed”
Reviews.Author: blaxx
Reviews.Content: First of all, we stayed at the famous room 606. It has to be one of the most stunning rooms we've ever seen. It has a perfect view of the Arc de Triomphe and you can see the top of the Eiffel Tower sparkling at night. The hotel is very elegant, with very professional and friendly staff. Their breakfast is also highly recommended. We wish we could have spent more time in the hotel, but there was so much to see and do withing minutes walking distance. Take a magical moment to throw open the windows and gaze at the city - you'll never forget it...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Splendidly Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Paris-7
Reviews.Content: I loved every moment of my stay. It was the best! I am going to love it even more when my wife and I check in once again. Thank for a Absolutely Splendid Stay !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED the Hotel Splendid Etoile!”
Reviews.Author: Mitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Splendid Etoile from 12/6/06 to 12/12/06. It was our 2nd time to Paris and wanted to stay more central vs. the outskirts when we were on a travel tour the 1st time around. We were in a Triple Room (503) which was a lg. King Size and a twin size rolling bed. Very comfortable for our 21 year old daughter. The room was large and faced the street. Two sets of huge glass doors kept out all street noise but we left them open during the day just to listen to Paris! From the balcony, an incredible view of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees which is basically across the street. The view was especially breathtaking at night. The hotel was quite easy to get to from the airport. The Air France shuttle stop is across the street. No you don't have to fly Air France to purchase a shuttle ticket. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Farooq in particular was very helpful and kind. Hotel Splendid Etoile was quite different than the hotel we stayed in during the tour. It surpassed our expectations and when we return someday, we will definitely stay here again. The hotel is just like the website. J'aime l'hotel Splendid Etoile!

Reviews.Title: “Bon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimRoyle
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean with good large rooms and an excellent location for tourism spots. The staff were friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights there. Having said that we spent very little time in the hotel apart from sleeping and showering. Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triumph, Louvre are all walkable but for the lazier amongst you the RER/metro is right outside the hotel and is dead easy to use. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mstge
Reviews.Content: My friend and daughter stayed at this wonderful hotel over New Year's Eve this year. I can't say enough about the service and location. Faroog, the concierge, was just the best I have ever encountered. He has such a warm and welcoming disposition that you feel right at home. We stayed in room #606 which is a suite that overlooks the Arch de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. What a magnificient view we had!!! I truly believe that there can not be a better view in the whole city. At night the lights from the Champs de Elysses are magnificient and you can sit and take it all in from your own room!!! In addition, the rooms are very quiet. even with all the noise of New Year's Eve!, Also, the suite was spacious. Far larger than any room I have seen in Europe. Another couple I met said the same for their double room. After traveling and living in Europe and paying incredibly high prices for hotel rooms, I have to say that this hotel is a "steal". In the states on New Year's Eve, this room would have been $1000 a night. However, the price of the room did not go up from their normal rates- amazing! Please, don't bother to go anywhere else in Paris. This is the best and I will return soon. Thanks Faroog for all your care and concern!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Pleasant Service, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: KWitt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an incredible trip to Paris. It was our first time visiting the romantic city and we had an unforgettable time. For three nights we stayed in a Superior Room at the Splendid Etoile hotel. We enjoyed everything about it. Our room/bathroom was large and comfortable, the elegant dÃ©cor was warm and inviting, and the view of the Arc de Triumph from our balcony was amazing! We found the staff and concierge were pleasant and helpful. One morning we asked the concierge for restaurant recommendations for dinner and he happily made us reservations at a wonderful French restaurant down the street called â€œLe Petit Colombier.â€� The fixed price menu had great choices and the overall dining experience was excellent. Another appealing feature of the hotel is the convenient location and access to public transportation. There are many taxi stands, RER and Metro locations surrounding the hotel. (We purchased a 3-day Paris Visite pass which granted unlimited travel in Paris using the RER, Metro, and bus systems. This was a great hassle-free way to travel the city.) Also, the Air France Shuttle (20 Euros/person round trip) is relaxing way to get to and from the airport. The shuttle leaves Charles de Gaulle airport and travels to two locations in downtown Paris. One of the drop off/ pick-up points is right across the street from the Splendid Etoile. We recommend this hotel to others looking for a Parisian hotel with charm and elegance. We would definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 68Aalum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this small hotel just on the west side of the Arc de Triomphe. There is an RER entrance in front of the hotel and an entrance to a metro station with two lines just across the street. We had a room that was like a suite in that it had a bedroom and a sitting room with a TV. Our room was on the 4th floor. Both the bedroom and the sitting room had floor to ceiling doors/windows which opened onto small balconies overlooking the street. The bathroom was very clean and spacious. My wife, who is very picky about bathrooms, loved it. The staff, especially the concierge, Farook, was attentive and very friendly. We would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in November with my husband and son and we loved this hotel. I have stayed in various hotels in Paris and I think for the price this is a great hotel. This hotel is clean, roomy and nicely furnished! We stayed on the 5th floor in room 508 (I think) and it had two balconies with views of the Arc. We requested a triple room and I am not sure if this was actually a triple room or a junior suite because it had one room with beds and another little sitting room with a sofa bed where my son slept. My brother in law and his family stayed here as well and they had a room on the 4th floor quite similar to ours, their room was lovely as well. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Truly splendid!”
Reviews.Author: nanajean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Splendid Etoile during a glorious-in-every-way, weeklong trip to London and Paris with my 10-year-old grandson. It was the very best place we stayed during the whole time. The room was gorgeous with a little balcony that overlooked the Tour Eiffel. The breakfast was excellent. We had the best of times there, and I will never forget it! I can't wait to go back with my other grandsons when they turn 10.

Reviews.Title: “What Agreat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woodberry
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and waiting for us on our arival in Paris. The hotel staff in particular, Annabelle and Casali, were most helpful. When we asked about restaurants and using the Metro the staff could not be more helpful. Although our Frence was limited, we were able to communicate very well. The Metro station was out side our door and very convenient. On several ocations when it was evident we were lost, people would come up and ask if they could help. We will go back to France as we had a great trip and everything went so well. Sincerely, Robert & Lois Reeves

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LJ35
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from Paris where we spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel. Our room was a junior suite on the 5th floor. It had a good sized bedroom with a nice flat screen tv and a separate sitting area. Doors lead out of both rooms onto the balcony from which you have a good view of the Arc de Triomphe (although it is partly restricted by another building). The main advantage of this hotel is it's location, we were able to walk to most of the major sites. There are also quite a few restaurants and bars in the immediate area. (Lateral restaurant was especially good). We did not dine in the hotel but given the standards of everything else, I imagine the food would be good here. Staff were very helpful and polite. The bar is good for a quiet nightcap. Also worth a mention is the fact that the rooms are so quiet - there was very little noise from other rooms and no noise at all from outside. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyhope83
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel!! My father-in-law stays here alot on business so when we made our trip this past May, he booked the room for us. It was very spacious and we had a spectacular view of the Arc! The service was great and the hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. It was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in and would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are quite accurate and complete. The location of the hotel is prime for two reasons: it is extremenly convenient to the Metro and the fabulous views of the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triompe. Walk outside of the hotel, take 20 steps and you are at an elevator that whisks you down to the Metro and RER stations. There are lots of decent cafes and great shopping within walking distance. The hotel itself exceeded my high expectations. Front desk, bellmen, concierge staff, housekeeping and dining room staff were 100% friendly, proffesional and accurate in their recommendations. Our suite, 606, had a postcard view of the Arc and Eiffel Tower which was especially wonderful at night. Quality of bedding and bathroom linens were okay. Not bad, but not luxurious. This did not impede our enjoyment of the hotel, but I mention it just in case it is important to others. Room was very tastefully decorated and whisper-quiet even with all of the traffic whizzing by the Arc just yards away. Farouq is quite an ambassador for the hotel and Paris. His calm professionalism and friendly manner were most appreciated as we got our bearings in the big city of Paris. My wife asked him about onion soup for lunch one day and he said, "come with me" and walked with us about 3-4 minutes to a nearby cafe and introduced us to the Maitre d'. The meal was great, the service very attentive, and we appreciated the VIP treatment that Farouq provided. One other opinion to share: when in Paris, don't underestimate the importance of access to the Metro. Taxis are pretty reasonable price-wise but can be hard to find, and traffic jams eat up a lot of your time. You simply can't walk everywhere you want to go. Having a metro stop just outside the door make it easy to whisk down to the Louvre for a few minutes to see the building and pyramids at night, zip over to the Eiffel Tower for a coffee, and be back in your room all within 90 minutes, having spent only a few Euro. Taxis are pretty reasonable price-wise but can be hard to find, and traffic jams eat up a lot of your time. The bottom line is that this is an excellent hotel even without the beautiful view, and nearly unbeatable when you factor it in. We left Paris and after a few days in Amsterdam we returned and stayed at the Four Seasons Georges V, and I found the differences in quality and service to be fairly small considering the astronomic difference in price. Next time we stay in Paris it will be at the Splendid Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff and Room”
Reviews.Author: Marais1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located across the street from the AirFrance bus stop so, for 13 Euros, you can have a very easy trip from CDG airport to your hotel. There is a metro stop directly outside the hotel room door and the station is serviced by the 1, 2 and 6 metro lines (along with an RER train, I believe). This makes it convenient to travel to many locations without switching trains (including the Louvre and Place De La Bastille). If you want a drink after a day roaming paris, L'Ecluse wine bar is just down the street. Breakfast may be purchased at one of the many cafe's within 1 block of the hotel, or at the patisserie/boulangerie also located in close proximity to the hotel. Paolo, Farooq and the rest of the staff were outstanding, helpful hosts. I booked a superior room for 10 days. The room and bathroom were clean, bright and comfortable. Cleaning staff was excellent. The hotel was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We got off the Air France plane, walked on to the Air France bus that dropped us off across the street from this hotel. You can't get easier than that. We, of course, were early and our room was not ready. Farooq , at the desk,gladly handled our luggage and arranged for it to be held while we went out for our first day in Paris. We walked from the hotel across the street to view the Arc de Triomphe. We were the only ones there, along with 2 security guards. We had some breakfast and made our way up the Champs Elysees, walking all the way to the Louvre. When we got back, we were shown to our room. It was a huge room. We could see the Arc from our balcony but not from inside our room. The bathroom was quite large. The only problem that we had was that the shower curtain smelled sour and made the bathroom smell. There is a cab stand right on the corner that makes it very easy to find a cab to get around. We took one to Bercy station and it cost 20Euros. All the people that were working at the hotel, especially Farooq, were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bernlh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Paris for three days in April this year and apart from the fact that it was a little cold - it was wonderful. Upon arriving at Charles DeGuille we were a little confused with travelling into Paris, however, in the end decided on taking the train. This hotel is on a train line and the public transport train system in Paris is amazing - once we were on the train, we had no trouble finding it. We were upgraded to I would have to say the best room in the hotel, which had french windows that opened up to a view of the Eifel Tower - we were both speechless for about 10 minutes. The view at night was breathtaking - the Eifel Tower has sparkling lights every hour on the hour - again amazing. The room wasn't too big, but it served it's purpose for us, it was neat and clean - on our first night we found a little grocery store and bought wine, cheese, bread and meat and set up the couch in front of the french windows and watched the Eifel Tower. If ever we have the chance to visit Paris again we will definately stay there again. It is close to everything, or within distance of a bus or train very easy to get around. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Splendid Etoile on our very first trip to Paris. Kudos to the hotel and its staff for operating such a well-run property.
