Superlatives include: Farooq and other front desk staff who were friendly, knowledgeable, and went out of their way to book excursions for us and show us exactly which Metro lines to take; spacious room; comfortable queen size bed (we had the superior room); air conditioning controls in the room; hot breakfast (15 euros); location as has been mentioned previously; close to great shopping- Louis Vuitton store (be prepared to stand in line to get in) and Hugo Boss and of course fabulous restaurants just a few blocks down on the marvelous Champs-Elysee. The only thing we did not like about the hotel were the towels. We're used to plush towels both at home and away; theirs were very thin and we felt we could never be dry enough. Oh well, one small ripple in a sea of superlatives. Paris is lovely and the people absolutely delightful. I do not know why Parisians have gotten such a bad rap from Americans. Maybe its from people who have never traveled there. They are polite and respectul people who went out of their way to help us; total strangers on the metro and on the street offered to help us find our way when they saw fumbling with our maps. I speak a little French, but most people wanted to speak English to us. We went to every neighborhood and tourist attraction you can imagine so we got a pretty good taste of the entire city. We always felt safe; no one at all bothered us. If you must see anything in Paris, don't miss the Louvre (Sundays it's free admission, as it's on Wednesdays after 3:00 p.m and the lines are short); Musee Orsay; Saint Chapelle; the ride up to the top of the Eiffel Tower; and if you have time, Versailles and Giverny (Claude Monet's home) which the hotel can arrange for about 143 euros per person for an 8 hour trip). All around this was the best vacation we've ever taken. We're already planning our next vacation to Paris, quite simply the most wonderful city in the world. We would consider the Spledid Etoile for our next stay, but we would probably stay some where else just to try a new hotel. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Most Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dedra28
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most romantic hotels in the world. My husband and I went here for the first time almost five years ago. We go back at least once a year- same room etc. The hotel is just a few feet away for the Air France Bus drop off and the metro station. The real beauty is the view; you really feel that youâ€™re in a movie. And there is nothing better than taking your late evening glass of wine on the balcony looking at the Arc de Triomphe and the Parisian in the flats across the street prepare for dinner. The rooms are huge, especially compared to other Paris Hotels. Itâ€™s by far the best value in Paris in terms of location, room, service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: jrzjenn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 8 days in September 2006 with my boyfriend, we're 29 & 36. Found it to be exactly as others describle. I thought the room was great, rm 403. Big bathroom, lots of closet/drawer space, excellent a/c and 2 french doors to the balcony with view of Arc. The hotel never seemed crowded, the staff was helpful and spoke excellent English. I like that you never had to carry your key around they hold it at the front desk. We did return every night after the doors were locked and never waited more than a few minutes for them to open it for us. The hotel was very centralized, the Metro across the street is on the popular line that goes down the Champs Elysees -Louvre, very convenient. We also went to Versailles ourselves and it was about an hour total between taking 2 trains. Taxi stand was right in front of the hotel and it was never hard to get a taxi. Also we got the AirFrance shuttle "navette" (it's more like a bus) to and from the airport, 12E each way. Slightly confusing taking to the hotel, very easy taking it back. Make sure you have the hotel confirm your terminal before leaving since we got off on the wrong one and had to take another bus to the right one! We ate at the cafe La Flame around the corner for dinner/drinks on 2 occaisons, reasonable prices, great atmosphere. We also ate a fast breakfast one morning at the "Quick" fast food place 2 blocks away. We also at a few places along the Champs, Madigral and L'Alsace.... service was ok, food was mediocre, very pricey. Laduree was excellent!! We loved Barrio Latino in the Bastile area, great food and great music, dance floor was packed and fun to watch. We also liked the food court in the Lourve for a quick lunch. Le Petit Pont was a nice place to eat right across from Notre Dame, we also liked the live jazz at Le Caveau de la Hauchette. Lots of bars/cafes/nightlife on that street. We saw the Lido show and the Crazy Horse cabaret, Farooq the concierge, booked our tickets, he charged us 32E as a "fee", the seats were great and we did get free champagne at the Lido, but just be aware he has a booking fee. Both shows were great I would recommend both. We did the entire city in 8 days, there is so much to see, we walked a million miles and the weather was hot for September, 85F. Always took a nap before heading out around 9pm for dinner. It was a great trip, I did a lot of research on the hotel and was glad that the Spendid Etoile was exactly what we expected!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Papasan
Reviews.Content: The place is great! The location is ideal, and the staff must have gone to the Waldorf Astoria's hospitality school. A warm welcome and the most pleasant stay we had for the 4 days spent there.. The room was large, bath was fine, both very very clean. Only drawback to the Splendid are the elevators, which are tiny but once your bags are stashed, you are fine.. We didn't eat at their restaurant because it was a bit pricey. Would recommend you don't have a meal across the street from the hotel. Food and drink were expensive and food was terrible. Do stay here, it's lovely and I will definitely go back next trip to Paree....

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Splendid September 2006 for 3 nights. Booked direct with hotel. Before arriving emailed hotel to ask for a room with a view as it was a special occasion and our first time to Paris. They responded letting us know that a room had been allocated to us which we would like. On arrival, we arrived at 10.30am and didn't expect to be able to check in so early, however, we were greeted by Farook and given our room key by reception. Farook took our cases up to our room in a separate lift(not very big). We opened the door and walked in through the hallway/dressing area. Wow!! What a view, we had a corner room and the view was the Arc de Triomphe. Over in the distance to the right we could see the Eiffel Tower. There was again an excellent view from the bathroom and we had a balcony which we could walk right from the bathroom, past the side bedroom window and in the front window (which overlooked Avenue Carnot. The view of the Arc de Triomphe was exactly that of the brochure and seen in the website and truly is amazing. Bedroom and bathroom were both excellent, very clean and decent sizes. There was a small dressing area as you first walk in the room with wardrobe and safe, to the door in front was the bathroom, with full size bath, shower over bath, toilet and bidet. Was lovely sitting in the bath, window open listening the traffic whizz round the Arc. Toiletries supplied in bathroom and replaced when used as were the towels, although the towels do need replacing as they were quiet thin and not very luxurious for that of a 4star hotel. Large double bed in bedroom with dressing table, table and chair next to one window and tv with drinks cabinet in the corner. Also had suit stand and suitcase rack. Nicely decorated. Take time at night or in the day to sit on the balcony watching the traffic zoom round the Arc, interweving lanes and listening to the car horns beeping. Would recommend a radio in the room or at least have some music channels on the tv so you can listen French music whilst there. Internet access also available in room. There is a mini bar, but this is very expensive, do as someone else suggested and use grocers down the street and first on right for water etc. Staff were very good at all times, ordered taxis when required and were courteous and pleasant when entering/leaving hotel. If you are planning on staying out after 12pm be careful as they lock the front doors and yo have to ring the bell for the porter to let you in. We arrived back one night about 12.30 and were waiting short time to go in hotel. Had drinks one afternoon after busy day in bar but these were expensive, for a whisky and ginger and a beer it came to 18 euros. Didn't use restaurant as there were plently of wonderful places to eat but menu looked decent and it did look a nice place. Breakfast wasn't included and costs 16 euros for continental or 23euros for English so we ate this out. Couple of places in the area that we can recommend to go for dinnere are Etoile, which is a couple of blocks to the front of hotel on the corner and the Beer Station which is on the same street nearer to the hotel. Dinner at the Etoile was 32 euros for glass of tatinger, entre, main and dessert with coffee. Excellent food and very good waiters. Had booked Le Ciel De Paris for our Friday night dinner and this was an experience worth trying at least once. It's located in Tour Montparnasse which is a distance from the hotel, we took a taxi but there is a metro right outside the tower. You're taken by lift to the 56th floor in what seems like seconds and as you walk into the restaurant the view is fabulous, the Eiffel Tower is directly opposite the panoramic windows and at night Paris sparkles below with all the landmarks on show. Food was extremely good and the staff are very attentive. It's a must try for anyone. The metro station is right outside the hotel and from there you can go just about anywhere in Paris, we bought carnets of tickets which cost just over 10 euros for 10 and you use one for each journey not each line so you can get about very cheaply. The Metro is easy to use and understand and very safe. It can be tiring though going up and down the numerous steps and can be warm so take water with you to drink whilst waiting. Most stations shows how long there is to wait for next two trains which is a very good idea. We had three night in Paris and these flew by, managed to visit the Eiffel Tower(very busy), The Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Pompidou Centre, Galleries Lafeyette, Notre Dame, Hotel del Invalides, Sacre Coure and Montmarte as well as take a boat trip along the Seine and wonder briefly through St Germaine and walk the Champs Elysee. There is so much to do and you could easily fill a week, taking time to relax with a book and some wine watching the world go by. Would we return, yes, to the Hotel Splendid and Paris. Our first visit took our breath away and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrookeBD
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous booking a hotel on Travelocity since I had never been to Paris. It turned out the be better that we could have expected. We were in Paris for 4 days and loved it. I think our impression of the entire city had a lot to do with the hotel. Fantastic location - we walked everywhere, but it wasn't loud or crowded right outside the hotel. Great view - we had a corner room with a direct view of the Arc de Triomphe, just like the pictures on the internet show. The room was spacious, especially the bathroom. The staff at the front desk made us feel so welcome. They were friendly, happy to speak English, and gave great suggestions for restaurants and photo opportunities. They also kept our luggage after we checked out the last day so we could spend a few more hours enjoying the city. A few tips - take the Air France bus to and from the hotel if you are flying into the city. It was so easy, just as quick as a taxi, and it stops in front of the hotel. You can even buy tickets at the front desk. Buy some bottled water and snacks at the grocery store (we found one a block or so from the hotel). It is hard to find a cheap bite to eat when you are out touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: Kev&SP
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break at the SE and we had a great time. After booking I contacted the hotel to ask whether I could get a room with a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The reply was that it was unlikely but they would see what they could do so we were very very pleased to get rm 207 which is the corner room over looking the Arc. It is an amazing room. For Paris standards it is very big and the bathroom was fantastic but it is the view that makes it so special, espcially at night. There is no traffic noise due to the sound proofing and the air con is quiet and efficient. The staff are very helpful and although their English was perfect they were quite happy to indulge our rusty attempts to speak French. The hotel is across the road from the Metro and RER station providing easy access from the airport and the Gare de Nord. At the bottom of the hill in Ave Carnot there is an excellent patisserie which does superb coffee and croissants for a fraction of the price of the restaurants. We ate in the Beer Station restaurant which is one block away behind the Emperour Restaurant. We were so pleased with it we went back as did others. In our opinion it deserves its good review and we will stay there again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It's All True”
Reviews.Author: PaulieGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and could not have been better thanks to this establishment. The staff was incredibly accomodating, room was spacious (even the bath) and Farooq is a sweetheart. At one point, they started doing some repair work before Noon (which was not good, since we slept in everyday), but they stopped immediately when asked and even upgraded our room to a larger one with double sinks. The view of the Arc was incredible from both rooms. Amazingly convenient to the Metro, the Champs, plenty of restaurants and shopping, and there's an AirFrance shuttle stop directly across the street. Friends we met over there who were visiting for the 5th time, also loved it and said they'd be recommending it to fam and friends. What a wonderful introduction to the city of my dreams.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: JNG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the SE for a long weekend Paris getaway back in April (yes . . . April in Paris). We would have to say two thumbs up on the SE -- and would definitely stay there again. We echo most of the positive comments below. Sure, the hotel may not be the George V, and the lift is rather cozy (actually a plus if you are riding with the right person), but for a reasonable price, we had a large clean and quite comfortable room with an unbeatable view of the Arc (but had to lean slightly for the best view). As noted below, the location is fantastic. The airport bus, Metro, and RER all stop out front. Also, it is in a pleasant walking area with a relatively quiet neighborhood with shops and restaurants in one direction and the bustling Champs ElysÃ©es less than a two minute walk in the other direction. Our interaction with the staff was always favorable. My only possible complaint is that they were sometimes too helpful: when I spoke in French, they would always reply in English (that was admittedly much better than my French, although I do come to France to exercise my French). In addition to their upbeat and friendly demeanor, they were very knowledgeable about directions, dinner reservations, etc. and were able to get us into crowded restaurants with little wait (including a great table in a very good seafood place on a Friday night). The only downside regarding their info was that they tended to underestimate the time necessary to walk to some of the "nearby" recommended restaurants (still, a pleasant walk . . . after all, it was Paris in April). We'll be back! jgeracimos@yahoo.com Alexandria, VA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: leeamm
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with a real Parisian feel, look no further! We booked the Splendid Etoile by the positive reviews on Trip Advisor months ago for our 30th wedding anniversary getaway and it ended up being exactly what we wanted. Our room was #207 and it was perfect. Having a corner room wrap around balcony, with three floor to ceiling french doors - one in the bath and two in the bedroom/sitting area. French furnishings, a crystal chandelier and a large marble bathroom. A flat screen tv too! not that you will be watching much tv but a daily news report in English was nice to keep in touch with the world even while on vacation. This was our first trip to Paris and we wanted a hotel that was quaint, French, accommodating, clean, convenient to the Metro/transportation and near the Champs Elysees for evening walks. The Splendid fit all of our needs. The location was a few blocks from the Champs but was surprisingly quiet even with the french doors opened. The location is near many restaurants, cafes, bars, bakeries, wine shops, etc. Also the CDG/Air France bus stops on the opposite corner so getting to and from the airport is a breeze and less expensive than taking a cab. Buy the round trip ticket for the bus for a good deal. The Metro stop was right outside the door of the hotel and we used only the Metro for getting around the city. We also booked a couple of excursions thru a travel company that picked us up by minivan at the door of the Splendid Etoile as well. Walking to the Champs Elysees a few evenings for dinner and people watching was very nice and a lovely stroll among the neighborhood getting there. The staff--especially Farooq-- was the best. Always greeted us and spoke perfect English, thank goodness, since our French consisted of only a few words and phrases. Farooq was very knowledgable and more than accommodating about any questions we had, going over and above aiding us with helpful hints, good suggestions and general French info. He is by far the best concierge we have ever used! The rest of the staff were also very pleasant and helpful. The room we booked was a superior and very spacious, clean, with a french style decor-- silk wall coverings, draperies, furnishings, and the balcony with a wonderful view of the Arc d' Triomphe!!!! We never had breakfast or dinner at the hotel so we can not comment on the dining experience at the hotel. But right across the street is a nice restaurant " L'Emporieur" that had a delicious menu. We never had a bad meal there.........ate a few breakfasts and dinners there. Authentic french fare........duck, chicken with mustard sauce, jambon and fromage sandwiches, omelets, chocolate crescents........And the best steak, potatoes and dessert we had in the city all week was at this little cafe! And that is saying a lot since we didnt have a bad meal all week no matter where we happened to eat.....from the bakeries, street fare, bistros or expensive restaurants......... So you dont have to walk all over the city looking for a good place to dine every night when L'Emporieur is so close by. And the staff there are very nice too! We highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Advice and Service”
Reviews.Author: viajeromex
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the hotel splendid etoile in paris this august with my two teen age daughters, the hotel was not what we expected or what we had seen on their website, i guess professional photographers do miracles but the room was nice and comfortable for the time we spent in it, the restaurant and bar were closed, something very odd for us since i chose it for having those amenities, we had to eat out all the time and being in Paris walking all the time sometimes is nice to have dinner and a glass of wine at your hotel before going to rest. The highlight of our stay was their staff, especially the chief concierge Farooq, He is a person that you can rely on for all your needs and he will always be happy and most important sincere to do it, You can always tell when somebody is doing something because they have to not because they want to, this is not the case with Farooq. We had some problem with our train tickets for talking to the "wrong people" at the train office and he helped us all thru the ordeal until we had the problem solved, always being so positive we will never forget, when we go back to Paris we will try to stay at the Splendid not for the facilities or location but for the great staff they have. Sincerely Roberto Ortiz San Diego California U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next stay”
Reviews.Author: GMAMPM
Reviews.Content: We based our stay on many of the good reviews the hotel received on this site. To say we were not disappointed is an understatement. Our experience was fantastic. We had no complaints, period. None. Our room was marvelous, the service was genuinely friendly yet unobtrusive and the location was perfect. We chose the latter based on having stayed in the 17th before, and because the hotel is so centrally located. The CDG-Etoile Metro station is across the street (and there's an elevator right out front), as is the Air France drop-off. One block to the east on Rue de Tilsitt is a little place called the Beer Station, which has great food. One block farther east, on Avenue Wagram, is La Croissanterie, which is the place to go for breakfast (gourmet pastries, delicious coffee, at fast-food prices). And you're one block from the Arc de Triomphe, which we got so used to seeing out our room's window that we started not to notice after a while. (!) The CDG Metro station gets you anywhere you want to go, either directly or with, at most, one transfer. It's a long walk to the Eiffel Tower, and a long walk down the Champs to the Louvre, so don't expect to roll out of bed and be there. But that's not what the 17th is about, anyway. It's about quiet. And our room was quiet. Even though we were on the 2nd floor, we heard nothing because of the pair of double-double doors that shut out all noise. Not that we kept them shut all the time, because our room (207) had a wonderful wrap-around balcony (one of only two in the hotel). One set of doors looked out at the Arc, which was nice. The room was surprisingly large by Paris standards. The adjacent room is of the same class, but not as large. Room 207 is considered the second-best room in the hotel (aside from the suite on top) because of its size and because it has the huge balcony. Our room came wonderfully appointed with matching curtains/furniture coverings/bedspread (the latter of which they were nice enough to take off after the first day; we didn't need it) and a nice sitting area. The ceilings were nice and tall, so the twin doors let in a lot of light. The bathroom was also well-appointed, with nice fixtures, a wall safe, and two mirrors. The shower is a typical European shower, with one glass half-door and a high step-in. If you haven't used one before, you'll probably freak, at least initially. It's no big deal. We can't say enough about the staff. They were so overwhelmingly helpful with our questions. We tried to speak as much French as we knew, but they all knew perfect English and usually helped us out of our verbal assault on their language. (One aside: There was a guest who, when asking questions in English only, was somewhat rude. He didn't receive the same treatment in return, although had we been on staff, he would have.) With La Croissanterie two really short blocks away, there's no need to eat in the hotel. Their breakfast is 16 euros which, like most Paris hotel breakfasts, no matter how good, invites you to take a morning stroll. One surprising note: We didn't buy a phone card this time, so we used the hotel phone. Expecting to be gouged, we weren't at all. The most expensive call to the states was under 2 euros, as opposed to an 18-pound call from a hotel in Britain! We are already planning a return stay for our daughter's high school graduation present!

Reviews.Title: “So sorry, but can't recommend to friends and family”
Reviews.Author: Kenya2010
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Splendid Etoile in the late July. We chose this hotel based upon its fabulous location, and the positive TA reviews. Reservations were made on line, with hotel staff, who were very acommodating and pleasant via email. Our request for a room with a view of the Arc was granted, and we were given a lovely corner room with an updated marble bathroom. The hotel is rather plain and charmless, but the rooms are well-soundproofed and pretty, the location is fantastic and we were quite comfortable throughout our stay. Sadly, I cannot recommend the hotel, though. The front desk staff are not uniformly pleasant and helpful. I speak some high school/college french, and they all speak excellent english, so it was certainly not a language issue. We would have been happy to recommend the hotel, were it not for one extremely unpleasant incident. The airconditioning system in our room was not functioning properly, and we were startled to find one afternoon, a sopping wet rug beneath the ceiling unit -- apparently from dripping condensation. The moisture was so great that the unit also dripped water in to the adjacent closet where my husbands clothes were stacked on the shelf. His clothes were soaked. A poorly functioning airconditioner is certainly not reason to be unhappy with the hotel, but what happened next is. My husband took his wet clothes down to the front desk to explain the situation. He requested that the clothes be cleaned, and that someone come look at the unit. A very nice young man saw the soaked carpet, and sent a repairman shortly thereafter. As it was a Sunday, the repairman was not a professional, and did nothing to repair the unit. The next Monday, while breakfasting downstairs, the day manager approached us at our table. She told us that according to the repairman, there was nothing wrong with the airconditioning unit, and that if we wanted our clothes cleaned, we would have to pay for it. My husband and I were flabbergasted. We are very honest people, and would never THINK of creating such an elaborate scam to get clothes cleaned. I took the manager up to our room, where she saw the wet rug and visible water drips on the wall. This was her opportunity to offer up a heartfelt apology, but it never came. She insisted that it was reasonable policy to assume the worst of the guests (after all, just that morning, some guests had run off with 80 euros of mini-bar). She explained to me that, "You would be surprised at the things people will do to get their laundry done." I found this behavior unprofessional and simply, unkind. Call me naive, but I thought people went in to the hospitality business because they genuinely like serving the public. This particular manager seemed not to like her job, let alone people. Although I can't recommend the hotel for the above reason, it has its strong points. If you do stay there, don't expect pleasant, professional treatment from all the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSteve
Reviews.Content: On vacation with two teen-age daughters. Chose this hotel based on prior ratings on this site. Superior hotel, maybe a little pricey but for Paris, and the location, a good value. We could see the Arc de Triomphe from our room, maybe 100 yards away. Metro station just across the street. Exceptional room. Great bathroom. Good breakfast. Had more of a corporate feel, vs. a family owned feel, but given the price, that is a reasonable feeling. Helpful staff. Worthy of high ratings. Probably my daughters' favorite hotel on our trip. Fully recommended.
